original: de ni sbyor ba po ma yin pa'i phyir las kyi lam dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba po ma yin pa'i phyir las kyi lam dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that one who is not the agent possesses the path of action.

original: gang dmag gis gdab pa dang / lings 'debs pa dang / ma 'khrigs par gdab ba dag tu pha rol po gsad par bya ba'i phyir mang po tshogs pas btab la /
analyzed: gang dmag gis gdab pa dang / lings 'debs pa dang / ma 'khrigs par gdab ba dag tu pha rol po gsad par bya ba'i phyir mang po tshogs pas btab la /
translated: When many people gather to kill an enemy in battle, in a surprise attack, or in a just war,

original: gcig gcig gis srog gcod na de dang su zhig ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig gcig gis srog gcod na de dang su zhig ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if one person kills him, with whom is the path of action associated?

original: dmag la sogs pa don gcig phyir //
analyzed: dmag la sogs pa don gcig phyir //
translated: Because they have the same object,

original: thams cad byed pa po bzhin ldan //
analyzed: thams cad byed pa po bzhin ldan //
translated: all are as if they were the actual perpetrators.

original: don gcig pa'i phyir thams cad byed pa po ji lta ba bzhin du ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gcig pa'i phyir thams cad byed pa po ji lta ba bzhin du ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they have the same object, all are as if they were the actual perpetrators.

original: de dag ni don gyis na /
analyzed: de dag ni don gyis na /
translated: In fact,

original: phan tshun du sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun du sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: they mutually assist each other.

original: yang srog gcod pa'i mtshan nyid nas log par lta ba'i bar gyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na //
analyzed: yang srog gcod pa'i mtshan nyid nas log par lta ba'i bar gyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na //
translated: What are the characteristics of the actions from taking life up to wrong views?

original: srog gcod pa ni bsams bzhin du ma nor bar ni gzhan bsad pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni bsams bzhin du ma nor bar ni gzhan bsad pa'o //
translated: Taking life is intentionally killing another without error.

original: @158a * // gal te 'di bsad do snyam du bsams nas gsod par byed la /
analyzed: @158a * // gal te 'di bsad do snyam du bsams nas gsod par byed la /
translated: If one thinks, “I will kill this person,” and if one kills him,

original: gzhan dang ma nor bar de nyid gsod par byed na de tsam gyis srog gcod pa yin no //🔽ma byin len pa gzhan gyi nor //
analyzed: gzhan dang ma nor bar de nyid gsod par byed na de tsam gyis srog gcod pa yin no // ma byin len pa gzhan gyi nor //
translated: and if there is no error with regard to the victim, then by this alone there is killing.

original: mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir byed //
analyzed: mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir byed //
translated: Stealing is the appropriating of the property of another by force or in secret.

original: gal te gzhan gyi bdag gir byas pa la mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir byed cing /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi bdag gir byas pa la mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir byed cing /
translated: If one appropriates the property of another by force or in secret,

original: gang mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir bya bar bsams pa de las gzhan du 'du shes kyang ma 'khrul na de tsam gyis ma byin par len pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mthu dang 'jab bus bdag gir bya bar bsams pa de las gzhan du 'du shes kyang ma 'khrul na de tsam gyis ma byin par len pa yin no //
translated: and if there is no error with regard to the person whose property is taken and the nature of the property as it is intended to be, then by this alone there is stealing.

original: bgrod min bgrod par 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: bgrod min bgrod par 'dod pa yis //
translated: Sexual misconduct is the improper performance of sexual intercourse.🔽It is of four types:

original: log par g-yem pa rnam pa bzhi //🔽bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'gro ba bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'am /
analyzed: log par g-yem pa rnam pa bzhi // bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'gro ba bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'am /
translated: 1. Improper place: a place belonging to others,🔽such as a monastery, or a place not fit for sexual intercourse, such as a place where there is an image of the Buddha.

original: ma'am bu mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma'am bu mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: 2. Improper time: when the woman is pregnant or is nursing, or when she has taken a vow, or when she is observing a fasting period.

original: yan lag ma yin par 'gro ba skye gnas ma yin par ro //
analyzed: yan lag ma yin par 'gro ba skye gnas ma yin par ro //
translated: 3. Improper organ: any orifice other than the vagina.🔽4. Improper partner: one’s own wife or another’s wife, if the wife is of one’s own caste.

original: yul ma yin par 'gro ba snang ba'am mchod rten la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ma yin par 'gro ba snang ba'am mchod rten la sogs pa'o //
translated: Going to a place where one should not go is to go to a place where there is a stupa, etc.

original: dus ma yin par 'gro ba sbrum ma 'am byis pa gso ba dang / nges pa dang bcas pa'i gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'gro ba sbrum ma 'am byis pa gso ba dang / nges pa dang bcas pa'i gan du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Going at a time when one should not go is to go to a woman who is pregnant, who is nursing an infant, who has taken a vow, who is observing a purificatory fast, etc.🔽Lying is to utter a speech

original: brdzun tshig 'du shes gzhan bsgyur ba'i //
analyzed: brdzun tshig 'du shes gzhan bsgyur ba'i //
translated: that differs from what one intends,

original: tshig don mngon par go ba'o //🔽don smra ba gang yin pa de las 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur la /
analyzed: tshig don mngon par go ba'o // don smra ba gang yin pa de las 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur la /
translated: when the meaning is understood.

original: des gang gi dbang du byas nas smras pa'i tshig de'i don yang go na tshig de'i brdzun du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: des gang gi dbang du byas nas smras pa'i tshig de'i don yang go na tshig de'i brdzun du smra ba yin no //
translated: When one speaks with a meaning that differs from what one intends, and when the meaning is understood by the one to whom one speaks, one commits lying.

original: mdo las tha dad bcu drug gsungs pa de ni ma mthong ba la mthong zhes smra ba nas mi shes par shes so zhes pa'i bar la sogs pa'o //🔽mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las tha dad bcu drug gsungs pa de ni ma mthong ba la mthong zhes smra ba nas mi shes par shes so zhes pa'i bar la sogs pa'o // mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: The Sūtra teaches sixteen types of lying:🔽What are seeing, hearing, discerning, and knowing?🔽The three consciousnesses and mental consciousness

original: mig rna yid kyi rnam shes dang / gsum gyis nyams su myong gang de //
analyzed: mig rna yid kyi rnam shes dang / gsum gyis nyams su myong gang de //
translated: are the characteristics of seeing, hearing, discerning, and knowing.

original: mthong thos rnam par shes pa dang // rtogs pa yin te rim bzhin bshad //🔽mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba de ni mthong ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni thos pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang /
analyzed: mthong thos rnam par shes pa dang // rtogs pa yin te rim bzhin bshad // mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba de ni mthong ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni thos pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas myong ba de ni rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang /
translated: It is seeing, hearing, cognition, and understanding, as explained.

original: lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pas myong ba ni rtogs pa zhes bshad do //🔽phra ma pha rol dbye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pas myong ba ni rtogs pa zhes bshad do // phra ma pha rol dbye ba'i phyir //
translated: What is experienced by visual consciousness is seeing; what is experienced by auditory consciousness is hearing; what is experienced by mental consciousness is understanding; what is experienced by olfactory, gustatory, and tactile consciousness is cognition.🔽Malicious speech is speech that causes division among the sentient beings who are its object, with a defiled mind.

original: nyon mongs can gyi sems kyi tshig / pha rol dbye zhing mi mdza' bar bya ba'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig ni phra ma ste /🔽don @158b mngon par go ba dang / ma nor ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi sems kyi tshig / pha rol dbye zhing mi mdza' bar bya ba'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig ni phra ma ste / don @158b mngon par go ba dang / ma nor ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is speech that causes division among sentient beings who are its object, with a defiled mind.

original: tshig rtsub po ni mi snyan pa /🔽sems nyan mongs pa can gyi tshig ces pa dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po ni mi snyan pa /🔽sems nyan mongs pa can gyi tshig ces pa dang yang sbyar te /
translated: Rough speech is defiled speech that is unpleasant.🔽It is defiled speech that is unpleasant.🔽It is defiled speech that is unpleasant.

original: sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig mi snyan pa pha rol po la smras shing don mngon par go la /
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig mi snyan pa pha rol po la smras shing don mngon par go la /
translated: Harsh speech is offensive speech.

original: gang la smra bar 'dod pa de nyid la smras pa gang yin pa de ni tshig rtsub po yin no //🔽nyon mongs can kun kyal pa nyid //
analyzed: gang la smra bar 'dod pa de nyid la smras pa gang yin pa de ni tshig rtsub po yin no // nyon mongs can kun kyal pa nyid //
translated: Harsh speech is offensive speech, that is, speech that is unpleasant and understood as such by the person to whom it is addressed.🔽All defiled speech is idle speech.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig thams cad ni tshig kyal pa yin no //🔽gzhan ni de las gzhan nyon mongs //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig thams cad ni tshig kyal pa yin no // gzhan ni de las gzhan nyon mongs //
translated: All defiled speech is idle speech.🔽Other defiled speech is idle speech.

original: gzhan dag na re ngag gi las brdzun gyi tshig smra ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa nyon mongs can gyi tshig gang yin pa de ni tshig kyal pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ngag gi las brdzun gyi tshig smra ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa nyon mongs can gyi tshig gang yin pa de ni tshig kyal pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Other masters say: All defiled speech, with the exception of lying, etc., is idle speech.

original: kha gsag glu dang zlos gar bzhin //
analyzed: kha gsag glu dang zlos gar bzhin //
translated: It is like flattery, singing, and acting.

original: bstan bcos ngan bzhin /
analyzed: bstan bcos ngan bzhin /
translated: It is like bad treatises.

original: dper na dge slong log pas 'tsho ba kha gsag byed pa dang / chags pas kha cig glu len pa dang / zlos gar mkhan rnams zlos gar gyi tshe gzhan dag mgu bar bya ba'i phyir 'khyal pa dang / de'i lta bar gyur nas bstan bcos ngan pa dag 'don pa dang /
analyzed: dper na dge slong log pas 'tsho ba kha gsag byed pa dang / chags pas kha cig glu len pa dang / zlos gar mkhan rnams zlos gar gyi tshe gzhan dag mgu bar bya ba'i phyir 'khyal pa dang / de'i lta bar gyur nas bstan bcos ngan pa dag 'don pa dang /
translated: For example, a monk who lives a false life of purity, a singer who sings out of attachment, actors who chatter in order to please others when they are acting, and those who recite bad treatises because they have fallen into their views.

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa can gyi ngag gi las gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa can gyi ngag gi las gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, any afflicted verbal action that is not lying is idle chatter.

original: brnab sems ni /
analyzed: brnab sems ni /
translated: Covetousness is

original: log pas gzhan gyi nor la chags //
analyzed: log pas gzhan gyi nor la chags //
translated: wrongly desiring the wealth of others.🔽Covetousness is the desire to make someone else's property one's own by force or stealth, thinking, How nice if what belongs to another were mine.

original: pha rol po dag gi gang yin pa bdag gi yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam nas gzhan gyi nor dag la mthu'am 'jab bu yang rung log pa mi rigs pas bdag gir byed par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni brnab sems so //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gang yin pa bdag gi yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam nas gzhan gyi nor dag la mthu'am 'jab bu yang rung log pa mi rigs pas bdag gir byed par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni brnab sems so //
translated: Malice is

original: gnod sems sems can la sdang ba //
analyzed: gnod sems sems can la sdang ba //
translated: hatred toward sentient beings.

original: pha rol la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o ;
analyzed: pha rol la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o ;
translated: It is the desire to harm others.

original: / dge dang mi dge med lta ba //
analyzed: / dge dang mi dge med lta ba //
translated: The view that there is no virtue or vice

original: log par lta ba yin /
analyzed: log par lta ba yin /
translated: is wrong view.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba med do zhes lta ba de ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba med do zhes lta ba de ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: The view that there is no virtue or vice is wrong view.

original: las kyi lam bcur bshad pa'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba'i don ni ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi lam bcur bshad pa'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba'i don ni ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term karmapatha, “path of action,” as it is explained in the ten paths of action?

original: 'di la / gsum lam bdun ni las kyang yin //
analyzed: 'di la / gsum lam bdun ni las kyang yin //
translated: Three are paths of action; seven are action.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa 'jug pa'i las kyi lam yin pas las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa 'jug pa'i las kyi lam yin pas las kyi lam mo //
translated: Covetousness and the others are paths of action because they are the paths of action that are instigated.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni las kyang yin las kyi lam yang yin pa las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni las kyang yin las kyi lam yang yin pa las kyi lam mo //
translated: The seven, beginning with killing, are both action and paths of action.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad dge ba'i chos rnams kun du spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin @159a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad dge ba'i chos rnams kun du spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin @159a * //
translated: All ten of these unwholesome paths of action are incompatible with the practice of wholesome actions.

original: la ; med par lta bas rtsa ba gcod //
analyzed: la ; med par lta bas rtsa ba gcod //
translated: They are severed by the view of nonexistence.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pas so //
translated: Severing the wholesome roots is done by the great, fully developed wrong view.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhig gcod ce na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhig gcod ce na /
translated: What wholesome roots are severed?

original: 'dod gtogs skyes nas thob pa rnams //
analyzed: 'dod gtogs skyes nas thob pa rnams //
translated: Those who are born in the realm of desire and obtain the wholesome roots through birth lose them through the severing of the wholesome roots.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gcod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gcod de /
translated: Those who are born in the realm of desire and obtain the wholesome roots through birth lose them through the severing of the wholesome roots.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those who are born in the realm of form and the formless realm, the wholesome roots are not severed, because they are not associated with the realm of desire.

original: skyes nas 'thob pa dag kho na kun du 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes nas 'thob pa dag kho na kun du 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Only those who obtain the wholesome roots through birth sever them,

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dag ni sngar yongs su nyams zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dag ni sngar yongs su nyams zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who obtain them through practice have already lost them previously.

original: ci la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas kun du gcod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas kun du gcod par byed ce na /
translated: Through what object does wrong view sever the wholesome roots?

original: rgyu dang 'bras la skur ba 'debs pas ;
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras la skur ba 'debs pas ;
translated: Through denying cause and effect.🔽There are those who deny cause, saying:

original: / legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: / legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good action,🔽There is no bad action.🔽And there are those who deny effect, saying:

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa gang dag yin pa dang / legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa gang dag yin pa dang / legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: There is no ripening of the results of good or bad action.

original: de la yang zag pa dang bcas pa kho nas zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de la yang zag pa dang bcas pa kho nas zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say: Only those that are impure sever the wholesome roots.

original: 'di skad du brjod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod de /
translated: But this is said:

original: kun gyis / gtan nas cig car gcod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun gyis / gtan nas cig car gcod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that all of them are cut off at one and the same time.

original: rim gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du chen po'i chen pos chung ngu'i chung ngu gcod par byed pa'i bar du log par lta ba dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu gcod par byed do //
analyzed: rim gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du chen po'i chen pos chung ngu'i chung ngu gcod par byed pa'i bar du log par lta ba dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu gcod par byed do //
translated: The roots of the wholesome are cut off by nine false views, from the weakest of the weak to the strongest of the strong, in the same way that the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation are abandoned.

original: gang du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du gcod ce na /
analyzed: gang du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du gcod ce na /
translated: Where are the roots of the wholesome cut off?

original: mi'i nang du /
analyzed: mi'i nang du /
translated: Among humans.

original: ngan song dag na ni ma yin te /🔽shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song dag na ni ma yin te / shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not in the unfortunate planes of existence, for the wholesome is obscured there by the defilements.

original: lha dag gi nang na yang med de /
analyzed: lha dag gi nang na yang med de /
translated: Not among the gods, for the wholesome is not obscured there by the defilements.

original: las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽gling gsum dag na yod kyi byang gi sgra mi snyan na med de /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro // gling gsum dag na yod kyi byang gi sgra mi snyan na med de /

original: skyes pa bud med kyis gcod do //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med kyis gcod do //
translated: The wholesome is obscured by the defilements in the realm of desire.🔽The wholesome is obscured by the defilements in the realm of desire.

original: de dag las kyang /
analyzed: de dag las kyang /
translated: The wholesome is obscured by

original: lta spyad sdig pa'i bsam pa bstan pa dang / mkhyud pa can yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: lta spyad sdig pa'i bsam pa bstan pa dang / mkhyud pa can yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The person whose wholesome roots are severed is one who is endowed with the view of nihilism, who has abandoned the wholesome roots by the power of wrong views, who has cut off the wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /

original: de ni mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mi ldan pa'o //
translated: He is not endowed with them.🔽When the acquisition of the wholesome roots is cut off and does not arise again, and when non-endowment arises, then the wholesome roots are said to be severed.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thob pa chad de yang mi skye la mi ldan pa de skyes na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du chad pa zhes bya'o //🔽kun du chad pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thob pa chad de yang mi skye la mi ldan pa de skyes na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du chad pa zhes bya'o // kun du chad pa de dag kyang /
translated: The severed wholesome roots

original: mtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas /🔽@159b nam zhig la rgyu dang 'bras bu la the tshom skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas / @159b nam zhig la rgyu dang 'bras bu la the tshom skyes pa'am /
translated: are reconnected through doubt and view.

original: yod par lta ba de'i tshe yang de'i thob pa kun du skyes pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par lta ba de'i tshe yang de'i thob pa kun du skyes pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When doubt arises with regard to cause and effect, or when the view of existence arises, then the wholesome roots are reconnected because the acquisition of the wholesome roots is produced.

original: yang de dag gi nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: yang de dag gi nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: The reconnection of the wholesome roots

original: mtshams med byed pa'i 'di la min //
analyzed: mtshams med byed pa'i 'di la min //
translated: does not occur for one who has committed the actions with indicated effects.

original: gzhan gyi 'di nyid la 'gyur gyi mtshams med pa byed pa ni dmyal bar skye ba'am 'chi 'pho bar nying mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'di nyid la 'gyur gyi mtshams med pa byed pa ni dmyal bar skye ba'am 'chi 'pho bar nying mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: But if one commits heinous acts against this very person, one is born in hell or one links with death and then rebirth.

original: 'di ni las kyi lam gyi skabs yin pas de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi lam gyi skabs yin pas de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since this is the section on the karmic path, we will now discuss how many karmic paths arise simultaneously with intention.🔽Up to eight nonvirtuous actions

original: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa cig car lhan cig 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa cig car lhan cig 'byung //
translated: arise simultaneously with intention.

original: re zhig sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir sems pa nyon mongs pa ma yin pa de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig mthar phyin par byed na'o //
analyzed: re zhig sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir sems pa nyon mongs pa ma yin pa de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig mthar phyin par byed na'o //
translated: First, up to eight nonvirtuous actions arise simultaneously with one instance of intention. If one who is not afflicted by affliction such as covetousness and so on, through the preparation of that intention, completes any of the physical karmas.

original: gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems su gyur pas srog gcod na'o //
analyzed: gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems su gyur pas srog gcod na'o //
translated: Two arise simultaneously with intention if one kills with malice.

original: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems su gyur pas gzhan gyi srog chags gsad pas 'phrog na'o //
analyzed: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems su gyur pas gzhan gyi srog chags gsad pas 'phrog na'o //
translated: When one takes life with the intention of killing another, and when this action is completed, then it is simultaneous with three courses of action: taking what is not given, when one takes the goods of another through stealing;🔽sexual misconduct, when one has recourse to the wife of another; lying, when one utters, with the required thought, words that differ from the sense one intends to express;🔽malicious speech, when one utters words that divide the community;

original: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dbyen bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas brdzun gyi tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra na ste /🔽de la yid kyi gcig yin ngag gi gsum yin no //
analyzed: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dbyen bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas brdzun gyi tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra na ste / de la yid kyi gcig yin ngag gi gsum yin no //
translated: or harsh speech, when one utters words that wound.

original: yang na brnab sems la sogs par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum mthar phyin par byed na ste /
analyzed: yang na brnab sems la sogs par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum mthar phyin par byed na ste /
translated: When one commits one of the courses of action of covetousness, etc., and when, through the preparatory action of these courses of action, one accomplishes the three other courses of action, then it is simultaneous with four courses of action.

original: lnga dang drug dang bdun dang yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni drug la sbyor ba byas nas /
analyzed: lnga dang drug dang bdun dang yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni drug la sbyor ba byas nas /
translated: One should explain in the same way the simultaneous accomplishment of five, six, or seven courses of action.🔽When one has recourse to the six courses of action, and when one accomplishes adultery by oneself, then it is simultaneous with eight courses of action.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa bdag nyid kyis byed la mnyam du mthar phyin par gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa bdag nyid kyis byed la mnyam du mthar phyin par gyur na'o //
translated: When one has recourse to the six courses of action, and when one accomplishes lying by oneself, then it is simultaneous with nine courses of action.

original: re zhig mi dge ba dang ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba dang ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is how the courses of action are accomplished simultaneously with the courses of action.🔽The courses of action are not accomplished simultaneously with the preparatory actions and the consecutive action.

original: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang min //
analyzed: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang min //
translated: The courses of action are not accomplished simultaneously with one, eight, or five courses of action.

original: de la gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa dang ngo //
analyzed: de la gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa dang ngo //
translated: Two together with that means that when abiding in the five virtuous consciousnesses,

original: gsum dang ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa na'o //
analyzed: gsum dang ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa na'o //
translated: three together with that means when possessing mental consciousness concomitant with right view.

original: bzhi dang ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge bsnyen dang dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
analyzed: bzhi dang ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge bsnyen dang dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
translated: Four together with that means when possessing nonvirtuous or neutral minds, taking up the vows of a layperson or novice monk.

original: drug dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pas de yang dag par @160a * //
analyzed: drug dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pas de yang dag par @160a * //
translated: Six together with that means when abiding in the five virtuous consciousnesses, taking up those vows.

original: len na'o // bdun dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas de kho na yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: len na'o // bdun dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas de kho na yang dag par len na'o //
translated: Seven together with that means when possessing virtuous mental consciousness, taking up those vows.

original: dgu dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pas dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: dgu dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pas dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
translated: Nine together with that means when abiding in the five virtuous consciousnesses, taking up the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: bcu dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pas de kho na yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: bcu dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pas de kho na yang dag par len na'o //
translated: Ten together with that means when abiding in virtuous mental consciousness, taking up those vows.

original: 'gro ba gang na dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang na dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
translated: In what realms are the paths of action, wholesome or unwholesome, present?🔽In the hells, there are two types of idle chatter,

original: dmyal ba na ni kyal pa dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: dmyal ba na ni kyal pa dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
translated: and also two types of harsh speech and malice.

original: smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir tshig kyal pa yin no ;🔽/ phan tshun brgyad bkag byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub po yin no //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir tshig kyal pa yin no ; / phan tshun brgyad bkag byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub po yin no //
translated: Because they lament, there is idle chatter.🔽Because they mutually obstruct each other, there is harsh speech.

original: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir gnod sems yin no //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir gnod sems yin no //
translated: Because they hate each other with a harsh mindstream, there is malice.

original: brnab sems log lta ldan pas so //
analyzed: brnab sems log lta ldan pas so //
translated: There is covetousness and false view.

original: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: There is no idle chatter that is present there, because there is no object of attachment and because the effect of action is directly perceived.

original: las kyi lam gzhan dag ni gnyis ka yang med do //
analyzed: las kyi lam gzhan dag ni gnyis ka yang med do //
translated: The other paths of action are not present there in either way.

original: sgra mi snyan na gsum yod de /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan na gsum yod de /
translated: In Uttarakuru, there are three:

original: yid kyi gsum ni ldan pa'i sgo nas sbyar gyi nga yir 'dzin pa dang / kun nas brnar sems pa'i dngos po med pa dang / sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi gsum ni ldan pa'i sgo nas sbyar gyi nga yir 'dzin pa dang / kun nas brnar sems pa'i dngos po med pa dang / sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three mental actions exist there by possession, but not by practice, because there is no appropriation of them as mine, because there is no real intention to deceive, and because there is no intention to do evil.

original: de ni bdun pa dngos su yang //
analyzed: de ni bdun pa dngos su yang //
translated: The seventh exists there in fact.

original: de na tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
analyzed: de na tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
translated: There idle speech exists in fact, because the gods quarrel and there is the laughter of Mara.

original: gzhan dag rnam pa gnyis ka yang med do //🔽'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam pa gnyis ka yang med do // 'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu //
translated: The other two do not exist there.🔽The ten paths of nonvirtuous action exist in the desire realm.

original: dmyal ba dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu rnam pa gnyis ka yod do //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu rnam pa gnyis ka yod do //
translated: The ten paths of nonvirtuous action exist in the desire realm in two ways, except in the hells and in Uttarakuru.

original: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The virtuous actions have been explained.

original: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na //
analyzed: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na //
translated: The three virtuous actions exist everywhere.

original: rnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas //
analyzed: rnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas //
translated: They exist in the three realms by both possession and manifestation.

original: khams gsum thams cad la yid kyi gsum rnam pa gnyis ka yang yod do //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad la yid kyi gsum rnam pa gnyis ka yang yod do //
translated: The three mental actions exist in all three realms in both ways.

original: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can //
analyzed: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can //
translated: The three virtuous actions exist in the formless realm by possession alone.

original: rnyed pas bdun yod //
analyzed: rnyed pas bdun yod //
translated: The seven exist by acquisition.

original: gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag ni lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun ldan pa'i sgo kho na nas yod do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag ni lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun ldan pa'i sgo kho na nas yod do //
translated: Beings in the formless realm and beings in the meditative attainment of nonperception possess the seven virtuous paths of action of body and speech, but not the others.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das @160b pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das @160b pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noble beings born in the formless realm possess past and future uncontaminated vows. Beings in the meditative attainment of nonperception possess the meditative vows.

original: lhag byas na /🔽mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang //
analyzed: lhag byas na / mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang //
translated: If one adds the manifest,🔽then they exist in the other realms and reincarnating beings,

original: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
analyzed: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
translated: except for hell beings and beings of the northern continent.

original: lhag mar byas pa'i khams sam 'gro ba gzhan gang yin pa de la dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag ma gtogs pa dge ba bdun po dag mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
analyzed: lhag mar byas pa'i khams sam 'gro ba gzhan gang yin pa de la dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag ma gtogs pa dge ba bdun po dag mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
translated: If one adds the manifest, then the seven virtuous paths of action exist in the other realms and reincarnating beings, except for hell beings and beings of the northern continent Uttarakuru.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These ten virtuous and nonvirtuous paths of action

original: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod //
translated: All are considered to give a dominant result and a result that is a similar species.

original: re zhig mi dge ba thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dmyal bar skye ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dmyal bar skye ba'o //
translated: The ripened result of all nonvirtuous actions is birth in a miserable realm.

original: mi rnams su srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni tshe thung ba'o //
analyzed: mi rnams su srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni tshe thung ba'o //
translated: The dominant result of killing is a short life.

original: ma byin par len pa ni longs spyod kyis phongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ni longs spyod kyis phongs pa'o //
translated: The dominant result of stealing is lack of resources.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du'o //
translated: The dominant result of sexual misconduct is having enemies and a spouse who is unfaithful.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni skur pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni skur pa mang ba'o //
translated: The dominant result of lying is being slandered.

original: phra mas ni mdza' bo dbye'o //🔽tshig rtsub po ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos so //
analyzed: phra mas ni mdza' bo dbye'o // tshig rtsub po ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos so //
translated: The dominant result of divisive speech is the breakup of friendships.🔽The dominant result of harsh speech is hearing unpleasant sounds.

original: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os pa'o //🔽brnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags che bar ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os pa'o // brnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags che bar ro //
translated: The dominant result of idle speech is being ignored.🔽The dominant result of covetousness is strong desire.

original: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang che bar ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang che bar ro //
translated: The dominant result of ill will is strong anger.

original: log par lta bas ni gti mug che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta bas ni gti mug che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The dominant result of wrong views is strong delusion.

original: srog gcod pa'i bdag po'i 'bras bu ni phyi'i dngos po rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang char pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i bdag po'i 'bras bu ni phyi'i dngos po rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur ro // ma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang char pa mang bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rdul gyis 'khrigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rdul gyis 'khrigs pa'o //
translated: By sexual misconduct, dust storms are frequent.

original: brdzun du smra bas ni dring  bar ro //🔽phra mas ni mtho dman can du'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas ni dring  bar ro // phra mas ni mtho dman can du'o //
translated: By lying, the ground is uneven.🔽By divisive speech, the land is high and low.

original: tshig rtsub pos ni tsha sgo can dang / dgon dung can du'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub pos ni tsha sgo can dang / dgon dung can du'o //
translated: By harsh speech, the land is salty and has few trees.

original: tshig kyal pas ni dus log pa can du'o //🔽brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal pas ni dus log pa can du'o // brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor ro //
translated: By idle chat, the seasons are reversed.🔽By covetousness, the fruits are small.

original: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar ro //
translated: By malice, the fruits are bitter.

original: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung ngu'am med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung ngu'am med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By wrong views, the fruits are few or nonexistent.🔽This is also stated:🔽The three results are suffering,

original: 'di yang / sdug bsngal phyir dang bsang  phyir dang // gzi byin med phyir 'bras rnam gsum //
analyzed: 'di yang / sdug bsngal phyir dang bsang  phyir dang // gzi byin med phyir 'bras rnam gsum //

original: srog gcod par byed pas ni gsad par bya ba sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / srog dang bral bas bsad pa dang / gzi byin med par byas pa yin te /🔽de'i de @161a * //
analyzed: srog gcod par byed pas ni gsad par bya ba sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / srog dang bral bas bsad pa dang / gzi byin med par byas pa yin te / de'i de @161a * //

analyzed: la dmyal bar skye ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum gsungs so //

analyzed: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa dang / dge ba rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: lus dang ngag la chags las skyes //
translated: It is said that wrong livelihood is generated by attachment to body and speech.🔽It is said that wrong livelihood is generated by attachment to body and speech.🔽It is said that wrong livelihood is generated by attachment to body and speech.🔽It is said that wrong livelihood is generated by attachment to body and speech.

original: log 'tsho / lus ngag gi las kyi mtha' ni zhe sdang dang gti mug las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: log 'tsho / lus ngag gi las kyi mtha' ni zhe sdang dang gti mug las skyes pa yin te /

analyzed: de ni de dag las /🔽sbyang dka'i phyir logs shig bstan to //
translated: It is said

original: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas des kun nas bslang ba'i las sems bsrung bar sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas des kun nas bslang ba'i las sems bsrung bar sla ba ma yin te /
translated: Since attachment steals the Dharma, it is not easy to guard the mind when it is motivated by attachment.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'tsho ba sbyang dka' bas bsgrib par bya ba'i phyir logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: Therefore, wrong livelihood is taught separately as an obscuration to purification of livelihood.
