analyzed: dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // thob pa rnams kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because they do not occur simultaneously with action.

original: las dang 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtainment does not project because action and its result are not the same.

original: sgrib pa gsum gsungs pa de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum gsungs pa de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the three obscurations that have been mentioned?

original: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs shas che ngan 'gro dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang // sgra mi snyan sgrib gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs shas che ngan 'gro dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang // sgra mi snyan sgrib gsum du 'dod //
translated: the sentient beings without ideation, and Uttarakuru.

original: mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyi sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyi sgrib pa yin no //
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution are the obstruction of action.

original: nyon mongs pa shas che ba rgyun du 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shas che ba rgyun du 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The great defilement which is always present is the obstruction of defilement.

original: ngan song rnam pa gsum dang mi dang lha'i phyogs gcig na rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song rnam pa gsum dang mi dang lha'i phyogs gcig na rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The three unfortunate planes of existence and one part of the fortunate planes of existence, the human plane and the heavenly plane, are the obstruction of retribution.

original: yang sgrib pa 'di dag pas gang zhig 'gro ba gang dag na yod par rig par bya zhe na /🔽re zhig gcig tu /
analyzed: yang sgrib pa 'di dag pas gang zhig 'gro ba gang dag na yod par rig par bya zhe na / re zhig gcig tu /
translated: In which planes of existence are the obstructions found?

original: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod //
analyzed: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod //
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution exist in the three continents.

original: sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'o //🔽de dag na yang skyes pa dang bud med rnams kho na la ste /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'o // de dag na yang skyes pa dang bud med rnams kho na la ste /
translated: They do not exist in Uttarakuru.🔽They exist only among humans, not among the sentient beings of the other planes of existence.

original: za ma sogs la mi 'dod do ;
analyzed: za ma sogs la mi 'dod do ;
translated: They exist only among men and women, not among eunuchs, etc.

original: / phan dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: / phan dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the latter have little affection and little shame.

original: de dag gi pha ma phan chung ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gi pha ma phan chung ba ste /
translated: The parents of the eunuchs, etc., are not the givers of life and of growth.

original: lus ma tshang ba'i bdag por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ma tshang ba'i bdag por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the lords of incomplete bodies.

original: de dag kyang pha ma la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen pos nye bar mi gnas pas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang pha ma la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen pos nye bar mi gnas pas so //
translated: And they do not dwell in the presence of their parents through shame and abashment.

original: las kyi sgrib pa bshad zin to //🔽lhag ma 'gro ba lnga dag na ;
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa bshad zin to // lhag ma 'gro ba lnga dag na ;
translated: The obscurations to action have been explained.🔽The obscurations to the five destinies are the remaining ones.

original: / nyon mongs pa'i dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni lhag ma dag go //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa'i dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni lhag ma dag go //
translated: The remaining ones are the obscurations to the destinies of the five realms.

original: mi dag gi nang na ni sgra mi snyan pa rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni sgra mi snyan pa rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Among humans, the obscuration to the destiny of Uttarakuru is the obscuration to the result.

original: lha dag gi nang na ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: lha dag gi nang na ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: Among the gods, the obscuration to the destiny of the gods devoid of ideation is the obscuration to the result.

original: mtshams med pa rnams kyi nang nas gsum ni srog gcod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams kyi nang nas gsum ni srog gcod pa'o //
translated: Among the five heinous actions, three are the obscuration to action.

original: gcig ni brdzun du smra ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni brdzun du smra ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: One is the obscuration to the nature of false speech.

original: gcig ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽dge 'dun dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa'i //
analyzed: gcig ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor ba'o // dge 'dun dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa'i //
translated: One is the obscuration to the performance of killing.🔽The schism of the Saṅgha is by nature

original: rang bzhin ldan pa ma yin chos //
analyzed: rang bzhin ldan pa ma yin chos //
translated: unharmonious, not a real entity.

original: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
translated: It is neither defiled nor neutral.

original: de dang dge 'dun yang dag ldan //
analyzed: de dang dge 'dun yang dag ldan //
translated: It is associated with the Saṅgha.

original: de yi kha na ma tho brdzun//
analyzed: de yi kha na ma tho brdzun//
translated: The lie that is the basis of the schism

original: de dang 'byed po yang dag ldan //🔽dge 'dun gyi dbyen zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'byed po yang dag ldan // dge 'dun gyi dbyen zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa ste /
translated: and the schismatic are associated with🔽the schism of the Saṅgha.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is a nonassociated, nonindicative, afflicted form.

original: ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
translated: How is it a heinous act?

original: gang gis de 'byed par byed pa'i brdzun du smra ba de ni mtshams med pa pa'i rang bzhin yin no /
analyzed: gang gis de 'byed par byed pa'i brdzun du smra ba de ni mtshams med pa pa'i rang bzhin yin no /
translated: The lie that is the basis of the schism is a heinous act by nature.

original: @163b de dang yang 'byed pa po yang dag par ldan no //
analyzed: @163b de dang yang 'byed pa po yang dag par ldan no //
translated: The schismatic is associated with that heinous act.

original: bskal par mnar med par smin 'gyur //
analyzed: bskal par mnar med par smin 'gyur //
translated: He is born in Avīci for an eon.

original: gzhan dag gis ni bar gyi bskal par ni ma nges so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni bar gyi bskal par ni ma nges so //
translated: Others say: He is born there for an intermediate eon.

original: yang gang zhig gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la /
analyzed: yang gang zhig gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la /
translated: If one commits many heinous acts,

original: de dag bar chad med pa kho nar smin par gyur na de la de dag ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag bar chad med pa kho nar smin par gyur na de la de dag ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and if they all ripen without fail, what happens?

original: lhag pas gnod pa lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: lhag pas gnod pa lhag par 'gyur //
translated: The greater the sin, the greater the harm.

original: de mtshams med pa mang pos mnar med pa der gang gis na gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga 'gyur gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus chen po gzhon sha can gyi lus thob cing /
analyzed: de mtshams med pa mang pos mnar med pa der gang gis na gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga 'gyur gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus chen po gzhon sha can gyi lus thob cing /
translated: At that time, he obtains a large, tender body, which experiences the feeling of the Avici hell multiplied by two, three, four, and five times, due to many heinous acts.

original: gnod pa yang rab tu mang ba dang shin tu mi bzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa yang rab tu mang ba dang shin tu mi bzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The harm is also very great and unbearable.

original: dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa de su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa de su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the one who splits the Saṅgha?

original: dge slong lta spyad tshul ldan pas //
analyzed: dge slong lta spyad tshul ldan pas //
translated: A monk who is a view-practitioner with proper conduct.

original: 'byed do // dge slong gis 'byed kyis khyim pa dang / dge slong ma la sogs pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byed do // dge slong gis 'byed kyis khyim pa dang / dge slong ma la sogs pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: A monk splits the Saṅgha, not a layperson or a nun, and so on.

original: de yang lta ba spyad pa kho nas 'byed kyi sred pa spyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang lta ba spyad pa kho nas 'byed kyi sred pa spyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, only a view-practitioner splits the Saṅgha, not one who is a craving-practitioner.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pas 'byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pas 'byed de /
translated: One with proper conduct splits the Saṅgha,

original: de'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //🔽nyams pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro // nyams pas ni ma yin te /
translated: because his words are to be accepted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung las /
translated: One who has degenerated does not split the Saṅgha,🔽because he is not respected.

original: gzhan du'o // ston pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa nyid du dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gzhan du'o // ston pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa nyid du dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is impossible when the Master is in direct presence, for the disciples are then unanimous in their devotion to the Master.

original: su dag gcig 'byed ce na /
analyzed: su dag gcig 'byed ce na /
translated: Who is it that divides the Saṅgha?

original: byis pa rnams /
analyzed: byis pa rnams /
translated: The fools,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kho na yin gyi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kho na yin gyi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: the ordinary worldlings, not the noble ones,

original: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter are in direct realization of the Truth.

original: de yang / ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
analyzed: de yang / ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
translated: The schism is the non-acquiescence of the Saṅgha in regard to another Master and another Path.

original: bye ba'o // gang gi tshe de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i ston pa dang / des bstan pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i lam la bzod na de tsam gyis dge 'dun bye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bye ba'o // gang gi tshe de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i ston pa dang / des bstan pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i lam la bzod na de tsam gyis dge 'dun bye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: When the disciples do not acquiesce in the fact that the Tathāgata is the Master, and that the path that he preaches is the path, then the Saṅgha is divided.

original: bye nas kyang de nyid kyi nub gcig tu de ni mi gnas so //
analyzed: bye nas kyang de nyid kyi nub gcig tu de ni mi gnas so //
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha does not last indefinitely; it lasts only a day and a night.

original: dge 'dun bye na gdon mi za bar nam ma langs pa nyid du dge 'dun 'dum par 'gyur ro //🔽dge 'dun gyi dbyen du bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun bye na gdon mi za bar nam ma langs pa nyid du dge 'dun 'dum par 'gyur ro // dge 'dun gyi dbyen du bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The Saṅgha is necessarily in agreement at sunrise.🔽The schism of the Saṅgha is the destruction of the Wheel,

original: de ni 'khor lo'i dbyen du 'dod //
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo'i dbyen du 'dod //
translated: because the Wheel of the Law turns by reason of the Saṅgha.

original: de'i tshe la ma 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor yang phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe la ma 'jug pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor yang phye ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the wheel of the Dharma of the Fortunate One is divided, because the Fortunate One is the Dharma Wheel, and because the Fortunate One is the Dharma, the object of the wheel.

original: yang 'khor lo'i dbyen gang du'am ji tsam gyis she na /
analyzed: yang 'khor lo'i dbyen gang du'am ji tsam gyis she na /
translated: In what place is there a schism of the Saṅgha?🔽In Jambudvīpa.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling @164a * //🔽na'o dgu sogs kyis //🔽brgyad ni gdon mi za bar phyogs gnyis na gnas pa dang / dgu pa ni dbyen byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling @164a * // na'o dgu sogs kyis // brgyad ni gdon mi za bar phyogs gnyis na gnas pa dang / dgu pa ni dbyen byed pa po yin te /
translated: By how many bhikṣus is there a schism?🔽Eight bhikṣus are necessary, for a schism presupposes two factions of four bhikṣus.🔽The ninth bhikṣu divides the Saṅgha; the others do not necessarily belong to the faction of the schismatic.

original: lhag mi ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: lhag mi ni nges pa med do //
translated: The Saṅgha is divided when the assent of the schismatic is manifested to the four bhiksus who are the object of the schism.

original: gzhan ni las kyi dbyen las 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan ni las kyi dbyen las 'gyur te /
translated: The Saṅgha is divided by a schism of the realm of desire.🔽The Saṅgha is divided in three continents.

original: gal te mtshams gcig gi nang du mi mthun pas las dag byed na'o //🔽de yang ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshams gcig gi nang du mi mthun pas las dag byed na'o // de yang ni /
translated: The Saṅgha is divided when the assent of the schismatic is manifested to the four bhikṣus who are the object of the schism.🔽The Saṅgha is divided by a schism of the realm of desire.

original: las kyi dbyen ni gling gsum na'o //🔽sgra mi snyan ma gtogs so //🔽de ni brgyad dag yan chad kyis //
analyzed: las kyi dbyen ni gling gsum na'o // sgra mi snyan ma gtogs so // de ni brgyad dag yan chad kyis //
translated: The Saṅgha is divided in three continents.

original: 'khor lo'i dbyen dus drug tu mi 'byung ngo //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbyen dus drug tu mi 'byung ngo //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The Saṅgha is not divided in the other realms of rebirth, nor in the other continents, because there is no right of voting there.🔽The Saṅgha is not divided by a schism in the other continents, for the Dharma is not taught there.🔽The Saṅgha is not divided by a schism in the other realms of rebirth, because the right of voting is not common to all the beings of these realms of rebirth.

original: dang po mtha' skyon zung gcig gi / snga rol thub pa nongs pa dang // mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang //
analyzed: dang po mtha' skyon zung gcig gi / snga rol thub pa nongs pa dang // mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang //
translated: First, there is the pair of faults at the end:🔽The Sage has passed into nirvana,🔽And the boundaries have not been set.

original: 'khor lo'i dbyen ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbyen ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The schism of the wheel does not occur🔽before the two faults, before the Muni’s transcendence of sorrow,🔽and before the division of the Saṅgha.

original: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas ring po ma lon pa dang / tha ma bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe dang / chu bur gyi sngon rol du ste /
analyzed: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas ring po ma lon pa dang / tha ma bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe dang / chu bur gyi sngon rol du ste /
translated: The schism of the wheel does not occur before the wheel of the Dharma has been turned for a long time, at the end when the Bhagavat is about to pass into nirvāṇa, and before the appearance of blisters.

original: ji srid du tshul khrims kyi skyon dang / lta ba'i skyon ma byung gi bar dang ; zung gcig gi sngon rol te /
analyzed: ji srid du tshul khrims kyi skyon dang / lta ba'i skyon ma byung gi bar dang ; zung gcig gi sngon rol te /
translated: It does not occur before the faults of morality and the faults of view have appeared, and before the two chief disciples.

original: ji srid du nyan thos kyi mchog zung gcig ma byung gi bar te /
analyzed: ji srid du nyan thos kyi mchog zung gcig ma byung gi bar te /
translated: It does not occur before the two chief disciples have appeared,

original: des phyir sdum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des phyir sdum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the ones who reconcile the Saṅgha.

original: thub pa nongs pa ni ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das na mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: thub pa nongs pa ni ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das na mi 'byung ste /
translated: The schism of the Muni does not occur when the Teacher has passed into nirvāṇa,

original: 'gren  zla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gren  zla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no longer a peer.

original: mtshams ma bcad na yang mtshams gcig gi nang du phyogs gnyis su gnas pas bye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad na yang mtshams gcig gi nang du phyogs gnyis su gnas pas bye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not occur when the boundary has not been established, because the schism is in one place, and the Saṅgha is divided into two factions.

original: ci'i phyir pha ma bsad pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir pha ma bsad pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa yin la /
translated: Why are patricide and matricide, etc., heinous acts,

original: gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not killing others?

original: phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan zhing //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan zhing //
translated: Because they are benefactors and fields of good qualities,

original: spangs dang med par byas phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs dang med par byas phyir ro //
translated: because they are abandoned and because they are destroyed.🔽Patricide and matricide are heinous acts because they destroy benefactors and because they destroy fields of good qualities.

original: re zhig pha ma bsad pa ni phan 'dogs pa med par byas pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi zhing min pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa bsad pa la sogs pa yang mtshams med pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig pha ma bsad pa ni phan 'dogs pa med par byas pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi zhing min pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa bsad pa la sogs pa yang mtshams med pa yin no //
translated: Killing an arhat, etc., is also a heinous act because they are fields of good qualities.

original: gal te pha'am ma mtshan gyur pa yang lus gcig pa de las ni /
analyzed: gal te pha'am ma mtshan gyur pa yang lus gcig pa de las ni /
translated: If the father or mother changes sex, does the heinous act of killing them also change?

original: mtshan ni gzhan du gyur kyang 'gyur //🔽de la yang mtshams med par 'gyur ro //🔽gang gi tshe bud med gzhan las nur nur po zags nas bud med gzhan gyi mngal du blugs na de'i tshe gang zhig bsad pa na mtshams med par 'gyur ba de'i ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ni gzhan du gyur kyang 'gyur // de la yang mtshams med par 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe bud med gzhan las nur nur po zags nas bud med gzhan gyi mngal du blugs na de'i tshe gang zhig bsad pa na mtshams med par 'gyur ba de'i ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: Even if their sex changes, it is still a heinous act.🔽If a fetus falls from a woman’s womb and enters the womb of another woman, whose killing would it be?

original: gang gi zla mtshan las byung ngam //
analyzed: gang gi zla mtshan las byung ngam //
translated: It is the mother from whose menstrual blood it arises.

original: gang gi zla mtshan las byung ba ni de'i ma yin no//
analyzed: gang gi zla mtshan las byung ba ni de'i ma yin no//
translated: The mother is the one from whose blood it arises.

original: @164b ci de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag byung bas gdon mi za bar mtshams med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: @164b ci de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag byung bas gdon mi za bar mtshams med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does the offense of matricide necessarily entail the karmic obstruction of heinous acts?

original: bgrongs par sems pa la ni 'gyur gyi /🔽sangs rgyas brdeg par sems la min //
analyzed: bgrongs par sems pa la ni 'gyur gyi / sangs rgyas brdeg par sems la min //
translated: It does if one kills with an evil mind.🔽But not if one kills with a mind to kill another.

original: gal te brdeg pa'i bsam pas 'byin par byed na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te brdeg pa'i bsam pas 'byin par byed na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills with a mind to kill another, one does not commit a heinous act.🔽If one kills an arhat with a mind to kill an arhat,

original: gal te dgra mchoms pa'i tshe bsnun la bsnun pa'i 'og tu dgra bcom par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dgra mchoms pa'i tshe bsnun la bsnun pa'i 'og tu dgra bcom par 'gyur na /
translated: but the arhat dies after the blow is struck,🔽then one commits a heinous act.

original: bsnun 'og dgra bcom pa la min //
analyzed: bsnun 'og dgra bcom pa la min //
translated: But if one kills an arhat with a mind to kill another, one does not commit a heinous act.

original: des ni dgra bcom pa la sbyong ba ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni dgra bcom pa la sbyong ba ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not prepare to kill an arhat.

original: ci mtshams med pa'i sbyor ba byas te /
analyzed: ci mtshams med pa'i sbyor ba byas te /
translated: If one prepares to commit a heinous act,

original: de yang ma bzlog par 'dod chags dang bral ba'am 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽mtshams med sbyor ba byas pa la //
analyzed: de yang ma bzlog par 'dod chags dang bral ba'am 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ram zhe na / mtshams med sbyor ba byas pa la //
translated: can one attain freedom from attachment or obtain a result even though one does not desist?

original: 'dod chags bral 'bras mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral 'bras mi srid do //
translated: One cannot attain freedom from attachment🔽or obtain a result if one prepares to commit a heinous act.

original: gzhan gyi las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba byas nas 'phags pa'i lam bskyed ba la dgag pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba byas nas 'phags pa'i lam bskyed ba la dgag pa med do //
translated: But there is no contradiction in saying that one can produce the noble path after having committed the preparatory action of the path of action of another.

original: mtshams med pa 'di dag gi nang nas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen po gang yin zhe na /🔽dge 'dun dbye phyir brdzun smra ba //
analyzed: mtshams med pa 'di dag gi nang nas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen po gang yin zhe na / dge 'dun dbye phyir brdzun smra ba //
translated: Which of these mortal transgressions is the heaviest?

original: kha na ma tho rab cher 'dod //
analyzed: kha na ma tho rab cher 'dod //
translated: Lying with the intention to divide is the most reprehensible of the mortal transgressions.🔽It is the most reprehensible of the mortal transgressions.

original: de'i ni rnam par smin pa bskal pa gcig tu mnar med par skye ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i ni rnam par smin pa bskal pa gcig tu mnar med par skye ba yin la /
translated: Its retribution is to be reborn in Avīci for one aeon.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni ma nges so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni ma nges so //
translated: The retribution of the other mortal transgressions is not determined.

original: legs par spyad pa gang zhig 'bras bu che zhe na /🔽'jig rten pa yi dge ba la //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa gang zhig 'bras bu che zhe na / 'jig rten pa yi dge ba la //
translated: What is the best of the good actions?

original: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che //
analyzed: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che //
translated: The best of the good worldly actions is the volition of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni bskal pa brgyad khri'i bar du zhi ba yin no //🔽ci mtshams med pa rnams kho nas dmyal ba dag tu gdon mi za bar skye'am zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni bskal pa brgyad khri'i bar du zhi ba yin no // ci mtshams med pa rnams kho nas dmyal ba dag tu gdon mi za bar skye'am zhe na /
translated: Its retribution is the state of the highest gods of the summit of cyclic existence.🔽Do only mortal transgressions necessarily produce their retribution in the next life?

original: mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra bas kyang gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra bas kyang gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mortal transgressions and the sins similar to mortal transgressions necessarily produce their retribution in the next life.

original: de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / ma dgra bcom ma sun byas dang ; / byang chub sems dpa' nges gnas dang // slob pa gsod dang dge 'dun gyi //
analyzed: smras pa / ma dgra bcom ma sun byas dang ; / byang chub sems dpa' nges gnas dang // slob pa gsod dang dge 'dun gyi //
translated: Causing regret in an arhat mother, killing a bodhisattva who is irreversible, killing a learner,🔽stealing the Saṅgha’s means of support,

original: 'du ba'i sgo ni 'phrog pa dag / mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ste //
analyzed: 'du ba'i sgo ni 'phrog pa dag / mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ste //
translated: and destroying a stūpa are similar to the heinous actions.

original: lnga pa mchod rten 'jig pa yin //
analyzed: lnga pa mchod rten 'jig pa yin //
translated: The fifth is destroying a stūpa.

original: gal te mi tshangs par spyad pas ma dgra bcom ma sun par byed pa dang / nges par gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zhal du 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog pa dang / mchod rten 'jig par byed pa dang lnga po 'di dag ni mtshams med pa lnga dang cha 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi tshangs par spyad pas ma dgra bcom ma sun par byed pa dang / nges par gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zhal du 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog pa dang / mchod rten 'jig par byed pa dang lnga po 'di dag ni mtshams med pa lnga dang cha 'dra ba yin no //
translated: If one causes regret in an arhat mother through sexual misconduct, kills a bodhisattva who is irreversible, kills a learner, steals the Saṅgha’s means of support, or destroys a stūpa, these five are similar to the heinous actions.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i las gzhan yang dus gsum po dag tu @165a * //🔽shin tu gegs byed de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i las gzhan yang dus gsum po dag tu @165a * // shin tu gegs byed de /
translated: Other karma that is certain to ripen also obstructs the three times.

original: gsum po gang dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang dag tu zhe na /
translated: What are the three times?

original: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom //
analyzed: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom //
translated: Patience, nonreturn, and arhat

original: 'thob la las gegs shin tu byed //
analyzed: 'thob la las gegs shin tu byed //
translated: The actions of the lower realms are obstacles to the attainment of the summit.

original: rtse mo las bzod pa 'thob pa la ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ngan song ba'i las rnams gegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i las rnams gegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rtse mo las bzod pa 'thob pa la ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ngan song ba'i las rnams gegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i las rnams gegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: The actions of the lower realms are obstacles to the attainment of the summit, because they cause one to fall from the stage of the summit.🔽The actions to be experienced in the present life in the realm of desire are obstacles to the attainment of the fruit of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa 'thob pa la ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las dag go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'thob pa la ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las dag go //
translated: The actions of the realms of form and of the formless are obstacles to the attainment of the fruit of perfected being.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsad pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsad pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The action of killing a Bodhisattva is explained above.

original: gang nas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: gang nas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: From what moment is one a Bodhisattva?

original: gang nas bzung ste nges par gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya /🔽gang nas mtshan gyi las byed pa //
analyzed: gang nas bzung ste nges par gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya /🔽gang nas mtshan gyi las byed pa //
translated: From what moment is one to be called a Bodhisattva?🔽From the moment when he produces the volition for perfect enlightenment.

original: gang phan  chad nas mtshan rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las rnams byed par rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: gang phan  chad nas mtshan rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las rnams byed par rtsom pa'o //
translated: From that time on, he begins to create the karma that will ripen as the marks.

original: de ni dus de phan chad rtag tu /
analyzed: de ni dus de phan chad rtag tu /
translated: From that time on, he is always

original: bde 'gror rigs mthong skye dbang tshang //
analyzed: bde 'gror rigs mthong skye dbang tshang //
translated: in happy realms, of high caste, with complete faculties,

original: phor gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: phor gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: male, remembering his former lives, and irreversible.

original: de'i 'gro ba rab tu bsngags pa ni lha dang mi yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'gro ba rab tu bsngags pa ni lha dang mi yin no //
translated: His destiny is always praised, as a god or a human.

original: rigs mtho bar skye ba ni rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa'i ris su skye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mtho bar skye ba ni rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa'i ris su skye ba'o //
translated: He is born in a high caste, as a kshatriya, brahmin, or the like.

original: dbang po tshang ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po tshang ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: He has complete faculties, without any deficiency.

original: pho kho na yin gyi mo la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pho kho na yin gyi mo la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: He is male, not female, and so on.

original: skye ba thams cad du yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all his lives, he remembers his former lives.

original: byang chub las mi ldog par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub las mi ldog par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He is irreversible from enlightenment.

original: mtshan ma rnam par smin pa can gyi las su bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gling gang zhig tu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par smin pa can gyi las su bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gling gang zhig tu zhe na /
translated: What is the continent of those who create the karma that ripens as the marks?

original: de ni 'dzam gling phor gyur te //
analyzed: de ni 'dzam gling phor gyur te //
translated: He is in the western continent.

original: mngon sum sangs rgyas la sems pa //
analyzed: mngon sum sangs rgyas la sems pa //
translated: The intention of the Buddha is direct perception.

original: bsam pa las byung bskal pa brgya //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung bskal pa brgya //
translated: The intention arises from the hundred eons.

original: lus pa dag tu 'phen par byed //
analyzed: lus pa dag tu 'phen par byed //
translated: It is projected in the remaining eons.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling kho nar 'phen gyi de dag blo rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling kho nar 'phen gyi de dag blo rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is projected only in Jambudvipa, because beings there are of sharp faculties.

original: pho kho nas yin gyis mos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pho kho nas yin gyis mos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is projected only by males, not by females.

original: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sems kho nas bskal pa brgya lus pa'i tshe 'phen gyi bskal pa mang po lus pa'i tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sems kho nas bskal pa brgya lus pa'i tshe 'phen gyi bskal pa mang po lus pa'i tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: It is projected only by the intention of the Buddha, not by the intention of the Teacher, because the Teacher is manifest. It is projected when a hundred eons remain, not when many eons remain.

original: las de yang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: las de yang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: And that karma is intentional.

original: mtshan de dag kyang /
analyzed: mtshan de dag kyang /
translated: As for those marks,

original: re re'ang bsod nams brgya las skyes //
analyzed: re re'ang bsod nams brgya las skyes //
translated: each arises from a hundred merits.

original: bsod nams kyi tshad ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la nye ba ma gtogs pa @165b sems can gyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can ji snyed pa tsam mo //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshad ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la nye ba ma gtogs pa @165b sems can gyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can ji snyed pa tsam mo //
translated: The measure of merit is the amount that would be the result of enjoyment by all sentient beings, except for bodhisattvas close to enlightenment.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas she na /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas she na /
translated: How many Buddhas did the Lord worship when he was a Bodhisattva?

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la bdun khri lnga stong la /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la bdun khri lnga stong la /
translated: In the first incalculable eon, he worshipped seventy-five thousand Buddhas.

original: gnyis pa la bdun khri drug stong la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la bdun khri drug stong la /
translated: In the second, he worshipped seventy-six thousand.

original: gsum pa la bdun khri bdun stong la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la bdun khri bdun stong la'o //
translated: In the third, he worshipped seventy-seven thousand.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gang gi tha mar sangs rgyas gang zhig byung bar gyur ce na /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gang gi tha mar sangs rgyas gang zhig byung bar gyur ce na /
translated: In the final period of which incalculable eon did each of these Buddhas appear?🔽Vipaśyin, Dīpaṃkara, Ratnaśikhin

original: rnam gzigs mar me rin chen gtsug / grangs med gsum gyi tha mar byung //
analyzed: rnam gzigs mar me rin chen gtsug / grangs med gsum gyi tha mar byung //
translated: appeared in the final period of the three incalculable eons.

original: rin chen gtsug tor can gyi tshe ni grangs med pa dang po rdzogs so //
analyzed: rin chen gtsug tor can gyi tshe ni grangs med pa dang po rdzogs so //
translated: The first incalculable eon was completed in the period of Ratnaśikhin.

original: mang me mdzad kyi tshe gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mang me mdzad kyi tshe gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second was in the period of Abhāya.

original: rnam par gzigs kyi tshe gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs kyi tshe gsum pa'o //
translated: The third was in the period of Vipaśyin.

original: de dag thams cad kyi /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi /
translated: All of them

original: dang po sh'akya thub pa yin /
analyzed: dang po sh'akya thub pa yin /
translated: had Śākyamuni as their first.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag kyang 'di 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho nar shog shig ces dang por smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag kyang 'di 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho nar shog shig ces dang por smon lam btab bo //
translated: The Lord made his first vow in the presence of Śākyamuni, saying, “May I too become just like him!”

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs gang du pha rol tu phyin pa gang rdzogs par byed ce na /🔽kun la thams cad snying rje yis //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs gang du pha rol tu phyin pa gang rdzogs par byed ce na / kun la thams cad snying rje yis //
translated: In what state does the bodhisattva complete the perfections?

original: sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa rdzogs //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa rdzogs //
translated: He completes giving by giving everything to everyone out of compassion.

original: gang gis kun la mig gi bar dang rkang pa'i bar thams cad mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par can la mi re bar snying rjes sbyin par byed na de tsam gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //🔽chags bcas yan lag bcad kyang ni //
analyzed: gang gis kun la mig gi bar dang rkang pa'i bar thams cad mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par can la mi re bar snying rjes sbyin par byed na de tsam gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // chags bcas yan lag bcad kyang ni //
translated: He completes the perfection of giving to the extent that, out of compassion, he gives everything to everyone, without hope of reward, from his eyes and flesh to the marrow of his bones.

original: mi 'khrug bzod dang tshul khrims kyi //
analyzed: mi 'khrug bzod dang tshul khrims kyi //
translated: He completes morality and patience when, with attachment, he does not get upset even when his limbs are cut off.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bzhin du yan lag bcad kyang cung zad kyang mi 'khrug pa de'i tshe 'di'i tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bzhin du yan lag bcad kyang cung zad kyang mi 'khrug pa de'i tshe 'di'i tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: When he does not get upset even when his limbs are cut off, without being detached from desire, then his perfections of morality and patience are complete.

original: skar rgyal bstod pas brtson 'grus kyi //
analyzed: skar rgyal bstod pas brtson 'grus kyi //
translated: He completes effort by praising the starlike one.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa skar rgyal la rkang pa gcig gis 'greng ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa skar rgyal la rkang pa gcig gis 'greng ste /
translated: The Bhagavat, standing on one foot for seven days, praised the Tathagata Pushya with one verse.

original: zhag bdun gyi bar du tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstod pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs la bskal pa dgu yang bsdums so //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi bar du tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstod pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs la bskal pa dgu yang bsdums so //
translated: At that time, he perfected the perfection of vigor and reduced nine eons.

original: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin blo'i //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin blo'i //
translated: The vajra like samadhi is the last of the aids to penetration.

original: byang chub pa'i sngon rol gyi de ma thag rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: byang chub pa'i sngon rol gyi de ma thag rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: At the time of the vajra like samadhi, immediately prior to enlightenment, he perfected the perfections of meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: mdo las bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum gsungs pa de ni ji @166a * //
analyzed: mdo las bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum gsungs pa de ni ji @166a * //
translated: The sutra mentions three bases of merit.

original: ltar bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltar bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum yin zhe na /
translated: How are they the three bases of merit?🔽The three are bases of merit

original: gsum po bsod nams bya ba dang // de bzhin dper na las lam bzhin //
analyzed: gsum po bsod nams bya ba dang // de bzhin dper na las lam bzhin //
translated: just like the four courses of action.

original: de la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi la lus dang ngag gi las ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi la lus dang ngag gi las ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of giving is threefold: bodily action, vocal action and the intention that instigates them.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams yang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams yang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
translated: The intention that instigates them is meritorious action and also a basis of meritorious action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
translated: The factors that coexist with it are only meritorious action.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kho na yin pas gsum char yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kho na yin pas gsum char yin no //
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of morality is threefold: bodily action and vocal action and the intention that instigates them.🔽The basis of meritorious action consisting of meditation is twofold: the meditation itself and the morality that accompanies it.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba la byams pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yang yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba la byams pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yang yin no //
translated: The meditation itself is meritorious action and also a basis of meritorious action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa dang tshul khrims ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa dang tshul khrims ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
translated: The intention and the morality that coexist with it are meritorious action and also a basis of meritorious action.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan dag ni bsod nams kho na yin no //🔽sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan dag ni bsod nams kho na yin no // sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: The other factors that coexist with it are only meritorious action.🔽What is giving?

original: gang gis sbyin byed de sbyin pa /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin byed de sbyin pa /
translated: It is giving because one gives through it.

original: mchod dang phan 'dogs 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: mchod dang phan 'dogs 'dod pa yis //
translated: 1. Giving is the will to honor and to help.

original: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pa dag gis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pa dag gis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the will to honor and to help others.

original: gang gis sbyin par byed pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin par byed pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the will to honor and to help?

original: lus dang ngag la slong dang bcas //
analyzed: lus dang ngag la slong dang bcas //
translated: 2. Giving is the body, speech, and the request.

original: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the request?

original: tshogs pa gang gis de slong bar byed pa'o //🔽de 'bras longs spyod chen po can //
analyzed: tshogs pa gang gis de slong bar byed pa'o // de 'bras longs spyod chen po can //
translated: It is the assembly which requests.🔽3. Giving has great enjoyment as its effect.🔽Giving has great enjoyment as its effect.

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po can yin no //🔽sbyin pa na yang /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po can yin no // sbyin pa na yang /
translated: What is the giving of the bodhisattvas?🔽4. Giving is for the sake of self, of other, of both, and also for the sake of not giving.

original: bdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir //🔽gnyis ka'i don du min phyir sbyin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir // gnyis ka'i don du min phyir sbyin //
translated: Giving is for the sake of self, of other, of both, and also for the sake of not giving.🔽Giving is for the sake of self when one gives to attain the rank of Brahma.🔽Giving is for the sake of other when one gives to sentient beings.🔽Giving is for the sake of both when one gives in order to obtain heaven and liberation.

original: de la gang 'dod chags dang ma bral bas mchod rten la sbyin pa de ni bdag kho na'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la gang 'dod chags dang ma bral bas mchod rten la sbyin pa de ni bdag kho na'i don du'o //

analyzed: rigs pas bcug pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi bye brag gis bcug pa'o //

original: lus dang / ngag @169a * //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag @169a * //

original: dang ; yid kyi las so //
analyzed: dang ; yid kyi las so //

analyzed: ngan pa dang gya nom pa las gzhan pa'i bar ma zhes bya bar grub bo //

original: 'dus byas dge bstan bya /
analyzed: 'dus byas dge bstan bya /

analyzed: bsten par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba rnams kyi rnam grangs yin no //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bstan par bya ba ma yin par 'grub bo //

analyzed: chos gzhan thams cad ni bla ma dang bcas pa yin gyi /

original: thar pa bla na med pa yin //
analyzed: thar pa bla na med pa yin //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa ni med kyi de ni dge ba dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //

analyzed: las bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bzhi pa'o /

analyzed: srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags dbye bas bdun du bshad //

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /

analyzed: khams gnyis las skyes srid 'dod chags //

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i @169b 'dod chags so //

analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //

analyzed: de lta bas na gcig tu byas so //

analyzed: de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //

analyzed: phra rgyas bcur bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni bcur yod do // de dag nyid las kun 'byung ba mthong bas spong bar bya ba bdun dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spong bar bya ba bdun te /
translated: The ten proclivities that have been explained are abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness in the realm of desire.🔽Seven are abandoned by insight into the truth of the origin, by excluding the afflicted view of self and the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dad brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs so //🔽lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de /

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs so //

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no //

original: 'dod pa'i khams na mthong bas spong bar bya ba so gnyis yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na mthong bas spong bar bya ba so gnyis yin la /

original: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal to /

analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //

original: khong khro ma @170a * //🔽gtogs de dag nyid //
analyzed: khong khro ma @170a * // gtogs de dag nyid //

original: gzugs khams / khong khro ba rnam pa lnga bor nas gzugs su gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig yin no //
analyzed: gzugs khams / khong khro ba rnam pa lnga bor nas gzugs su gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig yin no //

original: gzugs med de dang 'dra /
analyzed: gzugs med de dang 'dra /
translated: The same in the formless realm.

original: sum cu rtsa gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig kho na'o //

original: de ltar dgu bcu brgyad du 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar dgu bcu brgyad du 'dod //

original: de ltar na de dag rnam pa dang bye brag dang khams kyi dbye bas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag rnam pa dang bye brag dang khams kyi dbye bas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'dod do //

analyzed: de bas na / srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis // gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //

analyzed: bzod pas gzhom min bsgom kho nas //

analyzed: sa gang dag phra rgyas gang dag shes pas gzhom par bya ba yod pas de dag ni gnyis ka'i yang rtag tu bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The remaining afflictions are abandoned by the path of seeing and meditation.

original: lta ba lnga ming gi sgo nas bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ma bstan pas de'i phyir de'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba lnga ming gi sgo nas bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ma bstan pas de'i phyir de'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
translated: The remaining afflictions are abandoned by the path of seeing

original: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // med dang dman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // med dang dman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
translated: The view of the transitory collection,🔽eternalism and nihilism,🔽nonexistence, inferiority and superiority,🔽and the view of what is not a cause and path as such.🔽

original: de dag lta ba lnga yin no //
analyzed: de dag lta ba lnga yin no //
translated: The five views are the view of the self and what belongs to the self, the view of annihilation and permanence, the view of non-causality, the view of non-reality, and the view of the inferior as supreme.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the self and what belongs to the self is the view of the perishable collection.

original: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view of permanence or annihilation in regard to the entity that is the object of the view of the self is the view of holding to an extreme.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod na med do zhes bya ba'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod na med do zhes bya ba'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: The view that the truth of suffering and so on does not exist when it does exist is wrong view.

original: dman pa zag pa dang bcas pa la mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa zag pa dang bcas pa la mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of the inferior as supreme is the view that holds inferior ethics and ascetic practices to be supreme.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that a cause is not a cause and the view that a path is not a path are the view that holds inferior ethics and ascetic practices to be supreme.

original: gnyis ka la yang la sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang la sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so //
translated: The words “and so on” in the first and second views are elided in the third and fourth views.

original: gal te rgyu ma yin pa rgyur lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma yin pa rgyur lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The view of the self and what pertains to the self is the view of the transitory collection.

original: ci'i phyir kun 'byung mthong bas spong bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun 'byung mthong bas spong bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the view of the self and what pertains to the self not abandoned by insight into the origin?

original: gang las dbang phyug gam skye dgu'i bdag po la rgyur lta ba de ni de la rtag pa dang gcig @170b bu dang bdag byed pa por mngon par zhen nas lta ste /
analyzed: gang las dbang phyug gam skye dgu'i bdag po la rgyur lta ba de ni de la rtag pa dang gcig @170b bu dang bdag byed pa por mngon par zhen nas lta ste /
translated: One who views Īśvara or the Lord of creatures as a cause, views him as permanent, one, and as an independent agent.

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar /
translated: Thus,

original: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa /
translated: The view of Īśvara, etc. as a cause

original: de ni / rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: de ni / rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: is due to the error of permanence and self.

original: rab tu 'jug pas de'i phyir de //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pas de'i phyir de //
translated: Since it is due to this,

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: it is abandoned by insight into the truth of suffering.

original: de la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa de gnyis ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa de gnyis ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The two errors of permanence and self are abandoned by insight into the truth of suffering alone.

original: de lta bas na de byas pa rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de byas pa rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the view of the self as an agent is also abandoned by insight into the truth of suffering.🔽The view of Īśvara, etc. as a cause

original: rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: is due to the error of permanence and self.

original: zhes gang bshad pa phyin ci log de gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa phyin ci log de gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: Are there only two errors?

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
translated: No, there are four errors.

original: de ni / lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan /
analyzed: de ni / lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan /
translated: The four errors are from the three views.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba las rtag par lta ba ni rtag par phyin ci log go //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba las rtag par lta ba ni rtag par phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of permanence is an error of permanence from the view grasping an extreme.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa las ni bde ba dang gtsang bar phyin ci log go //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa las ni bde ba dang gtsang bar phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of pleasure and purity are errors of pleasure and purity from the view grasping false views as supreme.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni bdag tu lta bar phyin ci log go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni bdag tu lta bar phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of the self is an error of the self from the afflicted view of the self.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci ma log ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci ma log ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are other afflictions not errors?

original: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyis phyin ci log rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyis phyin ci log rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Because they are established as errors through three causes.🔽They are errors because they are misconceptions,

original: phyin ci log phyir dang / nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir //
analyzed: phyin ci log phyir dang / nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir //
translated: because they are definite conceptions, and because they are superimpositions.

original: chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dag ma yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of annihilation and wrong view are not superimpositions.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gcig tu phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gcig tu phyin ci log ma yin no //
translated: The esteeming of morality and asceticism is not mistaken view.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas phyin ci log ma yin no //

analyzed: mdo las 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci log tu gsungs pa de la lta ba kho na phyin ci log yin la / sems dang 'du shes de'i dbang gis //
