original: lta ba phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log tu bshad do //🔽yang lta ba'i phra rgyas kho na la dbye ba yod kyi gzhan la med dam zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log gi dbang gis 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log tu bshad do // yang lta ba'i phra rgyas kho na la dbye ba yod kyi gzhan la med dam zhe na /
translated: The Sūtra says that there are four mistaken views: view of the aggregates as pure, view of the aggregates as blissful, view of the aggregates as permanent, and view of the aggregates as a self.

original: yod pa 'di lta ste /🔽nga rgyal bdun /
analyzed: yod pa 'di lta ste /🔽nga rgyal bdun /
translated: The Sūtra says

original: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: de la chung ngu las bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am mnyam pa dang mnyam mo snyam du sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: de la chung ngu las bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am mnyam pa dang mnyam mo snyam du sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Among these, pride is the inflation of the mind that thinks 'I am superior' or 'I am equal' to an inferior.

original: mnyam pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //🔽khyad par @171a * //🔽du 'phags pa bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro bas nga'o snyam pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mnyam pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo // khyad par @171a * // du 'phags pa bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo // 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro bas nga'o snyam pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Excessive pride is the thought 'I am superior' to an equal.🔽Pride that thinks 'I am' is the thought 'I am' preceded by the view of the transitory collection.🔽Pride of superiority is the thought 'I have attained' what one has not attained.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ma thob pa la bdag gis thob bo snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ma thob pa la bdag gis thob bo snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride of thinking 'I am' is the thought 'I am' preceded by the view of the transitory collection.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride thinking I am slightly inferior to the most excellent is the pride thinking oneself slightly inferior.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag ni yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag ni yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride thinking I possess good qualities in regard to one who does not possess good qualities is false pride.🔽The nine types of pride explained in the treatise

original: bstan bcos las nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dgu gang dag bshad pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos las nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dgu gang dag bshad pa de dag ni /
translated: are the three each of higher,

original: rnam dgu gsum po //🔽de la dang po gsum ni bdag mchog dang mnyam pa dang / dman pa yin no zhes bya ba lta ba la brten pa gsum ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
analyzed: rnam dgu gsum po // de la dang po gsum ni bdag mchog dang mnyam pa dang / dman pa yin no zhes bya ba lta ba la brten pa gsum ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
translated: lower, and equal.🔽The first three are the three that are based on view: higher pride, pride, and the pride thinking oneself slightly inferior, thinking oneself to be superior, equal, and slightly inferior, respectively.

original: gnyis pa'i gsum ni bdag bas mchog dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa yod do zhes bya ba ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i gsum ni bdag bas mchog dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa yod do zhes bya ba ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
translated: The second three are the three that are based on attachment: the pride thinking oneself slightly inferior, pride, and higher pride, thinking that one is slightly inferior, equal, and superior to others, respectively.

original: gsum pa'i gsum ni bdag pas mchog dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa med do zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa'i gsum ni bdag pas mchog dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa med do zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag go //
translated: The three types of the third type are the three types of pride: pride, excessive pride, and slight pride.

original: yang nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is the abandonment of the seven types of pride?

original: mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
translated: They are abandoned by seeing and cultivation.

original: ci 'phags pa rnams la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa de kun du spyod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'phags pa rnams la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa de kun du spyod dam zhe na /
translated: Do noble ones who have not abandoned that which is to be abandoned by cultivation practice it?

original: nges pa med de /
analyzed: nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty.🔽For,

original: 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni //
translated: that which is to be abandoned by cultivation

original: gsod sogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: gsod sogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: is the defilement of killing, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa gang gis ched du bsams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa gang gis ched du bsams te /
translated: The defilement by which one intentionally

original: srog gcod par byed pa nas brdzun du smra bar byed pa'i bar de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod par byed pa nas brdzun du smra bar byed pa'i bar de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: kills, up to and including lying, is to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de bzhin 'jig sred /
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig sred /
translated: So too, the defilement of desire for sensual pleasure.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The craving for non-existence is also to be abandoned by cultivation.🔽There are also types of pride that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams kyang yod do zhes bshad pa la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang yod mod kyi /🔽'phags pa la /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams kyang yod do zhes bshad pa la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang yod mod kyi / 'phags pa la /
translated: The thought “I am” is also a type of pride.

original: rnam sogs nga'o snyam mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam sogs nga'o snyam mi 'byung //
translated: But it does not occur in the noble ones,🔽because they have abandoned the view of the transitory collection.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'i bar du gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'i bar du gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the root text refers to the craving for non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir de dag @171b ma spangs kyang mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag @171b ma spangs kyang mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why do these not occur in the noble ones even though they have not abandoned them?

original: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Because they are nourished by the view of the transitory collection.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The types of pride and the thought “I am” are nourished by the view of the transitory collection.

original: de bas na 'jug pa chad pa'i phyir yang ldang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'jug pa chad pa'i phyir yang ldang bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, they cannot arise in the noble ones because the entryway to them has been blocked.

original: gsod pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni log par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni log par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The entanglements of killing and so on are nourished by wrong view.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa chad par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa chad par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the craving for destruction is increased by the view of annihilation.

original: skye ba'i sred pa'i phyogs ni rtag par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sred pa'i phyogs ni rtag par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The craving for birth is increased by the view of permanence.

original: mi dge'i 'gyod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge'i 'gyod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: There is no regret for the nonvirtuous.

original: 'gyod pa ni mi dge ba yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin na 'phags pa la de mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni mi dge ba yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin na 'phags pa la de mi 'byung ste /
translated: Regret is not to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, but it is not nonvirtuous.

original: the tshom gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang phra rgyas de dag las /
analyzed: the tshom gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro // yang phra rgyas de dag las /
translated: It is not generated in āryas because it is motivated by doubt.

original: du kun du 'gro ba dang / kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: du kun du 'gro ba dang / kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
translated: How many of these negative tendencies are universal and how many are not universal?🔽Those that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of

original: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang// gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
analyzed: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang// gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: suffering and its cause are the views and doubt,

original: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
translated: and the ignorance that is not associated with them.🔽These are the universal negative tendencies.

original: de ltar na lta ba bdun dang / the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa gnyis dang / phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba yin no//
analyzed: de ltar na lta ba bdun dang / the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa gnyis dang / phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba yin no//
translated: Thus, the seven views, the two doubts, the two ignorances and the eleven negative tendencies focus on their own realm in its entirety.

original: de dag las dgu gong du dmigs /
analyzed: de dag las dgu gong du dmigs /
translated: Nine focus on higher realms.

original: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the two views.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs pa phra rgyas gzhan dgu ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs pa phra rgyas gzhan dgu ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin no //
translated: Except for the afflicted view of the self and extreme view, the other nine negative tendencies focus on the realms of different status.

original: phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not negative tendencies that focus on the formless realm.

original: 'on kyang / de dag dang ni lhan cig dang // 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'on kyang / de dag dang ni lhan cig dang // 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
translated: They arise simultaneously with them, but obtainment is not universal.

original: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu du ma'i phyir 'di dag tu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu du ma'i phyir 'di dag tu ma gtogs so //
translated: Obtainment is not included here because it has many results.

original: phra rgyas 'di dag las zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: phra rgyas 'di dag las zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many of these negative tendencies focus on contaminated states and how many focus on uncontaminated states?

original: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya ba ;
analyzed: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya ba ;
translated: Those to be abandoned by seeing🔽cessation and path are wrong view, doubt,🔽and the ignorance associated with them,

original: / log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig dang // drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
analyzed: / log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig dang // drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
translated: and independent ignorance.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The remaining are said to focus on the contaminated.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas //🔽sa drug sa dgu'i @172a * //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas // sa drug sa dgu'i @172a * //
translated: cessation and path of one’s level are mutually objects of each other.🔽The path of six levels

original: lam ni de'i //
analyzed: lam ni de'i //
translated: is the object of those.

original: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no //
translated: The remaining are said to focus on the contaminated.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, the focal object of wrong view and so on focusing on cessation is the cessation of its level alone.

original: lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa drug gi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
analyzed: lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa drug gi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
translated: The focal object of those that focus on the path and exist in the desire realm is the path compatible with Dharma knowledge of the six levels.

original: gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
translated: It is also the antidote of the form and formless realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa brgyad po rnams kyi dmigs pa yang sa dgu'i rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te ;
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa brgyad po rnams kyi dmigs pa yang sa dgu'i rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te ;
translated: The object-field of the eight stages of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality is the path of the cognition of the factors of the nine stages, i.e., the path of the cognition of the factors of the stage of the realm of desire, etc.

original: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is the object-field of the path of the cognition of the factors of the stage of the realm of desire, etc.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do craving, etc., not have the pure factors for their object-field?

original: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //🔽'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na go spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir // 'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na go spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Craving does not exist in relation to that which is to be abandoned.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bzhin no //
translated: If craving had the pure factors for its object-field, then the pure factors would be a cause of the arising of craving; they would not be abandoned by the vision of the truth of cessation and of the truth of the path; they would not be abandoned by the path of mental cultivation; they would not be unconditioned.🔽In fact, craving is abandoned by the vision of the truth of cessation and of the path, by the path of mental cultivation; it is unconditioned.

original: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
analyzed: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
translated: Hatred does not exist in relation to that which does not do evil.

original: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la ni khong khro ba skye na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la ni khong khro ba skye na /
translated: Hatred is produced in relation to that which does evil.

original: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni de lta bu ma yin no //🔽zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni de lta bu ma yin no // zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
translated: The pure factors are not like that.🔽Pride does not exist in relation to that which is calm, pure, excellent.

original: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
translated: Pride is produced in relation to that which is inferior.

original: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis khengs par 'gyur bar yang 'os pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis khengs par 'gyur bar yang 'os pa ma yin la /
translated: Cessation and the path are peace, and it is not proper to be proud of them.

original: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir de gnyis la dag par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir de gnyis la dag par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Also, since they are pure in the sense of being the real object, grasping them as pure is not the overesteeming of morality and ritual.

original: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te /
analyzed: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te /
translated: If grasping the inferior as supreme is the overesteeming of wrong views, then those two are supreme.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi dmigs pa zag pa med pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //🔽phra rgyas de dag las du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi dmigs pa zag pa med pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no // phra rgyas de dag las du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that they are the focal objects of uncontaminated states.

original: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From among those negative tendencies, how many increase through the focal object and how many increase through concomitance?

original: phra rgyas kun du 'gro rnams ni //🔽dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa //
analyzed: phra rgyas kun du 'gro rnams ni // dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa //
translated: All pervasive negative tendencies🔽increase with respect to their own realm

original: thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur //
translated: through the focal object.🔽Non-pervasive negative tendencies

original: kun 'gro ma yin rang ris su //
analyzed: kun 'gro ma yin rang ris su //
translated: increase with respect to their own type.

original: gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa pa'i rnam pa lnga po rnams la yang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa pa'i rnam pa lnga po rnams la yang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that are pervasive increase in the five aspects of their level through the focal object.

original: kun du 'gro ba ma yin @172b pa rnams ni rang gi sar rang gi ris kho na la ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma yin @172b pa rnams ni rang gi sar rang gi ris kho na la ste /
translated: Those that are not pervasive increase in their own type on their own level,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in others.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they focus on uncontaminated states,

original: zag med gong ma'i yul can min //
analyzed: zag med gong ma'i yul can min //
translated: they do not possess objects of higher uncontaminated states.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / sa gong ma la dmigs pa rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / sa gong ma la dmigs pa rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ;
translated: Those that focus on uncontaminated states and those that focus on higher levels do not increase through the focal object.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po ni /
translated: Because those objects🔽are not possessed, are antidotes,

original: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir //
translated: and are not objects of the view of the self.

original: dngos po gang zhig bdag tu lta ba dang / sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa de la phra rgyas gzhan dag kyang rgyas par nus kyi zag pa med par yang de lta ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig bdag tu lta ba dang / sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa de la phra rgyas gzhan dag kyang rgyas par nus kyi zag pa med par yang de lta ma yin la /
translated: Those objects that are possessed by the view of the self and craving are objects in which other negative tendencies can increase. But that is not so for uncontaminated states.

original: sa gong ma yang de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma yang de lta ma yin no //
translated: The same does not hold for the higher stages.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam ni de dag la dmigs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam ni de dag la dmigs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana and the path are the counter-agents to those that have them for their cognitive object.

original: sa gong ma yang sa 'og ma rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas de'i phyir yang de dag tu gnas mi thod do //
analyzed: sa gong ma yang sa 'og ma rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas de'i phyir yang de dag tu gnas mi thod do //
translated: The higher stages are the counter-agents to the lower stages. That is why the defilements cannot be supported by them.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba ni bshad zin to ;
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba ni bshad zin to ;
translated: We have explained how the proclivities increase through the object-field.🔽The proclivities increase through the possession of the proclivities, through the possession of the factors associated with the proclivities, and through the possession of the factors not associated with the proclivities.

original: / gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa //🔽de ni deng mtshungs ldan kho nas //
analyzed: / gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa // de ni deng mtshungs ldan kho nas //
translated: What is the difference between these three possessions?

original: phra rgyas gang zhig chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas rgyas par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin /
analyzed: phra rgyas gang zhig chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas rgyas par 'gyur ro // de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin /
translated: The proclivities increase through the possession of the proclivities.🔽How many proclivities are unwholesome?

original: du ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are neutral?

original: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
analyzed: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
translated: All the higher stages are neutral.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: All the proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are neutral.

original: 'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
translated: In the realm of desire, the afflicted view of self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme are neutral when they are not associated with the defilements of higher stages.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: In the realm of desire, the afflicted view of self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and the ignorance associated with them are neutral.

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
translated: The rest are unwholesome.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams ni mi dge ba dag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams ni mi dge ba dag yin no //
translated: The rest are unwholesome in the realm of desire.

original: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin /
analyzed: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin /
translated: How many roots of non-good are there?

original: du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not?

original: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //
translated: In the realm of desire, attachment, hostility, and delusion are roots of non-good.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs dang // mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rmongs pa ma gtogs pa rmongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs dang // mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rmongs pa ma gtogs pa rmongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum mo //
translated: In the realm of desire, delusion, that is, ignorance, which is associated with the afflicted view of self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and attachment and hostility associated with it, are the three roots of non-good.

original: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
translated: Three are roots of the neutral.

original: de ni sred dang @173a * //
analyzed: de ni sred dang @173a * //
translated: They are craving,

original: ma rig blo //
analyzed: ma rig blo //
translated: ignorance, and discernment.

original: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / shes rab tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / shes rab tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
translated: craving, ignorance, and wisdom, even that which is born of retribution.

original: gang cung zad de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba'o //🔽rnam gnyis mthar 'jug phyir de las //
analyzed: gang cung zad de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba'o // rnam gnyis mthar 'jug phyir de las //
translated: All of these are roots of the indeterminate.🔽Doubt is not a root, because it engages two modes.

original: gzhan min / the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa bar 'os pa ma yin te /🔽g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan min / the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa bar 'os pa ma yin te / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a root, because it is not firm, like a creeper.

original: nga rgyal ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin te /
translated: Pride is not a root, because it engages in elevation, having the characteristic of haughtiness.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a root, because it is not in accord with the nature of a root.

original: 'jig rten na rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang / 'og nas gnas pa dag yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'jig rten na rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang / 'og nas gnas pa dag yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: In the world, roots are seen to be firm, growing downward.

original: / bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa //
analyzed: / bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa //
translated: The outsiders say that there are four roots:

original: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: craving, view, pride, and delusion.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag go //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag go //
translated: The roots of the indeterminate are craving, view, pride and ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they indeterminate roots?

original: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
translated: The three contemplatives are due to ignorance.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three contemplatives:

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan dag yin la /
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan dag yin la /
translated: contemplatives who are dominated by craving, by view, and by pride.

original: de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
translated: And these are due to the power of ignorance.

original: mdo las / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gang gsungs pa de dag lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo las / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gang gsungs pa de dag lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The fourteen indeterminate questions mentioned in the sutras are not indeterminate.

original: gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The question to be set aside is indeterminate.

original: ci de kho na lung du ma bstan pa yin nam ma yin te /
analyzed: ci de kho na lung du ma bstan pa yin nam ma yin te /
translated: Are they only indeterminate?

original: 'on kyang rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: No, they are of four types:🔽The fourfold response:🔽a single response, a distinguishing response,

original: mgo gcig pa dang rnam phye dang // dri dang bzhag par lung bstan pa //
analyzed: mgo gcig pa dang rnam phye dang // dri dang bzhag par lung bstan pa //
translated: a question to be set aside, and a response through a counter-question.

original: 'chi dang skyes dang khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: 'chi dang skyes dang khyad par 'phags //
translated: Death, birth, and superiority.

original: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
translated: like “self” and “other,” etc.🔽If one asks, “Will all sentient beings die?”

original: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bsten par bya'o ;
analyzed: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bsten par bya'o ;
translated: one should answer categorically, “They will die.”

original: / ci sems can thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: / ci sems can thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Will all sentient beings be born?”

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should answer by distinguishing, “Those with defilements will be born, but not those without defilements.”🔽If one asks, “Is this person superior or inferior?”

original: ci mi 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri na lha'am ngan song gang la ltos te 'di zhes dris nas lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ci mi 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri na lha'am ngan song gang la ltos te 'di zhes dris nas lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should ask, “Superior to what or inferior to what?”

original: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Are sentient beings other than the aggregates or not other?”

original: sems can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: one should set that question aside, because there is no substance of a sentient being.

original: gang @173b zag gang gi phra rgyas gang zhig dmigs pa gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni des na de dang ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽'das pa ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang @173b zag gang gi phra rgyas gang zhig dmigs pa gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni des na de dang ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o // 'das pa ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One should say that any person possesses any proclivity that increases with respect to any object.🔽What is meant by “one who possesses past proclivities” up to “one who possesses present proclivities”?

original: da ltar ba ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang// khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gang zhe na / smras pa / 'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang// khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni //
translated: What are they?🔽It is said:🔽One possesses objects toward which past attachment,

original: gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i //🔽dngos po de dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i // dngos po de dang ldan pa yin //
translated: aversion, and pride have not yet been abandoned,🔽and toward which present attachment, aversion, and pride have arisen.

original: dngos po gang la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal rnams skyes pa ma spangs pa de dag gis dngos po de dang ldan te /
analyzed: dngos po gang la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal rnams skyes pa ma spangs pa de dag gis dngos po de dang ldan te /
translated: One possesses objects toward which past attachment, aversion, and pride have arisen and not yet been abandoned.🔽One possesses objects toward which present attachment, aversion, and pride have arisen.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar thams cad la thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar thams cad la thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: These are afflictions that exist by their own characteristics. Therefore they do not necessarily occur in all cases.

original: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas /🔽kun dang / gang la de skyes ba ma spangs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas / kun dang / gang la de skyes ba ma spangs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The future ones of the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ma 'ongs pa de dag nyid kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ma 'ongs pa de dag nyid kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: The future ones of the mental faculty, i.e., attachment, hostility and pride, are associated with all things of the three time periods.

original: gzhan gyis rang dus pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang dus pa /
translated: The others with their own time period.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba gzhan dag gis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba gzhan dag gis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no //
translated: The other anuśayas, i.e., the others among the ninety-eight, are associated with future things of their own time period.

original: skye ba'i chos rnams kyis ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos rnams kyis ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the case for the anuśayas whose object is to arise.

original: de dag nyid /
analyzed: de dag nyid /
translated: The same,🔽with the exception of those which are in the process of arising.

original: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang// mi skye ba'i chos rnams kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang// mi skye ba'i chos rnams kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: The anuśayas whose object is not to arise are associated with all things of the three time periods.

original: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
analyzed: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
translated: All the others with all.

original: lta ba dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa rnams kyis dngos po thams cad dang ldan te /
analyzed: lta ba dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa rnams kyis dngos po thams cad dang ldan te /
translated: The other anuśayas, i.e., the views, doubt and ignorance, are associated with all things.

original: nyon mongs pa spyi la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rdzas su yod dam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyi la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rdzas su yod dam /
translated: Because they focus on the general affliction.

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Do past and future things substantially exist or not?

original: gal te yod na ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽'on te med na ji ltar de dang ngam /🔽des ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro // 'on te med na ji ltar de dang ngam / des ldan pa'am /
translated: If they exist, they would be permanent because they would exist at all times.

original: bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: But if they do not exist, how can one possess them or be free of them?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'i /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'i /
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert that conditioned states are permanent because they possess the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: dus rnams kun du yod par ni gsal bar dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: dus rnams kun du yod par ni gsal bar dam 'cha'o //
translated: They clearly assert that they exist at all times.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gsungs phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te 'das pa'i gzugs zhig yod par ma gyur na /🔽'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i @174a * //
analyzed: gsungs phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te 'das pa'i gzugs zhig yod par ma gyur na / 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i @174a * //
translated: Because it is said that if past form did not exist,

original: gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then noble śrāvakas who possess learning would not not see past form.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod do zhes rgyas par gsung so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod do zhes rgyas par gsung so //
translated: For the same reason, the Buddha said that past form exists, and so on at length.🔽Because of the two,🔽because of the object,🔽and because of the result.🔽Because of the two,🔽consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: gnyis phyir / rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis phyir / rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang gzugs rnams nas yid dang chos kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams nas yid dang chos kyi bar yin no //
translated: The eye and form, up to the mind and mental objects.

original: yul yod phyir /
analyzed: yul yod phyir /
translated: Because of the object.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul med par 'gyur gyi yul dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul med par 'gyur gyi yul dang mi ldan no //
translated: If the past and future did not exist, consciousness that has them as objects would be without an object, but it is not without an object.🔽Because of the result.

original: 'bras phyir / gal te 'das pa zhig med na tshe phyi ma la 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras phyir / gal te 'das pa zhig med na tshe phyi ma la 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the past did not exist, the result of past action would not exist in the future.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the past and future exist.

original: yang 'di ltar /🔽de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar / de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
translated: Moreover,🔽because they are proponents of existence,

original: yod par smra bar 'dod /
analyzed: yod par smra bar 'dod /
translated: they are called Sarvastivadins.

original: gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba thams cad yod par smra ba de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba thams cad yod par smra ba de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba yin no //
translated: Those who are proponents of the existence of all past, future, and present are called Sarvastivadins.

original: gzhan ni rnam par phye ste smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par phye ste smra ba yin no //
translated: The others are the Vibhajyavadins.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
translated: How many of these Sarvastivadins are there?

original: smras pa / de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya //
translated: They are four: the Dhatu, the Lakshan, the Anudharm, and the Prakriyapari-namita.

original: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa chos skyo ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa chos skyo ba yin te /
translated: The Bhadanta Dharmatrata is a Dhatu-parinamavadin, a proponent of the transformation of the element.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: He says that when a dharma passes through the time periods, it is the element that changes, not the substance.

original: dper na gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byed pa ni dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byed pa ni dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a gold vessel is destroyed and remade, it is the shape that changes, not the color.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te /
translated: The Bhadanta Ghoshila is a Lakshan-parinamavadin, a proponent of the transformation of the characteristic.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la gnyis dang ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la gnyis dang ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He says that when a dharma passes through the time periods, it is the characteristic that it possesses that changes, not the dharma itself.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang ngo //
translated: For example, when a man is a son, a father, and a grandfather, it is the name that changes, not the man.🔽The Bhadanta Vasumitra is an Anudharmika, a proponent of the accompanying dharma.🔽He says that when a dharma passes through the time periods, it is accompanied by different dharmas.🔽For example, when milk becomes curds, it is not the color that changes, but the taste.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says: It is a different state.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston to //
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston to //
translated: He says: When a dharma moves into the time periods, it is said to have gone to another state, such as the past.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Buddhadeva says: It is a different thing.

original: chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan zhes brjod do //🔽de dag las /
analyzed: chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan zhes brjod do // de dag las /
translated: He says: When a dharma moves into the time periods, it is said to be different in dependence on what precedes and follows it.

original: gsum pa bzang ste /
analyzed: gsum pa bzang ste /
translated: Among these, the third is best.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a different state.

original: de'i ni / bya ba yis /
analyzed: de'i ni / bya ba yis /
translated: By its activity,

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag //
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag //
translated: the time periods are posited.

original: gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma @174b 'ongs pa yin la /🔽gang gi tshe bya ba byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma @174b 'ongs pa yin la / gang gi tshe bya ba byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba yin zhing /
translated: When a dharma does not perform its activity, it is future.🔽When it performs its activity, it is present.

original: gang gis byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe 'das pa yin no //
translated: When it has performed its activity and has ceased, it is past.

original: de'i yang chos de'i bdag nyid de kho nar yod la rtag tu bya ba byed pa la gegs su byed /
analyzed: de'i yang chos de'i bdag nyid de kho nar yod la rtag tu bya ba byed pa la gegs su byed /
translated: and that which exists as the reality of that dharma in reality always obstructs the performance of action.

original: gang gis na res 'ga' ni bya ba byed la res 'ga' ni ma yin ;
analyzed: gang gis na res 'ga' ni bya ba byed la res 'ga' ni ma yin ;
translated: How is it that sometimes it performs action and sometimes it does not?

original: bya ba 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: bya ba 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa /
translated: What is called the past, future, and present

original: de yang ji ltar /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar /
translated: how is that?

original: ci bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam /
analyzed: ci bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam /
translated: Is there another action in regard to action?

original: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig yin na de ni gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig yin na de ni gzhan ma yin /
translated: If action were different from the dharma, then that error would occur, but it is not different.

original: de'i phyir skyon der mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon der mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, that error does not occur.

original: de lta na 'o na ni /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni /
translated: If that is so,

original: de nyid dus su mi rung /
analyzed: de nyid dus su mi rung /
translated: then it is not tenable that

original: gang gi tshe chos yod pa de'i tshe kho nar bya ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos yod pa de'i tshe kho nar bya ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: action exists at the time of the dharma, for action would exist only at the time the dharma exists.

original: gal te ji ltar da ltar rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar da ltar rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod na /
translated: If the past and future exist in the same way that the present substantially exists,

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: then
