original: zag pa de dag ji skad du bshad pa ltar ;
analyzed: zag pa de dag ji skad du bshad pa ltar ;
translated: The floods and the yokes are explained as the fluxes have been.🔽The flood of desire is the same as the flux of desire.

original: chu bo sbyor ba'ang de bzhin du //🔽lha rnams gsal phyir logs shig bstan //
analyzed: chu bo sbyor ba'ang de bzhin du // lha rnams gsal phyir logs shig bstan //
translated: The flood of existence is the same as the flux of existence.🔽The flood of views is the same as the flux of views.🔽The flood of ignorance is the same as the flux of ignorance.🔽The yoke of desire is the same as the flux of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The yoke of existence is the same as the flux of existence.🔽The yoke of views is the same as the flux of views.🔽The yoke of ignorance is the same as the flux of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa ni srid pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa ni srid pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The same for the flood of existence and the yoke of existence.

original: lta ba rnams ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: lta ba rnams ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The afflicted views are excluded.🔽They are placed separately, outside of the floods and the yokes, because they are prominent.🔽What is the meaning of the word uṣadha?

original: de dag ni chu bo dang / sbyor ba rnams las logs shig tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni chu bo dang / sbyor ba rnams las logs shig tu bzhag ste /
translated: The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.🔽The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.

original: gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:

original: zag par ma yin grogs ming rnams //🔽'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun lo //
analyzed: zag par ma yin grogs ming rnams // 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun lo //
translated: The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.🔽The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.🔽The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:

original: zag pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'jog par byed pas na zhes 'og nas 'chad na /
analyzed: zag pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'jog par byed pas na zhes 'og nas 'chad na /
translated: The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.🔽The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.🔽The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:🔽The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.

original: lta ba 'ba' zhig ni gsal ba'i phyir 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin pas bsres nas gzhag go //
analyzed: lta ba 'ba' zhig ni gsal ba'i phyir 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin pas bsres nas gzhag go //
translated: The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.

original: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //🔽nyer len rnams te lta rnams gnyis //
analyzed: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas // nyer len rnams te lta rnams gnyis //
translated: The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:🔽The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.

original: phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.🔽The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:🔽The uṣadhas are so called because they cause one to be placed in the floods and the yokes.🔽The afflicted views are not uṣadhas because they are prominent; they are placed separately, because they are the cause of the floods and the yokes.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word uṣadha is explained later in the kārikā:🔽The u

original: srid pa'i sbyor ba @176b nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //🔽lta ba'i sbyor ba dag las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs phyung ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i sbyor ba @176b nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o // lta ba'i sbyor ba dag las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs phyung ste /
translated: The attachment to the belief in a self is the appropriation of the belief in a self, which is the attachment to existence together with ignorance.

original: lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The attachment to views is the appropriation of views.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The attachment to morality and asceticism is the appropriation of morality and asceticism.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa bsres te nye bar len par bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa bsres te nye bar len par bshad ce na /
translated: Why is ignorance mixed in with the appropriations?

original: srid pa 'dzin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa dag yin na /
analyzed: srid pa 'dzin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa dag yin na /
translated: If the appropriations are so called because they grasp existence,

original: ma rig pa 'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres /
translated: ignorance is mixed in because it is the grasping of the view of the transitory composite.

original: ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Ignorance is not a grasping because it is not clear, being characterized by non-knowledge.

original: de'i phyir bsres so //🔽yang de dag gi nang nas phra rgyas kyi don ci yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsres so // yang de dag gi nang nas phra rgyas kyi don ci yin /
translated: Therefore, it is mixed in.

original: nye bar len pa'i bar gyi don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i bar gyi don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term “contaminant” and what is the meaning of the term “appropriation”?

original: gang phyir de dag phra ba dang // rjes 'brel rnam gnyis rgyas 'gyur dang // rjes su 'brel pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir de dag phra ba dang // rjes 'brel rnam gnyis rgyas 'gyur dang // rjes su 'brel pa de yi phyir //
translated: Because they are subtle, because they are associated, because they are extended, and because they follow,

original: phra rgyas dag tu bshad pa yin //
analyzed: phra rgyas dag tu bshad pa yin //
translated: they are called the proclivities.

original: de la phra ba ni rtogs par dka' bas rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phra ba ni rtogs par dka' bas rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are subtle because they are subtle in their activity, since they are difficult to understand.

original: rjes 'brel pa ni thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
analyzed: rjes 'brel pa ni thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
translated: They are associated because they are associated with acquisition.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are extended because they are extended in their object-field and in their concomitants.

original: rjes su 'brang ba ni sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: They follow because they follow the life-continuum.

original: bzlog bzhin du yang yang du mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog bzhin du yang yang du mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called proclivities because they are the cause of the appearance of the defilements, even in the absence of any special cause.

original: de dag 'jog byed zag byed dang // 'khyer bar byed dang 'byar byed dang // nye bar 'dzin phyir zag la sogs //🔽de dag gi ni nges tshig yin //
analyzed: de dag 'jog byed zag byed dang // 'khyer bar byed dang 'byar byed dang // nye bar 'dzin phyir zag la sogs //🔽de dag gi ni nges tshig yin //
translated: The proclivities are so called because they cause the defilements to adhere, to be carried along, to be attached, to be seized, and to be clung to.🔽The proclivities are so called because they cause the defilements to adhere, to be carried along, to be attached, to be seized, and to be clung to.

original: 'khor bar 'jog par byed pa dang // srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pas na zag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jog par byed pa dang // srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pas na zag pa dag yin no //
translated: They are outflows because they flow out from the wound of the six sense spheres, from the peak of cyclic existence down to the lowest hell.

original: 'khyer bar byed pas na chu bo dag yin no //🔽'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba dag go //
analyzed: 'khyer bar byed pas na chu bo dag yin no // 'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba dag go //
translated: They are floods because they carry one away.🔽They are yokes because they yoke one to the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: nye bar 'dzin par byed pas na nye bar len pa rnams so //🔽de dag kun du sbyor sogs kyi //
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin par byed pas na nye bar len pa rnams so // de dag kun du sbyor sogs kyi //
translated: They are clingings because they cling to the self.

original: dbye bas yang rnam lngar bshad do //
analyzed: dbye bas yang rnam lngar bshad do //
translated: They are also explained as being five types🔽through the classifications of fetters, and so on.

original: phra rgyas de dag nyid kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa'i dbye ba yang rnam pa lngar phye nas bshad do //
analyzed: phra rgyas de dag nyid kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa'i dbye ba yang rnam pa lngar phye nas bshad do //
translated: These negative tendencies are also explained as being five types through the classifications of fetters, bonds, negative tendencies, branch afflictions, and entanglements.

original: de la kun du sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
analyzed: de la kun du sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine fetters:

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba rnams so //🔽yang ci'i phyir lta ba @177a * //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba rnams so // yang ci'i phyir lta ba @177a * //
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, view, grasping at extreme, doubt, jealousy, and stinginess.

original: gsum ni logs shig tu lta ba'i kun du sbyor bar bshad la /
analyzed: gsum ni logs shig tu lta ba'i kun du sbyor bar bshad la /
translated: Why are the three views explained separately as the fetter of view?

original: gnyis ni logs shig tu mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: gnyis ni logs shig tu mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor bar bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the two views explained separately as the fetter of grasping at extreme?

original: rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are similar to grasping at substance and grasping at the highest.

original: lta gnyis kun du sbyor gzhan no //
analyzed: lta gnyis kun du sbyor gzhan no //
translated: The two views are separate fetters because they are similar to grasping at substance and grasping at the highest.

original: lta ba gsum yang rdzas bco brgyad yin la /
analyzed: lta ba gsum yang rdzas bco brgyad yin la /
translated: The three views are eighteen substances.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang rdzas bco brgyad kho na yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang rdzas bco brgyad kho na yin te /
translated: The two views that grasp at the highest are also eighteen substances.

original: de'i phyir rdzas mnyam pas 'di gnyis kun du sbyor ba gzhan du byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas mnyam pas 'di gnyis kun du sbyor ba gzhan du byas so //
translated: Therefore, because they are equal in substance, these two are made separate fetters.

original: 'di gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: These two have the nature of grasping at the highest.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin pas mchog tu 'dzin par 'dra ba'i phyir yang 'di dag gnyis logs shig tu bshad de /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin pas mchog tu 'dzin par 'dra ba'i phyir yang 'di dag gnyis logs shig tu bshad de /
translated: The remaining fetters are not like that, but they are similar in that they are the most prominent.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang ci'i phyir kun du sbyor ba dag phrag dog dang / ser sna ni logs shig tu kun du sbyor ba gnyis su bshad la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // yang ci'i phyir kun du sbyor ba dag phrag dog dang / ser sna ni logs shig tu kun du sbyor ba gnyis su bshad la /
translated: Therefore, they are explained separately as two fetters, because they are the opposite of the fetters of attachment and aversion.

original: kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /🔽gang phyir gnyis ka'ang gcig tu ni //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni ma yin zhe na / gang phyir gnyis ka'ang gcig tu ni //
translated: Why are the fetters of envy and avarice explained separately as two fetters, but the other entanglements are not?

original: mi dge rang dbang de yi phyir //🔽phrag dog ser sna de dag las //
analyzed: mi dge rang dbang de yi phyir // phrag dog ser sna de dag las //
translated: Because both are nonvirtuous and independent,

original: logs shig kun sbyor gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: logs shig kun sbyor gnyis su bshad //
translated: envy and avarice are explained as two fetters separately from those.

original: gang la gcig tu mi dge ba dang / rang dbang can 'di gnyis ga yin pa de lta bu'i kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gang la gcig tu mi dge ba dang / rang dbang can 'di gnyis ga yin pa de lta bu'i kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other entanglement that is both nonvirtuous and independent.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du sbyor ba /🔽tha ma'i cha dang mthun rnam lnga //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du sbyor ba / tha ma'i cha dang mthun rnam lnga //
translated: The Bhagavān said:🔽The five that are compatible with the lower realm.

original: gsungs te ; ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsungs te ; ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there only five?

original: 'di ltar / gnyis kyis 'dod las mi 'da' la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gnyis kyis 'dod las mi 'da' la //
translated: One does not transcend the desire realm by means of the first two,

original: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed //
analyzed: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed //
translated: but by means of the latter three one turns back.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da'o //
translated: One does not transcend the desire realm by means of the desire to enjoy sensual pleasures and malice.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dag gis ni 'das kyang phyir zlog par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dag gis ni 'das kyang phyir zlog par byed do //
translated: One transcends it by means of the latter three, but one turns back due to the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is also said:

original: sgo dang rtsa bas bsdus phyir gsum //🔽kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: sgo dang rtsa bas bsdus phyir gsum // kho nar gsungs so //
translated: The three are stated because they include the doors and the roots.🔽The three are stated because they include the doors and the roots.

original: sngar mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs na yang sgo dang rtsa ba bsdus pas nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: sngar mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs na yang sgo dang rtsa ba bsdus pas nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
translated: Even if one abandons the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, the afflictions are said to be of three types because they include the doors and the roots.

original: rnam pa gcig pa dang / rnam pa gnyis pa dang / rnam pa bzhi pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa dang / rnam pa gnyis pa dang / rnam pa bzhi pa dag go //
translated: They are the single aspect, the two aspects, and the four aspects.

original: de dag gi sgo ni 'di gsum gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de dag gi sgo ni 'di gsum gyis bsdus so //
translated: They are included in these three doors.

original: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug la /
translated: Moreover, the afflicted view of the extreme is induced by the afflicted view of the self.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas rab tu bcug / log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis @177b rab tu bcug ste /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas rab tu bcug / log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis @177b rab tu bcug ste /
translated: and wrong view is the root of doubt.

original: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus so zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the root is included in these three.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:🔽Non-desire to go, wrong path,🔽and doubt about the path

original: 'gro mi 'dod dang lam nor dang // lam la the tshom de rnyed cig / thar pa bgrod la gegs byed yin //
analyzed: 'gro mi 'dod dang lam nor dang // lam la the tshom de rnyed cig / thar pa bgrod la gegs byed yin //
translated: are obstacles to traveling the path to liberation.

original: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //
translated: Therefore, three are taught.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni thar pa la skrag par 'gyur bas 'gro mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni thar pa la skrag par 'gyur bas 'gro mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates causes fear of liberation and thus one has no desire to go.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas ni lam gzhan la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir lam nor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas ni lam gzhan la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir lam nor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism causes one to enter another path and thus one goes on a wrong path.

original: the tshom gyis ni lam la som nyi za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni lam la som nyi za bar 'gyur te /
translated: Doubt causes one to doubt the path.

original: de'i phyir 'di gsum kho na spang bar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gsum kho na spang bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, just these three are taught to be abandoned.

original: ji ltar kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga bshad pa de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: ji ltar kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga bshad pa de bzhin du yang /
translated: Just as there are five lower fetters,

original: gong mi'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
analyzed: gong mi'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
translated: so too there are five higher fetters:

original: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //
translated: attachment to existence in the form and formless realms,🔽excessive conceit,🔽excessive restraint,

original: 'dod chags gnyid rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyid rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: and ignorance.

original: 'di dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not transcend the higher realms without abandoning these.

original: kun du sbyor ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bshad zin to //
translated: The fetters have been explained.🔽The bonds

original: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three bonds:🔽attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang ; zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ; zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so //
translated: aversion, and conceit.

original: 'di yang / tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
analyzed: 'di yang / tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
translated: These three bonds are due to the power of feeling.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: How so?

original: bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //🔽sdug bsngal ba las ni zhe sdang ngo //🔽bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro // sdug bsngal ba las ni zhe sdang ngo // bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Attachment increases through the power of pleasant feeling, by taking it as an object and by being concomitant with it.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ste /
translated: Aversion increases through the power of unpleasant feeling.🔽Conceit increases through the power of neutral feeling.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Attachment and aversion do not increase in this way.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no //
translated: Or else, they are determined by the object that exists in the stream of consciousness.

original: phra rgyas rnams ni sngar bshad pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: phra rgyas rnams ni sngar bshad pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The proclivities have already been explained.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: The secondary defilements should be mentioned.

original: de la re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
translated: In this respect, those that are defilements are also secondary defilements,

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they defile the mind.

original: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
analyzed: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
translated: The others are secondary defilements.

original: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes pa //
analyzed: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes pa //
translated: The others are the mental factors that are associated with defilements, and the formations that are not associated with defilements.

original: gang de 'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
analyzed: gang de 'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
translated: They are also secondary defilements,

original: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
translated: but they are not called defilements.

original: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'don pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'don pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are also those that are mentioned in the Kṣudraka-piṭaka.

original: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, only those that are included in the defilements of the envelopers and the secondary defilements should be mentioned.

original: de la re zhig //
analyzed: de la re zhig //
translated: In this respect, first of all,

original: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni //🔽kun nas dkris pa @178a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni // kun nas dkris pa @178a * //
translated: Shamelessness, lack of conscience, envy, avarice, excitation, regret, torpor, and sleep.

original: rnam pa brgyad //🔽yang kha cig gis brgyad po de dang / khro dang 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad // yang kha cig gis brgyad po de dang / khro dang 'chab pa'o //
translated: Envelopment is of eight kinds.

original: de dag gis bcu ste /
analyzed: de dag gis bcu ste /
translated: Some say that there are ten envelopments: the above eight, plus anger and concealment.

original: de la phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Envy is the irritation of another's good qualities and fortune.

original: ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'gal ba can sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'gal ba can sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Avarice is the grasping of the mind by the thought of the uselessness of giving away one's goods, knowledge, and skill.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Excitation is the non-tranquility of mind.

original: gnyid ni lus yang dag par 'dzin mi nus pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni lus yang dag par 'dzin mi nus pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the inability of the body to hold itself up, and the drawing in of the mind.

original: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no //
translated: Envy and avarice are only defiled.

original: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Anger is the state of mind that torments, except for malice and cruelty.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one's faults.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kha cig sngar bshad pas 'dir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kha cig sngar bshad pas 'dir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: Some subsidiary defilements have already been explained, and so are not distinguished here.

original: kun nas dkris pa de rnams las /🔽'dod chags kyis /🔽ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa de rnams las / 'dod chags kyis / ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang //
translated: Among these entanglements,🔽three are the outcome of attachment.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: Shamelessness, excitement and avarice are the outcome of attachment.

original: 'chab pa rtsod do //
analyzed: 'chab pa rtsod do //
translated: Concealment is disputed.

original: kha cig na re sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say it is the outcome of craving.

original: gzhan na re ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan na re ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say it is the outcome of ignorance.

original: gzhan dag na re de gnyis ka yin te shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes so //🔽ma rig las //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de gnyis ka yin te shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes so // ma rig las //
translated: Others say it is both, for it belongs to those who know and those who do not know.🔽Three are the outcome of ignorance.

original: rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
analyzed: rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
translated: Dullness, sleep and lack of conscience are the outcome of ignorance.

original: gsum po 'di ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: These three are the outcome of ignorance.

original: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang // phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang // phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
translated: Regret arises from doubt, and anger arises from resentment, envy, and hostility.

original: khong khro ba kun nas bslang ba dag yin te /
analyzed: khong khro ba kun nas bslang ba dag yin te /
translated: They are all motivated by hostility.

original: de ltar na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: Thus these ten secondary defilements are the natural outcome of the defilements.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug ;
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug ;
translated: There are six other defilements:🔽Dissimulation, guile, arrogance, violence, spite, and jealousy.

original: / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe sgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o //
analyzed: / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe sgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o //
translated: Dissimulation is the concealing of one's faults.

original: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba'o //
translated: Guile is the crookedness of mind.

original: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin to //🔽'tshig pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po la dam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin to // 'tshig pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po la dam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Arrogance has been explained.🔽Violence is the firm grasping of things that are reprehensible.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po la lan mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po la lan mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Spite is the frequent practice of hostility.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
translated: Hostility is the desire to harm.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug po de dag las /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug po de dag las /
translated: Among these six defilements,

original: sgyu dang rgyags pa ni //
analyzed: sgyu dang rgyags pa ni //
translated: Deceit and arrogance🔽are born from attachment.

original: 'dod chags las skyes khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe khong khro las skyes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe khong khro las skyes so //
translated: Resentment and spite are born from hatred.

original: 'tshig pa lta ba mchog 'dzin las //
analyzed: 'tshig pa lta ba mchog 'dzin las //
translated: Malice is born from views.

original: g-yo @178b ni lta bas kun nas bslang //
analyzed: g-yo @178b ni lta bas kun nas bslang //
translated: Guile is born from views.

original: rgyu mthun bshad nas ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun bshad nas ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the causes, what is to be abandoned will now be explained.

original: de las ngo tsha med pa dang // khrel med rmugs gnyid rgod rnam gnyis //
analyzed: de las ngo tsha med pa dang // khrel med rmugs gnyid rgod rnam gnyis //
translated: Shamelessness, lack of conscience, torpor, sleep, and the two regrets

original: chos lnga po 'di dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: are to be abandoned by both seeing and cultivation.

original: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
translated: The others are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Envy, avarice, regret, anger, and concealment are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: rang dbang / ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga po rang dbang can dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: rang dbang / ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga po rang dbang can dag kyang ngo //
translated: The five secondary afflictions are autonomous because they are concomitant only with ignorance.

original: de bzhin dri ma rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin dri ma rnams /
translated: The stains are also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The six defilements of thought are also like this.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bshad pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bshad pa de dag ni /
translated: The subsidiary defilements, which have been explained,

original: 'dod na mi dge gsum rnam gnyis //
analyzed: 'dod na mi dge gsum rnam gnyis //
translated: are, in the realm of desire, nonvirtuous and of two types.

original: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / gnyis ni mi dge dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / gnyis ni mi dge dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Lethargy, excitedness, and the two faults of pride and ignorance are nonvirtuous and morally indeterminate.

original: de yan chad ni lung ma bstan /
analyzed: de yan chad ni lung ma bstan /
translated: Above that, they are morally indeterminate.

original: 'dod pa'i khams yan chad na ci rigs par rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams yan chad na ci rigs par rnam pa gcig go //
translated: Above the realm of desire, they are morally indeterminate.

original: de dag las du zhig gang na yod ce na /
analyzed: de dag las du zhig gang na yod ce na /
translated: How many of them exist in which realm?

original: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po na //
analyzed: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po na //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the first meditation,

original: g-yo sgyu 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu 'di nyid ni /
translated: there is deceit and fraud.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the first meditation, there is deceit and fraud.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na sgyu ji ltar yod ce na tshangs pas 'drid phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na sgyu ji ltar yod ce na tshangs pas 'drid phyir ro //
translated: How can there be fraud in the world of Brahma?

original: tshangs pa chen po ni de na bdag nyid log bar kun du ston pas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'drid par zhugs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po ni de na bdag nyid log bar kun du ston pas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'drid par zhugs so //
translated: The Great Brahma, in order to deceive the venerable Aśvajit, manifested himself in a false manner.

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
translated: Lethargy, excitedness, and arrogance exist in the three realms.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni khams gsum pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni khams gsum pa dag yin no //
translated: These three are of the three realms.

original: gzhan dag 'dod khams las skyes pa //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dod khams las skyes pa //
translated: The others are of the realm of desire.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu gcig ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu gcig ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The eleven upakleśas are of the realm of desire.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The kleśas and the upakleśas have been discussed.

original: de dag las kyang /
analyzed: de dag las kyang /
translated: Among them,

original: mthong spang bya gnyid nga rgyal bcas //
analyzed: mthong spang bya gnyid nga rgyal bcas //
translated: Drowsiness and pride are abandoned through the Seeing of Suffering and the Seeing of Origin.

original: yid kyi rnam shes sa pa yin //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes sa pa yin //
translated: They are of the sphere of mental consciousness.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa dag yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa dag yin te /
translated: All the dharmas to be abandoned by the Seeing of Suffering and the Seeing of the Origin are of the sphere of mental consciousness.

original: gnyid nga rgyal bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag dang bcas pa yang ngo ;
analyzed: gnyid nga rgyal bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag dang bcas pa yang ngo ;
translated: Drowsiness and pride are also abandoned by the Meditation.

original: / nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
analyzed: / nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
translated: The independent upakleśas

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rang dbang can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yid kyi sa pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rang dbang can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yid kyi sa pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: are of the sphere of mental consciousness.

original: gzhan ni rnam shes drug rten can //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam shes drug rten can //
translated: The others are of the six consciousnesses.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni rnam par shes pa drug gi sa pa dag go //🔽yang de @179a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni rnam par shes pa drug gi sa pa dag go // yang de @179a * //
translated: The other defilements and subsidiary defilements are of the six consciousnesses.

original: dag las bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa brjod par bya ste /🔽bde ba dag dang 'dod chags su //
analyzed: dag las bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa brjod par bya ste / bde ba dag dang 'dod chags su //
translated: We have explained the relationship of the controlling faculties with the sensations.🔽We must now explain the relationship of the controlling faculties with the defilements.🔽Desire is associated with satisfaction and contentedness.

original: mtshungs ldan / 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan / 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Desire is associated with the two sensations of satisfaction and contentedness.

original: zhe sdang bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang bzlog pa'o //
translated: Aversion is associated with dissatisfaction and displeasure.

original: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Aversion is associated with the two sensations of dissatisfaction and displeasure.🔽Ignorance is associated with all.

original: ma rig pa dag thams cad dang // dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dag thams cad dang // dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Ignorance is associated with the five sensations.🔽Wrong views are associated with contentedness and dissatisfaction.

original: med lta yid bde sdug bsngal dang // log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan to //🔽bsod nams dang sdig pa'i las can dag dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: med lta yid bde sdug bsngal dang // log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan to // bsod nams dang sdig pa'i las can dag dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Wrong views are associated with the two sensations of contentedness and dissatisfaction.🔽The other envelopments are associated with the sensations of dissatisfaction and contentedness.

original: yid mi bde dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: yid mi bde dang the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is associated with dissatisfaction and contentedness.

original: gzhan yid bde dang / lta ba bzhi dang / nga rgyal dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gzhan yid bde dang / lta ba bzhi dang / nga rgyal dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The others are associated with mental satisfaction, the four views, pride, and mental satisfaction.

original: 'di dag /'dod las skyes par bstan nas gzhan bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag /'dod las skyes par bstan nas gzhan bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the ones that arise in the desire realm, the others will now be explained.

original: btang snyoms dang kun /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang kun /
translated: Upeksā, all,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na gdon mi za bar btang snyoms kun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na gdon mi za bar btang snyoms kun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the defilements are interrupted, they are necessarily associated with equanimity.

original: yang sa gong ma rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang sa gong ma rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What about the higher realms?

original: smras pa / sa gong ma /
analyzed: smras pa / sa gong ma /
translated: It is said:

original: sa ji bzhin du rang rang dang / sa gong ma'i phra rgyas rnams ni sa gang na dbang po ji snyed pa rang rang gi dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: sa ji bzhin du rang rang dang / sa gong ma'i phra rgyas rnams ni sa gang na dbang po ji snyed pa rang rang gi dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: In the higher realms, the proclivities are associated with the faculties of their own realm, just as they are in the desire realm.

original: 'gyod dang phrag dog khro ba dang // rnam 'tshe khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'tshig pa yid mi bde ba dang // mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gyod dang phrag dog khro ba dang // rnam 'tshe khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'tshig pa yid mi bde ba dang // mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Regret, envy, anger, hostility, resentment, and spite are associated with mental dissatisfaction.

original: skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they operate with the aspect of dejection and because they are on the level of the mental faculty.

original: ser sna dag ni bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: ser sna dag ni bzlog pa yin //
translated: and the opposite of stinginess.

original: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression “associated with joy” is clear.

original: g-yo dang sgyu dang 'chab dang gnyid /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu dang 'chab dang gnyid /
translated: Guile, deceit, concealment, and sleep

original: gnyis ka dang ldan /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan /
translated: are associated with two.

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Guile, deceit, concealment, and sleep are associated with both joy and dissatisfaction.

original: bde ba dag dang / rgyags pa /🔽bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: bde ba dag dang / rgyags pa / bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Happiness and arrogance🔽are associated with happiness.🔽In the third meditation, they are associated with happiness.

original: man chad na ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: man chad na ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Below that, they are associated with joy.

original: yan chad na ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te /🔽'di ltar btang snyoms kun du 'gro //
analyzed: yan chad na ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te / 'di ltar btang snyoms kun du 'gro //
translated: Above that, they are associated with equanimity.🔽Because equanimity is universal.

original: thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: They are associated with equanimity in all stages.

original: de ni ma rig pa bzhin du gang la yang dgag pa med do //
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa bzhin du gang la yang dgag pa med do //
translated: Like ignorance, they are not excluded from any of the moral faculties.

original: bzhi po gzhan ni lnga dag dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / kun nas dkris @179b pa bzhi po 'di dag ni dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: bzhi po gzhan ni lnga dag dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / kun nas dkris @179b pa bzhi po 'di dag ni dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Shamelessness, nonembarrassment, lethargy, and excitation are concomitant with all five faculties.🔽The five hindrances are stated in the sutras:

original: mdo las / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang / sgrib pa lnga po gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de la rmugs pa dang /
analyzed: mdo las / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang / sgrib pa lnga po gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de la rmugs pa dang /
translated: The five hindrances are desire for sensual objects, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: rgod pa dang ; the tshom khams gsum pa yin yang gcig tu mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa dang ; the tshom khams gsum pa yin yang gcig tu mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lethargy and excitation and doubt are concomitant with all five faculties.

original: 'dod na sgrib rnams /
analyzed: 'dod na sgrib rnams /
translated: The five hindrances are called hindrances in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i kho nar sgrib pa'i ming 'thob bo //🔽de la yang /🔽mi mthun dang / zad dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i kho nar sgrib pa'i ming 'thob bo // de la yang / mi mthun dang / zad dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir //
translated: They are called hindrances in the desire realm alone.🔽They are called hindrances because🔽they are incompatible,🔽they exhaust, and they have the same function.

original: gnyis gcig rmugs gnyid dag dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gcig yin te /
analyzed: gnyis gcig rmugs gnyid dag dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gcig yin te /
translated: Lethargy and sleep and excitation and regret are one.

original: mi mthun pa dang / zas dang / bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang / zas dang / bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the same counter-agent, the same nutriment, and the same task.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa dag gi mi mthun pa gcig ste /
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa dag gi mi mthun pa gcig ste /
translated: Sleep and sloth have the same counter-agent:

original: snang ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: snang ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: the idea of light.🔽They have the same nutriment:

original: zas gcig pa ni chos lnga ste /
analyzed: zas gcig pa ni chos lnga ste /
translated: five factors:

original: rmya ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / bya rmyang dang / kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmya ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / bya rmyang dang / kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
translated: weariness, dejection, fatigue, inability to control one’s limbs, and mental lassitude.

original: 'di dag gi bya ba yang gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bya ba yang gcig ste /
translated: They have the same task:

original: 'di gnyis kas kyang sems zhum par byed do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kas kyang sems zhum par byed do //
translated: both cause the mind to be unserviceable.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gi yang mi mthun pa gcig ste /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gi yang mi mthun pa gcig ste /
translated: Excitement and regret have the same counter-agent:

original: zhi gnas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas so //
translated: calmness.🔽They have the same nutriment:

original: zas gcig pa ni chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: zas gcig pa ni chos bzhi ste /
translated: four factors:

original: nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon rgod pa dang rtses pa dang // dga' ba dang / dga' mgur yongs su spyod pa rnams rjes su dran pa yin no //
analyzed: nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon rgod pa dang rtses pa dang // dga' ba dang / dga' mgur yongs su spyod pa rnams rjes su dran pa yin no //
translated: thinking about relatives, thinking about one’s native land, thinking about death, and remembering past amusements, pleasures, and delights.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bya ba yang gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bya ba yang gcig ste /
translated: They have the same task:🔽both cause the mind to be unserviceable.

original: 'di gnyis kas kyang sems rnam par ma zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kas kyang sems rnam par ma zhi bar byed do //
translated: Both of these disturb the mind.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang sgrib pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang sgrib pa yin na /
translated: If all the defilements are obscurations,

original: ci'i phyir lnga kho nar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lnga kho nar bshad ce na /
translated: why are only five stated?🔽Five are stated because they harm the aggregates,

original: phung po gnod byed dang / the tshom phyir na lnga nyid do //
analyzed: phung po gnod byed dang / the tshom phyir na lnga nyid do //
translated: because they are doubts.🔽Desire for sense-pleasures and malice harm the aggregate of morality;🔽torpor and sleep harm the aggregate of wisdom;

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dag gis ni shes rab kyi phung po la dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dag gis ni shes rab kyi phung po la dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: excitement and regret harm the aggregate of meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag med na bden pa dag la the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag med na bden pa dag la the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no meditative concentration and wisdom, one doubts the truths.

original: de'i phyir sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, they are stated first.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated:

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa @180a * //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa @180a * //
translated: The pervasive negative tendencies of the realms that are not of the same type, and those that are to be eliminated by seeing the truths of cessation and path, are not associated with the five aggregates.

original: dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams gang gi tshe dmigs pa yongs su shes pa de'i tshe spong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams gang gi tshe dmigs pa yongs su shes pa de'i tshe spong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: When one understands the object, one does not abandon it.

original: gang gi tshe spong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni dmigs pa yongs su mi shes na ji ltar de dag spong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni dmigs pa yongs su mi shes na ji ltar de dag spong zhe na /
translated: When one abandons it, one does not understand the object.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas zad par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas zad par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The defilements are not necessarily exhausted by the understanding of the object.🔽But,

original: 'on kyang / dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang // de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
analyzed: 'on kyang / dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang // de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
translated: by the understanding of the object, by the complete abandoning of the object,

original: zad dang dmigs pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: zad dang dmigs pa spangs pas so //
translated: by the abandoning of the object of the defilements.

original: de la dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rang gi sa la dmigs pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rang gi sa la dmigs pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: By the understanding of the object, one abandons the defilements which have a pure object for their object, and the defilements which have a stage for their object, namely, the defilements of the realm of immateriality.

original: de la dmigs pa rnams yang dag par zad pas ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnams yang dag par zad pas ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: By the complete abandoning of the object, one abandons the universal defilements of the realm of desire.

original: de la dmigs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin pas de spang na de dag kyang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin pas de spang na de dag kyang spangs pa yin no //
translated: The pervasive negative tendencies of the same realm focus on that, therefore, when that is abandoned, they are also abandoned.

original: dmigs pa spangs pas ni 'gog pa dang lam ma thob bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa spangs pas ni 'gog pa dang lam ma thob bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the focal object is abandoned, those that focus on contaminated states that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are eliminated.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni de dag gis dmigs pa yin pas de dag spangs na de dag kyang spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni de dag gis dmigs pa yin pas de dag spangs na de dag kyang spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that focus on uncontaminated states are their focal objects, therefore, when they are abandoned, those are also abandoned.

original: de ltar re zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams yin no //
translated: In this way, those that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are explained.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni /
translated: Those to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
translated: are eliminated by generating their antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gang gi gnyen po lam gang yin pa de skyes pas spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gang gi gnyen po lam gang yin pa de skyes pas spong bar byed do //
translated: The antidote to any aspect of affliction is the path that generates it.

original: de yang ni chen po'i chen po'i ni chung ngu'i chung ngus zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ni chen po'i chen po'i ni chung ngu'i chung ngus zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is explained by the statement, “The great of the great is abandoned by the small of the small” and so on.

original: gnyen po yang rnam pa du zhig ce na /🔽smras pa / gnyen po rnam la zhi spong ba dang // gzhi dang srid nyid rnam par ni //
analyzed: gnyen po yang rnam pa du zhig ce na / smras pa / gnyen po rnam la zhi spong ba dang // gzhi dang srid nyid rnam par ni //
translated: How many kinds of antidote are there?🔽It is said:🔽The antidote is of six kinds:

original: sun 'byin zhes bya //
analyzed: sun 'byin zhes bya //
translated: the pacifying, the abandoning, the basic, the distant,🔽the counteracting, and the complete clearing.

original: spong ba'i gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: spong ba'i gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The pacifying antidote is the uninterrupted path that abandons.

original: gzhi'i gnyen po ni de yan chad kyi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i gnyen po ni de yan chad kyi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The basic antidote is the antidote that is higher than that.

original: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam man chad kyi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam man chad kyi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The distant antidote is the antidote that is lower than the path of liberation.

original: sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni lam gang gis khams de la skyon du mthong nas rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni lam gang gis khams de la skyon du mthong nas rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: The counteracting antidote is the path by which one sees the realm as a fault and counteracts it.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba na gang las spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba na gang las spang bar bya zhe na /
translated: When afflictions are abandoned, from what are they abandoned?

original: dmigs pa las /
analyzed: dmigs pa las /
translated: From the focal object.

original: nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that afflictions are abandoned🔽from the focal object.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las nyon mongs pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las nyon mongs pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus la /
translated: It is not possible to separate afflictions from their concomitant states,

original: dmigs @180b pa las ni nus so //
analyzed: dmigs @180b pa las ni nus so //
translated: but it is possible from the focal object.

original: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo zhes bya bar sngar bshad pa de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo zhes bya bar sngar bshad pa de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The nature of remoteness has been explained above.

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mi mthun phyogs //
translated: It is by nature, by counteraction,

original: yul rnams chad dang dus kyis te //
analyzed: yul rnams chad dang dus kyis te //
translated: by object, by interruption, by time,

original: 'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
analyzed: 'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
translated: by origin, by morality, by direction,

original: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: and by the two times, like distance.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ring ba ni dper na 'byung ba chen po rnams lhan cig skyes pa yin yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ring ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ring ba ni dper na 'byung ba chen po rnams lhan cig skyes pa yin yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ring ba lta bu'o //
translated: Distance by nature is, for example, the great elements, which are simultaneous but distant because their natures are incompatible.

original: gnyen pos ring ba ni dper na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos ring ba ni dper na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims lta bu'o //
translated: Distance by counteraction is, for example, morality, which is distant from immorality.

original: yul gyis ring ba ni bskal pa'i yul rnams yul rnam par chad pas so //
analyzed: yul gyis ring ba ni bskal pa'i yul rnams yul rnam par chad pas so //
translated: Distance by object is, for example, the objects of the kalpas, which are distant because they are interrupted by other objects.

original: dus kyis ring ba ni dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus kyis ring ba ni dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Distance by time is, for example, the past and future, which are distant because they are separated by the present.

original: ci lam khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spangs pa yang dang yang du khyad par du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci lam khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spangs pa yang dang yang du khyad par du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do the abandonments of afflictions also become increasingly distinguished through the path of distinction?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: This is not so.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni /
translated: All the defilements

original: lan cig tu zad /
analyzed: lan cig tu zad /
translated: are abandoned at one time.

original: gang gis spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de kho nas zad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de kho nas zad pa yin no //
translated: The path by which one abandons is the path of immediate succession.

original: de dag gi / bral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang dus du zhig tu zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi / bral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang dus du zhig tu zhe na /
translated: How many times is the acquisition of the disconnection from these defilements obtained?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / drug tu ste /
analyzed: smras pa / drug tu ste /
translated: Six times,

original: gnyen po skye dang 'bras thob dang // dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su //
analyzed: gnyen po skye dang 'bras thob dang // dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su //
translated: when the antidote arises, when the fruit is obtained, when the faculties are upgraded.

original: gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: The antidote is the path of liberation.

original: 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dag go //
translated: The fruits are the fruits of the sramanera.

original: dbang po rnam par 'phel ba ni dbang po 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnam par 'phel ba ni dbang po 'pho ba'o //
translated: Upgrading the faculties is the upgrading of faculties.

original: dus de dag tu nyon mongs pa bral ba thob bo //
analyzed: dus de dag tu nyon mongs pa bral ba thob bo //
translated: The acquisition of disconnection from the defilements is obtained at these times.

original: bral ba de yang ni gnas skabs de dang de dag tu yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: bral ba de yang ni gnas skabs de dang de dag tu yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: And this disconnection is called perfect knowledge in these states.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: These are

original: yongs su shes dgu /
analyzed: yongs su shes dgu /
translated: nine perfect knowledges.

original: de la re zhig 'dod pa na /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dod pa na /
translated: First, in the desire realm,

original: dang po rnam gnyis zad la gcig //
analyzed: dang po rnam gnyis zad la gcig //
translated: two are abandoned by one.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na dang po'i rnam pa gnyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba gcig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na dang po'i rnam pa gnyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba gcig go //
translated: In the realm of desire, the abandonment of the two aspects of the first category, i.e., of the factors to be abandoned by insight into unsatisfactoriness and into the origin, is one complete knowledge.

original: gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
translated: The abandonment of the two other categories is two complete knowledges.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kho na na 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kho na na 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis so //
translated: In the realm of desire, the abandonment of the aspects of the factors to be abandoned by insight into cessation and into the path is two complete knowledges.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: As in the realm of desire, so in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: de bzhin gong ma de gsum nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gong ma de gsum nyid //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, the same three complete knowledges.

original: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug yin no //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the factors to be abandoned by insight in the three realms is six complete knowledges.

original: yongs su shes pa gzhan gsum ste //🔽tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang // zag pa kun zad /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gzhan gsum ste // tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang // zag pa kun zad /
translated: Three other complete knowledges:🔽the complete knowledge of the exhaustion of the impurities of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality, of the realm of immateriality.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa spong ba'i yongs su shes pa dang / gzugs kyi zag pa spong ba'i yongs su shes pa dang @181a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa spong ba'i yongs su shes pa dang / gzugs kyi zag pa spong ba'i yongs su shes pa dang @181a * //
translated: The complete knowledge of the abandonment of the impurities of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality, of the realm of immateriality.

original: zag pa thams cad spong ba'i yongs su shes pa 'di dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad spong ba'i yongs su shes pa 'di dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa gsum ste /
translated: These are the three perfect knowledges that abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sngar gyi drug dang dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi drug dang dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are six former and nine latter perfect knowledges.

original: de dag las kyang /🔽drug bzod 'bras /
analyzed: de dag las kyang / drug bzod 'bras /
translated: From among those,🔽six are results of perseverance.

original: snga ma dag go //🔽lhag ma dag ni shes pa yin //
analyzed: snga ma dag go // lhag ma dag ni shes pa yin //
translated: The former are results of perseverance ksantiphala.🔽The remainder are knowledge.

original: phyi ma gsum mo ;
analyzed: phyi ma gsum mo ;
translated: The latter three are knowledge.

original: / mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
analyzed: / mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
translated: The result of unrestricted access concentration is all.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga 'am brgyad //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga 'am brgyad //
translated: The results of the absorptions are five or eight.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pa lnga ste /
translated: According to the Vaibhasikas, the results of the absorptions are five perfect knowledges,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: which are by nature the abandonment of afflictions of the desire realm and the abandonment of afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis brgyad de /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis brgyad de /
translated: According to Bhadanta Ghoṣaka, there are eight perfect knowledges.

analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa yang bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa rnyed pa'i phyir /

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa drug ste /

analyzed: rjes kyi bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang dag yin pa kho na'o //

analyzed: ci'i phyir spangs pa re re yongs su shes par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /

analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig bzod pa'i 'bras bu bral ba ni /

analyzed: re zhig so so'i skye bo la ni bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo nyams par byed pa med do //

original: srid pa'i rtse mo nyams par byas pa med do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo nyams par byas pa med do //
translated: also do not obtain the uncontaminated state of separation and do not destroy the summit of existence for as long as they abide in perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la gnyis ka yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la gnyis ka yod do //
translated: But both exist for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu gnyis kun du bcom pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kun du bcom pa ni ma yin te /

translated: Since all three exist for other subsequent and conventional knowledge, they obtain the name complete knowledge of abandonment in those states.

original: shes pa'i 'bras bu ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu ni spangs pa ste /

original: rgyu gsum po de dang bzhi pa /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po de dang bzhi pa /
translated: The third and fourth causes are

analyzed: gang zhig yongs su shes pa du ma dang ldan zhe na /
translated: ” How many complete knowledges does one possess?
