translated: The ordinary worldling does not possess any complete knowledge.🔽The noble one, as long as he is not a candidate for the fruit of the second, up to the sixth,🔽possesses one complete knowledge when he is a candidate for the fruit of the second.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gnyis dang ldan no //🔽'gog pa la chos shes pa ni gsum dang ldan no //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gnyis dang ldan no // 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni gsum dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses two complete knowledges when he is a candidate for the fruit of the third.🔽He possesses three complete knowledges when he is a candidate for the fruit of the fourth.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni bzhi dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni bzhi dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses four complete knowledges when he is a candidate for the fruit of the third.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni lnga dang ldan no //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni lnga dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses five complete knowledges when he is a candidate for the fruit of the second.

original: bsgom la gnas pa drug gam ni //
analyzed: bsgom la gnas pa drug gam ni //
translated: The one who is in the path of cultivation possesses six,

original: gcig gam yang na gnyis dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig gam yang na gnyis dang ngo //
translated: one, or else two complete knowledges.

original: drug gis ni ji srid du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob pa'am /🔽de las yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: drug gis ni ji srid du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob pa'am / de las yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The first six are possessed by those who have not obtained detachment from the realm of desire, or who have retrograded from it.

original: sngon nam phyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ni gcig gis so //
analyzed: sngon nam phyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa ni gcig gis so //
translated: Those who have obtained detachment from the realm of desire either previously or later possess only one, the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob na yang gcig kho na dang ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob na yang gcig kho na dang ngo //
translated: When they obtain the status of perfected being, they possess only the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams na de yang gcig go //🔽gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa na gnyis dang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams na de yang gcig go // gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa na gnyis dang ngo //
translated: When they retrogress through the defilements of the realm of fine-materiality, they possess only the faculty of perfect knowledge.🔽When they obtain detachment from the realm of desire, they possess two faculties, the faculty of perfect knowledge and the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod ba'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams pa yang gnyis kho na dang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod ba'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams pa yang gnyis kho na dang ngo //
translated: When they retrogress through the defilements of the realm of immateriality, they possess two faculties, the faculty of perfect knowledge and the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown.

original: yang ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dag gi yongs su shes pa gcig kho nar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dag gi yongs su shes pa gcig kho nar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the perfect knowledges of the non-returners and of the perfected beings established as one single perfect knowledge?

original: 'di ltar / khams las 'dod chags bral ba dang // @182a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / khams las 'dod chags bral ba dang // @182a * //
translated: Because of the detachment from the realm of desire

original: 'bras bu thob phyir de dag bsdoms //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob phyir de dag bsdoms //
translated: and because of the acquisition of the fruit.

original: yongs su shes pa rnams sdom zhing gcig tu rnam par 'jog pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis yin la /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa rnams sdom zhing gcig tu rnam par 'jog pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis yin la /
translated: The totalities are established as one by two causes.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dag la 'di gnyis ka yod pas de'i phyir yongs su shes pa ni gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dag la 'di gnyis ka yod pas de'i phyir yongs su shes pa ni gcig ces bya'o //
translated: Since both of these exist for nonreturners and arhats, they are called one complete knowledge.

original: yang gang zhig gis yongs su shes pa du zhig gis gtong ngam 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig gis yongs su shes pa du zhig gis gtong ngam 'thob ce na /
translated: How many complete knowledges are relinquished or obtained by whom?

original: la la gcig gnyis lnga dang drug / gtong ste 'thob pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: la la gcig gnyis lnga dang drug / gtong ste 'thob pa lnga yin no //
translated: One, two, five or six are relinquished.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas ni gcig gtong ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas ni gcig gtong ngo //
translated: One complete knowledge is relinquished by the arhat or by one who regresses from freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams na yongs su shes pa gnyis gtong ngo //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams na yongs su shes pa gnyis gtong ngo //
translated: Two complete knowledges are relinquished by the nonreturner free of attachment to the form realm who regresses from freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba lam la rjes su shes pa ni lnga gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba lam la rjes su shes pa ni lnga gtong ngo //
translated: Five complete knowledges are relinquished by one previously freed from attachment who obtains perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: mthar gyis pa 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pas ni yongs su shes pa drug gtong ngo //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pas ni yongs su shes pa drug gtong ngo //
translated: Those who are detached from the desire realm by means of the serial approach relinquish six perfect knowledges.

original: de bzhin du thob pa yang la la ni yongs su shes pa kho na gcig thob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thob pa yang la la ni yongs su shes pa kho na gcig thob ste /
translated: Similarly, some obtain one perfect knowledge,

original: gang la la zhig gis sngon med pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang la la zhig gis sngon med pa thob pa'o //
translated: that is, those who obtain what has not been obtained before.

original: la la ni gnyis te /
analyzed: la la ni gnyis te /
translated: Some obtain two,

original: gang zhig gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig las yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig las yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: that is, those who degenerate from freedom from attachment to the formless realm.

original: kha cig gis ni drug ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni drug ste /
translated: Some obtain six,

original: gang zhig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: that is, those who degenerate from the result of nonreturn.

analyzed: lnga thob pa ni 'ga' yang med pa nyid do //
translated: But none obtain five.

original: phra rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa'o /
analyzed: phra rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa'o /
translated: This has been part V: The Exposition of the Negative Tendencies.

analyzed: // / ji skad du spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa'i ming 'thob po zhes bshad pa de yang /

analyzed: dben pa mthong ba bsgoms pa las //

analyzed: nyon mongs spangs pa zhes bshad pa //🔽de la yang /
translated: The explanation that abandonment is called perfect knowledge is from the perspective of the path of meditation.🔽The explanation that abandonment is called perfect knowledge is from the perspective of the path of meditation.

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te// mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na'o //

analyzed: bden pa mthong ba las zhes brjod de / de dag kyang /

analyzed: bden pa dag ni bzhir bshad do //

analyzed: gang du bshad ce na /

analyzed: chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang // zag pa med pa bstan par ro //

analyzed: der gang bshad pa'i rim pa ci de kho na yin na ma zhe na /

analyzed: ma yin te 'on kyang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung de bzhin du //
translated: Not in the order in which they are realized.

analyzed: 'gog dang lam ste de ltar na //

original: de dag gi rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni sngar ji skad bshad pa kho na bzhin no //

analyzed: 'di yang / de dag ji ltar mngon @182b rtogs kyis //🔽bden pa gang zhig sngar mngon par rtogs pa de sngar bstan to //

analyzed: gang gi tshe tshor ba'i phyogs gcig sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar na 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If one part of feeling is by nature suffering, then how can it be said that all contaminated formations are suffering?🔽Pleasant, unpleasant, and the other,

analyzed: yid 'ong yid du mi 'ong dang // de las gzhan zag bcas rnams nyid //
translated: which are contaminated,

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir //🔽ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir // ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
translated: are suffering because they possess the three kinds of suffering,🔽as appropriate, in their entirety.

analyzed: de la yid du 'ong ba dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis so //

analyzed: de dag las gzhan rnams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The other two are the truth of suffering and the truth of origin.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
analyzed: gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
translated: That which is destroyed by the mind or by other things,

original: bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
translated: If it is destroyed or mentally dissected, it is a conventional reality.

original: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
translated: Like a pot or water, it exists conventionally.

original: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
analyzed: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
translated: Otherwise, it is an ultimate reality.

original: gang la cha shas su bcom na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang la cha shas su bcom na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
translated: That which is destroyed or mentally dissected is a conventional reality.

original: dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot.

original: gang la blos chos gzhan bsal na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de yang kun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: gang la blos chos gzhan bsal na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de yang kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: That which is destroyed or mentally dissected by the intellect is also a conventional reality.

original: dper na chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, water.

original: de las gzhan ni don dam par yod de /
analyzed: de las gzhan ni don dam par yod de /
translated: Otherwise, it is an ultimate reality.🔽That which is not destroyed or mentally dissected by the intellect is an ultimate reality.

original: gang la bcom pa'am blos chos gzhan bsal yang de'i blo 'jug pa nyid ni dper na gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang la bcom pa'am blos chos gzhan bsal yang de'i blo 'jug pa nyid ni dper na gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, form.

original: de la ni rdul phra rab tu bcom yang rung /
analyzed: de la ni rdul phra rab tu bcom yang rung /
translated: In that case, even if it is destroyed into subtle atoms,

original: blos ro la sogs pa'i chos bsal yang rung /
analyzed: blos ro la sogs pa'i chos bsal yang rung /
translated: or even if the attributes of taste, etc., are mentally dissected,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: the cognition of the nature of form still occurs.

original: bden pa dag bshad nas ji ltar na de dag mthong bar 'gyur ba dang po 'jug pa las brtsams te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa dag bshad nas ji ltar na de dag mthong bar 'gyur ba dang po 'jug pa las brtsams te brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the truths, now, in order to show how they are seen, we will discuss the first stage of the path, beginning with the stage of application.

original: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
analyzed: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
translated: One who is established in morality, who is endowed with listening and reflection,

original: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: is engaged in cultivation.

original: bden pa rnams ma thong bar 'dod pas dang po kho nar tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
analyzed: bden pa rnams ma thong bar 'dod pas dang po kho nar tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
translated: One who desires to see the truths first of all guards morality.

original: de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i chos thos pa 'dzin pa'am don nyan par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i chos thos pa 'dzin pa'am don nyan par byed do //
translated: After that, he listens to the Dharma which is conducive to seeing the truths, or he reflects on its meaning.

original: thos pas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
analyzed: thos pas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
translated: Through listening, he reflects without error.

original: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Having reflected, he is engaged in cultivating concentration.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: And these are:

original: thes sogs las byung blo rnams ni //
analyzed: thes sogs las byung blo rnams ni //
translated: The cognitions that arise from listening, etc.

original: ming dang gnyis ka don yul can //
analyzed: ming dang gnyis ka don yul can //
translated: have names, both, and meanings as their objects.

original: thos pa las byung pa'i shes rab ni ming la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: thos pa las byung pa'i shes rab ni ming la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The wisdom that arises from listening has names as its object.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: That which arises from reflection has names and meanings as its objects.

original: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren @183a * //🔽par byed do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren @183a * // par byed do //
translated: Sometimes the letters lead to the meaning,

original: res 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed do //
translated: sometimes the meaning leads to the letters.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni don la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni don la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The wisdom born of meditation has as its object only the meaning.

original: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
translated: It is not dependent on the letter, but penetrates the meaning.

original: de ltar bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /🔽bsrings gnyis ldan /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na / bsrings gnyis ldan /
translated: How does one who is intent on such meditation complete the meditation?

original: gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir lus dang / sems dag gis bsrings pa yin na rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir lus dang / sems dag gis bsrings pa yin na rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is completed when the body and mind are distanced from the distractions and unwholesome thoughts.

original: 'o na bsrings pa de nyid su la sla zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bsrings pa de nyid su la sla zhe na /
translated: But for whom is this distancing easy?

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa la sla'i /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa la sla'i /
translated: It is easy for one who has few desires and is content.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can la ma yin no //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can la ma yin no //
translated: It is not easy for one who is discontented and has great desires.

original: chog mi shes pa ni gang zhig yin //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa ni gang zhig yin //
translated: What is discontent?

original: 'dod chen can ni gang zhig yin zhe na /🔽rnyed pa la sred chog mi shes //
analyzed: 'dod chen can ni gang zhig yin zhe na / rnyed pa la sred chog mi shes //
translated: What is having great desires?🔽Discontent is the craving for more acquisitions.

original: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
analyzed: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
translated: Having great desires is the desire for what has not been acquired.

original: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa la yang dang yang du 'dod pa ni chog mi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa la yang dang yang du 'dod pa ni chog mi shes pa yin la /
translated: The desire to obtain robes, etc., is discontent.

original: ma rnyed pa dag la de 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dag la de 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
translated: The desire to obtain what has not been obtained is great desire.

original: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / chog shes pa dang 'dod pa chung ba dag go //
analyzed: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / chog shes pa dang 'dod pa chung ba dag go //
translated: Their opposites are their remedies: contentment and fewness of desires.

original: de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
analyzed: de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
translated: They are in the three realms and are pure.

original: de'i gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Their remedies are their remedies.🔽Discontent and great desire exist in the realm of desire.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'dod chen chung ba dang / chog shes pa 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'dod chen chung ba dang / chog shes pa 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of these two, fewness of desires and contentment?

original: ma chags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma chags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are nonattachment.

original: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //🔽'phags rigs / ma chags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no // 'phags rigs / ma chags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They are by nature nonattachment.🔽The four noble lineages are nonattachment.

original: 'di dag las 'phags pa rnams skye bas na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag las 'phags pa rnams skye bas na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi'o //
translated: The noble lineages are so called because the noble ones are born from them.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among them,

original: gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
translated: three are by nature contentment.

original: dang po gsum po chos gos dang // bsod snyoms dang / mal stan gyis chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po gsum po chos gos dang // bsod snyoms dang / mal stan gyis chog shes pa'o //
translated: The first three are the contentment of the monk who has the three robes, who begs for alms, and who has a straw mat for his bed.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa dag la dga' ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa dag la dga' ba nyid yin no //
translated: The fourth is the delight in the practice of abandoning and of meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i rigs bzhis ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i rigs bzhis ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What does the Blessed One teach by means of the four noble lineages?

original: gsum gyis tshul bstan tha ma las //🔽rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa dag la gnyis bcas te /
analyzed: gsum gyis tshul bstan tha ma las // rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa dag la gnyis bcas te /
translated: The first three are the means; the fourth is the end.🔽The first three lineages are the means for obtaining the fourth lineage.🔽The first three lineages are the means, because they are the means for obtaining the fourth lineage.

original: gsum gyis ni tshul dang / bzhi pas ni las so //🔽bcas pa de yang /🔽sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni tshul dang / bzhi pas ni las so // bcas pa de yang / sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir //
translated: The fourth is the end, because it is the end of the means.🔽The Blessed One teaches the four noble lineages in order to cure the four kinds of craving.

original: sred pa skye ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: sred pa skye ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of craving:

original: chos gos la sogs pa gsum dang / sred pa med pa la bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa gsum dang / sred pa med pa la bzhi pa'o //
translated: craving for the three robes, etc. , and craving for the absence of craving.

original: de dag gi gnyen por 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi bstan te /
translated: The four noble lineages are the antidotes to these four kinds of craving.

original: bdag gir bdag @183b 'dzin dngos 'dod pa //
analyzed: bdag gir bdag @183b 'dzin dngos 'dod pa //
translated: The first three lineages are the antidotes to the first three kinds of craving.🔽The fourth lineage is the antidote to craving for the absence of craving.🔽The first three lineages are the means for obtaining the fourth lineage.

original: de yi dus dang gtan bzhi'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi dus dang gtan bzhi'i phyir //
translated: The fourth lineage is the end of the means.

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The things that are grasped as mine are the robes, etc.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni lus so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni lus so //
translated: The things that are grasped as the self are the body, etc.

original: de dag la 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Desire for them is craving.

original: de la bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa de'i dus su zhi bar byed pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa de'i dus su zhi bar byed pa gsum mo //
translated: The three that pacify desire for the things that are grasped as mine are the first three.

original: gnyis ka la 'dod pa gtan du zhi bar byed ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la 'dod pa gtan du zhi bar byed ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the one that completely pacifies desire for both.

original: de ltar snod du gyur pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa de la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar snod du gyur pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa de la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one who has become a proper vessel enter into the cultivation of these?

original: de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yin //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yin //
translated: The entry to it is through the meditation on the impurities and on the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.

original: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
translated: The rest is for the sake of eliminating discursive thought.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags nye ba dang shin tu spyad pa de ni mi sdug pas 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags nye ba dang shin tu spyad pa de ni mi sdug pas 'jug go //
translated: One who is overcome by desire and who is greatly habituated to it enters through the meditation on the impurities.

original: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa spyad pa de ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa spyad pa de ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug go //
translated: One who is habituated to discursive thought enters through the meditation on the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.

original: de la 'dod chags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Desire is of four types:

original: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg pa'i 'dod chags dang / bsnyen bkur gyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg pa'i 'dod chags dang / bsnyen bkur gyi 'dod chags so //
translated: attachment to color, attachment to shape, attachment to contact, and attachment to service.

original: de dag la bye brag med par shis pa ni /🔽keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
analyzed: de dag la bye brag med par shis pa ni / keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
translated: The general antidote to all of these is🔽the meditation on a skeleton.🔽For all those who are attached,

original: rus pa'i keng rus la ni chags pa'i bzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag thams cad med do //
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus la ni chags pa'i bzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag thams cad med do //
translated: there is no skeleton.

original: de yang mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de ni rnam pa gsum du brjod de /
analyzed: de yang mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de ni rnam pa gsum du brjod de /
translated: The yogi/nī who meditates on the repulsive is said to be of three types:

original: las dang po pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: beginner, one who has completed the training, and one who has completed the mental focus.🔽The beginner is one who

original: de la / rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni//🔽spro zhing sdud pas las dang po //
analyzed: de la / rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni// spro zhing sdud pas las dang po //
translated: expands and contracts the skeleton up to the ocean.

original: mi sdug pa bsgom par 'dod pas ni rang gi yan lag la sems gtod de /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom par 'dod pas ni rang gi yan lag la sems gtod de /
translated: One who wishes to meditate on the repulsive should focus the mind on one’s own body part.

original: de der sha myags shing zags par mos pa na rim gyis rus pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pas thams cad rus pa'i keng rus su lta zhing de bzhin du yang gnyis pa la mos pa byed pa nas /
analyzed: de der sha myags shing zags par mos pa na rim gyis rus pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pas thams cad rus pa'i keng rus su lta zhing de bzhin du yang gnyis pa la mos pa byed pa nas /
translated: When he has imagined that the flesh is rotting and falling from that skeleton, then he gradually purifies the bones, and he sees the whole world as a skeleton.

original: gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / grong dang / zhing gi bar nas rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mtha' klas pa'i bar gyi sa gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang bar mos par byed do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / grong dang / zhing gi bar nas rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mtha' klas pa'i bar gyi sa gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang bar mos par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he imagines a second skeleton, and so on, until he imagines the whole earth filled with skeletons as far as the ocean.

original: yang mos pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du yang sdud na sems bsdu ba'i phyir keng rus gcig bu kho na la mos pa'i bar du sdud de /
analyzed: yang mos pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du yang sdud na sems bsdu ba'i phyir keng rus gcig bu kho na la mos pa'i bar du sdud de /
translated: And again, in order to increase his imagination, he reduces it, in order to concentrate his mind, to the point where he imagines only one skeleton.

original: 'di tsam gyis na las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //🔽keng rus nas ni thod phyed bar //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // keng rus nas ni thod phyed bar //
translated: This much is the complete practice for the beginner.

original: btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //
analyzed: btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //
translated: The purification is said to be done by abandoning the half-skeleton.

original: de yang sems bsdus pa khyad par du byed pa'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus pa rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing /
analyzed: de yang sems bsdus pa khyad par du byed pa'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus pa rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing /
translated: The skeleton is the object of meditation for one who is a beginner.🔽In order to perfect the mind’s concentration, one should discard the bones of the feet and focus the mind on the remaining bones.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis thod pa'i phyed kyi bar por nas yid la byed pa 'di ni @184a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis thod pa'i phyed kyi bar por nas yid la byed pa 'di ni @184a * //
translated: In the same way, one should discard the bones of the legs, the thighs, and so on, up to the skull.

original: yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete training.

original: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas //
analyzed: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas //
translated: When one focuses the mind on the space between the eyebrows,

original: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin //
analyzed: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin //
translated: one has perfected the mental focus.

original: de thod pa'i phyed kyang bar nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin pa 'di ni yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de thod pa'i phyed kyang bar nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin pa 'di ni yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: When one discards even the skull and focuses the mind on the space between the eyebrows, one has perfected the mental focus.

original: yang mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin /🔽sa ni du pa zhig yin /
analyzed: yang mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin / sa ni du pa zhig yin /
translated: What is the nature of this meditation on foulness?🔽On what level does it exist?

original: dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What is its object?

original: gang du ni skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang du ni skyed par byed ce na /
translated: Where does it arise?

original: go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du /
translated: In order,🔽foulness is nonattachment, on ten levels,

original: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang // dmigs pa 'dod snang mi skyed do //
analyzed: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang // dmigs pa 'dod snang mi skyed do //
translated: and does not arise with respect to the desire realm.

original: mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ni ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ni ma chags pa'o //
translated: The nature of this meditation on foulness is nonattachment.

original: sa ni bcu pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni bcu pa ste /
translated: It exists on ten levels.

original: bsam gtan bzhi yi nyer bsdogs dang // bsam gtan khyad par can dang bcas pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yi nyer bsdogs dang // bsam gtan khyad par can dang bcas pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
translated: The mindfulness of breathing is associated with four meditations, with the threshold of the first meditation, with the special meditation, and with the realm of desire.

original: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs so //
translated: Its object is the color and shape of the realm of desire.

original: mi kho na las skye ba'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi kho na las skye ba'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is produced only by humans, not by others.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ming kho nas grub po //🔽mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to //🔽dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ming kho nas grub po // mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to // dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni //
translated: The mindfulness of breathing is called “loathsome” because it is the antidote to attachment.🔽The loathsome is of two types: the loathsome as object, and the loathsome as meditation.🔽The mindfulness of breathing is associated with five consciousnesses.

original: shes rabs lnga spyod yul rlung //
analyzed: shes rabs lnga spyod yul rlung //
translated: The mindfulness of breathing is associated with five consciousnesses, namely, those of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: 'dod rten dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs rngub pa ste rlung 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //🔽dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod rten dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs rngub pa ste rlung 'jug pa gang yin pa'o // dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mindfulness of breathing is associated with the five consciousnesses, because it has for its support the five sensefaculties of the realm of desire.🔽The mindfulness of breathing is associated with the five consciousnesses, because it has for its support the five sensefaculties of the realm of desire.

original: de gnyis dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa ste /🔽de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa ste /🔽de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The mindfulness of breathing is associated with the five consciousnesses, because it has for its support the five sensefaculties of the realm of desire.

original: dran ba zhes smos pa ni de'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran ba zhes smos pa ni de'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “mindfulness” is mentioned because it is through the power of mindfulness that one enters into this concentration.

original: sa lnga ni nyer bsdogs pa gsum dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang // 'dod pa'i khams na yod de /
analyzed: sa lnga ni nyer bsdogs pa gsum dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang // 'dod pa'i khams na yod de /
translated: This concentration exists in five stages: three access concentrations, the intermediate concentration, and the realm of desire.

original: btang snyoms dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with equanimity.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni rlung yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni rlung yin no //
translated: Its object is the wind.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin te /
translated: It has the realm of desire as its basis.

original: lta dang mi dag gi nang du bskyed do ;🔽/ chos 'di pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi byi ba'i ma yin no //
analyzed: lta dang mi dag gi nang du bskyed do ; / chos 'di pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi byi ba'i ma yin no //
translated: It is produced among humans.🔽It belongs only to those who are faithful and to those who are intellectuals.

original: lud med pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis chos thab mo mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yang / bgrang la sogs pa rnam pa drug / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa 'di //
analyzed: lud med pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis chos thab mo mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro // de yang / bgrang la sogs pa rnam pa drug / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa 'di //
translated: It is not for those who are of indeterminate nature, because they are not interested in the truth, and because they do not understand the teaching by themselves.🔽This mindfulness of breathing is sixfold, counting, etc.

original: bgrang dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // rtog pa dang ni sgyur ba dang // yongs dag rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: bgrang dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // rtog pa dang ni sgyur ba dang // yongs dag rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: Counting, following, fixing, observing, modifying, and purifying are considered the six aspects of this mindfulness of breathing.

original: de la bgrang ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba gang la sems gtang nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bgrang ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba gang la sems gtang nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Counting is when the mind is placed on the inhalation and exhalation of the breath, and without any mental activity, one counts from one to two up to ten, just with the body and mind.

original: sems mngon par sdud pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang / @184b nyung ngur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems mngon par sdud pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang / @184b nyung ngur ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not count too many or too few, for fear of drawing the mind inward or of distraction.

original: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yengs na yang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang par bya'o //
analyzed: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yengs na yang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang par bya'o //
translated: If the mind is distracted in the middle, one should begin again from the beginning until samādhi is attained.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni 'di dag thag ji srid cig tu 'byung ngam 'jug ces dbugs 'byung ba'i 'gros kyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni 'di dag thag ji srid cig tu 'byung ngam 'jug ces dbugs 'byung ba'i 'gros kyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Following is when one follows the exhalation of the breath, thinking, “How far does this go?”

original: 'jig pa ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mtho bong gi bar du gnas par lta zhing /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mtho bong gi bar du gnas par lta zhing /
translated: Dispersal is when one sees the breath as if it were a string of pearls, from the tip of the nose to the toes.

original: ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam gnod par byed pa zhig ces rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam gnod par byed pa zhig ces rtog pa'o //
translated: One then reflects, Are they beneficial or harmful?🔽One then reflects, They are not just wind, but also the great elements and the form derived from the great elements, and also the five aggregates, which are the mind and mental factors that depend on them.🔽One then turns away from the external object and reflects, The body is not pure, it is impure.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just impure, but also a cause of desire for one who is attached to it.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of desire, but also a cause of anger.

original: nye bar rtogs pa ni 'di dag rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'byung ba chen po dag dang 'byung ba dag las mngon par grub pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag la brten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lnga la nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //🔽sgyur ba ni phyi rol du dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur te /
analyzed: nye bar rtogs pa ni 'di dag rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'byung ba chen po dag dang 'byung ba dag las mngon par grub pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag la brten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lnga la nye bar rtog par byed pa'o // sgyur ba ni phyi rol du dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur te /
translated: One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of desire and anger, but also a cause of delusion.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of desire, anger, and delusion, but also a cause of pride and other defilements.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of desire, anger, delusion, pride, and other defilements, but also a cause of the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on.

original: chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par spyad par bya'o //🔽yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs par 'jug pa'o //🔽de la yang /🔽dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par spyad par bya'o // yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs par 'jug pa'o // de la yang / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //
translated: One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, but also a cause of the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant, and not obtaining what one desires.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, but also a cause of the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant, and not obtaining what one desires, and also a cause of the suffering of the five aggregates.

original: lus gang gi sa pa yin pa de'i sa pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus gang gi sa pa yin pa de'i sa pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, but also a cause of the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant, and not obtaining what one desires, and also a cause of the suffering of the five aggregates, and also a cause of the suffering of the three realms.🔽One then reflects, The body is not just a cause of the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, but also a cause of the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant, and not obtaining what one desires, and also a cause of the suffering of the five aggregates

original: sems can zhes bya ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ma zin pa'o //
translated: The expression sentient being refers to the non-appropriated.

original: dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinct from the sense-faculties.

original: rgyu mthun las byung /
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung /
translated: It is derived from the cause of natural outcome.

original: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad nas yang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no //🔽'og ma yi /
analyzed: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad nas yang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no // 'og ma yi /
translated: It is not derived from the cause of accumulation or the cause of retribution, because it diminishes through the growth of the body and because it is reconnected after having been interrupted.

original: yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so //
translated: The mental faculty of a lower stage does not cognize these two.🔽The mental faculty of a lower stage does not cognize these two, the life faculty and the mental faculty of a higher stage.

original: de gnyis ni rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma'i sems kyis rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma'i sems kyis rtogs kyi /
translated: The mental faculty of a higher stage and the mental faculty of its own stage cognize it.

original: 'og ma spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'og ma spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so //
translated: The mental faculty of a lower stage, i.e., the mental faculty of the realm of desire, does not cognize the life faculty and the mental faculty of the first meditation, etc.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to //
translated: The two doors of entry have been explained.

original: de gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: Having obtained concentration through these two,

original: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish insight,

original: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
translated: one who has accomplished calm

original: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //
translated: should cultivate the applications of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one cultivate them?🔽With regard to the body,🔽feeling,

original: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //
analyzed: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //
translated: mind, and the factors.

original: mtshan nyid gnyis su yongs brtags pas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis su yongs brtags pas //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are investigated in terms of their characteristics, their focal objects, their qualities, their order, their cultivation, and their attainment.🔽The four foundations of mindfulness are investigated in terms of their characteristics, their focal objects, their qualities, their order, their cultivation, and their attainment.🔽What are their characteristics?🔽The four foundations of mindfulness are investigated in terms of their characteristics, their focal objects, their qualities, their order, their cultivation, and their attainment.🔽What are their characteristics?🔽The body, feelings, mind, and mental objects are investigated in terms of their general and specific characteristics.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid /🔽dag tu yongs su brtags pa ste //🔽de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid / dag tu yongs su brtags pa ste // de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The specific characteristics of the body, feelings, mind, and mental objects are their individual natures.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams sdug bsngal nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid dag go //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams sdug bsngal nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid dag go //
translated: Their general characteristics are that all conditioned things are impermanent, all contaminated things are suffering, and all phenomena are empty and without a self.

original: lus kyi ngo bo ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //🔽gsum las gzhan bdag @185a * //
analyzed: lus kyi ngo bo ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do // gsum las gzhan bdag @185a * //
translated: The body is by nature the elements and what is derived from the elements.🔽The mind is the six collections of consciousness.

original: ni chos so //
analyzed: ni chos so //
translated: Mental objects are the phenomena that are neither corporeal nor mental.🔽What is their focal object?🔽The body, feelings, mind, and mental objects are the focal objects of the foundations of mindfulness.🔽What are their qualities?🔽The foundations of mindfulness have the qualities of nonapprehending, nontransgression, nonadherence, and nondistraction.

original: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is their order?🔽The order of the foundations of mindfulness is that of their grossness, defilement, container, and so on.🔽What is their cultivation?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness is fourfold:🔽cultivation as the investigation of phenomena,🔽cultivation as the undertaking of vigilance,🔽cultivation as the undertaking of what is wholesome, and

original: rang bzhin dang / 'brel pa dang / dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽shes rab thos sogs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'brel pa dang / dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽shes rab thos sogs las byung ba'o //
translated: cultivation as the purification of one’s attitude and conduct.🔽What is their attainment?🔽The attainment of the foundations of mindfulness is the attainment of their absence of defilement and their purity.🔽What is the foundation of mindfulness that is the investigation of phenomena?

original: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //
translated: The others are related to it and have it as their object.

original: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness that is by nature wisdom is the application of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: gzhan de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams 'brel pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams 'brel pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The others are the applications of mindfulness of the factors that are related to it.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The object of those is the application of mindfulness of the object.

original: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin //
analyzed: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin //
translated: The order is according to the order in which they arise.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar skye zhe na /
translated: Why do they arise in that order?

original: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the gross is seen first.

original: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
translated: Four are taught as the antidotes to the four errors.

original: gtsang ba dang bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: gtsang ba dang bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness are taught in order as the antidotes to the four errors of purity, happiness, permanence, and a self.

original: de ltar lus la sogs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams goms par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus la sogs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams goms par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having cultivated the applications of mindfulness with regard to the body and so on,

original: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //
analyzed: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //
translated: one then abides in the application of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
translated: One abides in the observation of the general characteristics of the body and so on.

original: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta'o //
translated: One views them as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'dres pa la dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'dres pa la dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: One abides in the combined focal object of the close placements of mindfulness.

original: lus la sogs pa de dag thams cad spyir bsdus te rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa de dag thams cad spyir bsdus te rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
translated: One views all of those, the body, etc., in general, in four aspects.

original: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
analyzed: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
translated: From that, the state of heat arises.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de ltar goms pa las rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba skye'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de ltar goms pa las rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba skye'o //
translated: From the cultivation of the close placements of mindfulness in that way, the root of the wholesome called heat arises in stages.

original: de ni bden bzhi'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: de ni bden bzhi'i spyod yul can //
translated: It has the four truths as its object field.

original: dro bar gyur pa de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is continuous, heat has the four truths as its object field.

original: rnam pa bcu drug sdug bsngal la sogs pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug sdug bsngal la sogs pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has sixteen aspects, because each of the four truths has four aspects, such as impermanence, etc.

original: dro ba las /
analyzed: dro ba las /
translated: From heat,🔽the peak arises.

original: rtse mo // dro ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba la rtse mo dag skye ste /
analyzed: rtse mo // dro ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba la rtse mo dag skye ste /
translated: The peak arises from the increase of heat in stages, that is, small, medium, and great.

original: de yang de dang 'dra /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra /
translated: It is similar to that.

original: ji ltar dro bar gyur pa rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa bcu drug yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dro bar gyur pa rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa bcu drug yin pa bzhin te /
translated: Just as the heat element focuses on the four truths and has sixteen aspects, so too do the summit and so on.🔽

original: chos mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na ming gzhan du btags so //🔽gnyis ka chos kyis rnam pa gtod //🔽dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / 'di gnyis ka chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas nye bar gtod par byed ba ni /
analyzed: chos mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na ming gzhan du btags so // gnyis ka chos kyis rnam pa gtod // dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / 'di gnyis ka chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas nye bar gtod par byed ba ni /
translated: The stages of heat and peak are like the stage of receptivity, but they are called heat and peak because they are the best of the best.🔽The two, heat and peak, are directed by the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: dang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o //
translated: They are directed by the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas because they are the first to set the aspects of the four truths.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed do //
translated: They are increased by the others.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyis kyang de dag 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyis kyang de dag 'phel bar byed do //
translated: They are increased by the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: rnam par 'phel bar @185b byed pa na sngon thob pa rnams mngon sum du mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar @185b byed pa na sngon thob pa rnams mngon sum du mi byed de /
translated: When they are increased, previously obtained states are not manifested.

original: dga' ba chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no great joy.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i rim gyis 'phel ba dag las /
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i rim gyis 'phel ba dag las /
translated: They are increased in stages of small, medium, and great.

original: de las bzod pa yang skye ste /
analyzed: de las bzod pa yang skye ste /
translated: From that, acceptance is born.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, by not retrogressing, one has a great acceptance of the Truths.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This acceptance is threefold:🔽weak, middling, strong.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //🔽de la rnam pa gnyis de bzhin //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o // de la rnam pa gnyis de bzhin //
translated: The weak and middling are like the summit.

original: rtse mo rnams ji skad bshad pa ltar bzod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rtse mo rnams ji skad bshad pa ltar bzod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The weak and middling acceptance of the Truths are like the weak and middling summit.

original: de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are like the summit, for they are directed to the same object.

original: rnam par 'phel ba la ni khang par 'di yod do //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba la ni khang par 'di yod do //
translated: But they differ from the summit in that they are increased.

original: bzod pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa ni /
translated: Acceptance is increased

original: thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed//🔽chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho nas 'phel bar byed kyi /

original: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are included in the unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption, the special first absorption, and the four actual absorptions.

original: gnyis ni 'og na 'ang yod pa'am //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'og na 'ang yod pa'am //
translated: The two latter stages are also in the lower stages.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi ltar na /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi ltar na /

original: dang po gnyis ni sa bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni sa bdun pa yin te /

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yod do //
translated: and they also exist in the desire realm.

original: de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang /

analyzed: 'dod rten mi kho na las skyed par byed pa'o //

analyzed: gsum ni skyes pa dang bud med kyis gnyis ka'i rten can dag 'thob po //

original: chos mchog bud med kyis /
analyzed: chos mchog bud med kyis /
translated: Females obtain the supreme mundane state

original: gnyis ka'i rten can 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rten can 'thob par 'gyur //

original: chos kyi mchog ni bud med kyis gnyis ka'i rten can 'thob la /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ni bud med kyis gnyis ka'i rten can 'thob la /
translated: Females obtain the supreme mundane state as a basis of both.

original: skyes pas ni skyes pa'i rten 'ba' zhig 'thob ste /
analyzed: skyes pas ni skyes pa'i rten 'ba' zhig 'thob ste /
translated: Males obtain it as a basis of males alone,

original: bud med nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the female organ.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ji ltar gtong zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ji ltar gtong zhe na /
translated: How are the factors conducive to penetrative insight relinquished?

original: 'phags pas de dag sa bor nas //🔽gtong ngo // 'phags pa ni sa gang thob par gyur pa'i sa de dag 'dor ba na /
analyzed: 'phags pas de dag sa bor nas // gtong ngo // 'phags pa ni sa gang thob par gyur pa'i sa de dag 'dor ba na /
translated: Aryas relinquish them by discarding the stage.

original: de dag kyang gtong ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang gtong ngo //
translated: Aryas relinquish those factors conducive to penetrative insight when they discard the stage on which they obtained them.

original: sa 'dor ba ni sa 'phos pa las so //
analyzed: sa 'dor ba ni sa 'phos pa las so //
translated: Discarding the stage is due to relocating to another stage.

original: 'phags min 'chi 'pho bas so //
analyzed: 'phags min 'chi 'pho bas so //
translated: because of death and falling away of the ordinary worldling.

original: so so'i skye bo ni 'chi ba kho nas gtong ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni 'chi ba kho nas gtong ngo //
translated: The ordinary worldling loses the receptivity through death alone.

original: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang //
analyzed: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang //
translated: The first two also through retrogressing.

original: 'chi bas kyang gtong ste /
analyzed: 'chi bas kyang gtong ste /
translated: One also loses the receptivity through death.

original: so so'i skye bo kho na'o //🔽dngos gzhi'i de nyid la bden mthong //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo kho na'o // dngos gzhi'i de nyid la bden mthong //
translated: But only the ordinary worldling.🔽One who has seen the truths in this life necessarily sees them again in this life.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the summit of cyclic existence necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with all cyclic existence.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of desire necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of desire.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed pa des ni tshe de nyid la gdon mi za bar bden pa rnams mthong bar 'gyur te /🔽yid 'byung shas che ba'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par nyams na sngon med 'thob //
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed pa des ni tshe de nyid la gdon mi za bar bden pa rnams mthong bar 'gyur te / yid 'byung shas che ba'i phyir ro // rnam par nyams na sngon med 'thob //
translated: One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of fine-materiality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of fine-materiality.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of immateriality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of immateriality.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of desire necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of desire.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of fine-materiality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of fine-materiality.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of immateriality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of immateriality.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par nyams pa dag kyang su thob pa de'i tshe sngon med pa dag kho na 'thob kyi sngon btang ba dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par nyams pa dag kyang su thob pa de'i tshe sngon med pa dag kho na 'thob kyi sngon btang ba dag ni ma yin no //
translated: One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of desire necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of desire.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of fine-materiality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of fine-materiality.🔽One who has produced the receptivity of the stages conducive to insight of the realm of immateriality necessarily sees the truths in this very life, because of the intensity of the disgust with the realm of immateriality.

original: rnam par nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /🔽nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /🔽nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa /
translated: What is the nature of retrogressing and falling away?

original: nyams pa de gnyis ka yang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no //🔽rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
analyzed: nyams pa de gnyis ka yang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no // rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
translated: These two, the summit and receptivity, are by nature not subject to retrogressing.🔽One who has attained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots.

original: rtse mo thob ba ni yongs su nyams kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du mi 'chad do //
analyzed: rtse mo thob ba ni yongs su nyams kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du mi 'chad do //
translated: One who has attained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots even by retrogressing.

original: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
translated: One who has attained receptivity does not go to the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: bzod pa las ni rnam par nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: bzod pa las ni rnam par nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
translated: One who has attained receptivity does not go to the unfortunate planes of existence even by retrogressing.

original: der 'gro ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has distanced himself from the actions and defilements which lead to them.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag kyang rigs gsum yin te //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag kyang rigs gsum yin te //
translated: These are also of three families.

original: de la / gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //🔽sangs rgyas su @186b 'gyur ;
analyzed: de la / gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni // sangs rgyas su @186b 'gyur ;
translated: The two, the summit and receptivity, are of the family of the śrāvaka.🔽The summit and receptivity are of the family of the śrāvaka.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo skyes pa nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid do //🔽gzhan gsum yang /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo skyes pa nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid do // gzhan gsum yang /
translated: The summit and receptivity are of the family of the śrāvaka.🔽The other three are of the family of the Buddha.

original: gsum yang nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas sangs rgyas las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum yang nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas sangs rgyas las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The other three are of the family of the Buddha.🔽The other three, i.e., heat, the summit and receptivity, are of the family of the Buddha.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams ni bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams ni bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: The lineage of pratyekabuddhas cannot be averted.

original: 'di ltar / ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
translated: The rhinoceros-like, after seeing the teacher,

original: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //
translated: attain all in one sitting, based on the last absorption.

original: sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa kho na la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las bzung ste /🔽byang chub kyi bar du skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa kho na la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las bzung ste / byang chub kyi bar du skyed par byed do //
translated: Buddhas and pratyekabuddhas definitely generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on up to enlightenment in the fourth absorption alone.

original: gzhan dag na re mi sdug pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mi sdug pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Others say: They do so from the stage of the fourth absorption to the stage of nothingness.

original: byang chub kyi bar du'o zhe'o //🔽ci tshe dang po kho na la sbyor ba byas te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du'o zhe'o // ci tshe dang po kho na la sbyor ba byas te /
translated: Others say: They do so from the stage of the fourth absorption to the stage of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyed par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyed par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Do they generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the first lifetime alone, having prepared for them in that lifetime?

original: de lta bu ni med kyi nges par /🔽de yi sngon du thar cha mthun //
analyzed: de lta bu ni med kyi nges par / de yi sngon du thar cha mthun //
translated: No, they do not.🔽They generate the factors conducive to liberation🔽prior to that.

original: skyed par byed do //🔽thams cad las shin tu /
analyzed: skyed par byed do // thams cad las shin tu /
translated: They generate the factors conducive to liberation prior to that.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the second lifetime.

original: myur bar srid pa gsum gyi mthar //
analyzed: myur bar srid pa gsum gyi mthar //
translated: They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the third lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the fourth lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the fifth lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the sixth lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the seventh lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the eighth lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the ninth lifetime.🔽They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in the tenth lifetime.

original: sa bon 'debs pa dang / 'bru skye ba dang ; 'bras bu chags pa bzhin du tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sa bon 'debs pa dang / 'bru skye ba dang ; 'bras bu chags pa bzhin du tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed do //
translated: The root of virtue that is conducive to liberation is like a seed, that conducive to penetrativeness is like the sprout, and the noble path is like the stalk, leaves, branches, and so on.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa de yang /🔽thos bsams las byung /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa de yang / thos bsams las byung /
translated: The root of virtue that is conducive to liberation is

original: yin par brjod de /
analyzed: yin par brjod de /
translated: said to arise from hearing and reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ma yin no//
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ma yin no//
translated: It does not arise from meditation.

original: las gsum mo //
analyzed: las gsum mo //
translated: It is the three actions.

original: gtso bor ni yid kyi las so //
analyzed: gtso bor ni yid kyi las so //

analyzed: de'i smon lam gyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las kyang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin no //

original: de yang 'di /
analyzed: de yang 'di /
translated: Moreover, this root of virtue

analyzed: mi yi nang nas 'phen par byed // mi kho na'i nang du ste /

original: gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: It is projected among humans, not elsewhere,

analyzed: ci rigs par shes rab dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhar las 'ongs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhar las 'ongs pa bshad nas /

analyzed: gnas skabs kyi 'bad par bya ste /
translated: one should make effort in the present context.

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //
translated: From the supreme mundane state,

original: chos kyi bzod pa zag pa med //
analyzed: chos kyi bzod pa zag pa med //

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog gi mjug thogs su chos shes pa'i bzod pa zag pa med pa skye'o //

original: dmigs pa gang la zhe na /🔽'dod sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la zhe na / 'dod sdug bsngal la /

analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal lo //

original: de nas ni /
analyzed: de nas ni /

original: de nyid la chos shes /
analyzed: de nyid la chos shes /

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de kho na la chos shes pa skye'o //

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal lhag la rjes bzod shes //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal lhag la rjes bzod shes //
translated: Similarly, one has subsequent acceptance and knowledge of the remaining suffering.
