analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa spyi la dmigs pa skye'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the suffering of the form and formless realms arises.

original: @187a * // de nas ni rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: @187a * // de nas ni rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Then, subsequent knowledge arises.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang shes pa bzhi po de dag skye ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang shes pa bzhi po de dag skye ba ltar /
translated: so do the four aspects of acceptance and knowledge

original: bden pa gsum la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bden pa gsum la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: with regard to the three truths.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dag la 'dod pa'i khams dang gong mar chos dang chos su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dag la 'dod pa'i khams dang gong mar chos dang chos su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
translated: With regard to the truths of origin, cessation, and path, there are the four aspects of acceptance and knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge in the desire realm and higher realms.

original: de ltar bden pa mngon rtogs 'di //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa mngon rtogs 'di //
translated: Thus, this clear realization of the truths

original: sems bcu drug go //
analyzed: sems bcu drug go //
translated: is sixteen moments of mind.

original: rim pa des na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sems bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: rim pa des na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sems bcu drug yin no //
translated: In this way, this clear realization of the truths is sixteen moments of mind.

original: de ni rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: mthong dmigs bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong dmigs bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that which is called seeing, focusing, and acting.

original: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyis bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyis bden pa rnams so //
translated: The clear realization of seeing is the four truths by means of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The clear realization of focusing is by means of those concomitant with it.

original: bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshul khrims dang skye ba la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshul khrims dang skye ba la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: The clear realization of acting is by means of uncontaminated ethics, birth and so on.

original: sdug bsngal mthong na de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong na de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum mo //
translated: When one sees the truth of unsatisfactoriness, there are three realizations.

original: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The realizations of the truths of the origin, etc., are realizations of activity,

original: spong ba dang / mngon sum du byed ba dang / bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba dang / mngon sum du byed ba dang / bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one rejects, realizes, and cultivates.

original: mngon par rtogs pa sems bcu drug par bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa sems bcu drug par bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The sixteen thoughts of the path of insight have been explained.

original: de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig / chos kyi mchog sa gang yin pa sems bcu drug po 'di dag kyang de'i sa pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig / chos kyi mchog sa gang yin pa sems bcu drug po 'di dag kyang de'i sa pa dag go //
translated: The supreme factors are of the same stage as the supreme factors of the stage of the receptivities.

original: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bzod pa dag dang shes pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bzod pa dag dang shes pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the receptivities and the cognitions necessarily of the same stage?

original: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //
analyzed: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //
translated: The receptivities and the cognitions are, respectively,

original: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //
analyzed: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //
translated: the uninterrupted path and the path of liberation.

original: bzod pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam dag yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam dag yin no //
translated: The receptivities are the uninterrupted paths, because they cut off the possession of the defilements.

original: shes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dag yin no //
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dag yin no //
translated: The cognitions are paths of liberation, because they are produced with the acquisition of the separation from the possession of the defilements.

original: ci sems bcu drug po thams cad bden pa mthong ba'i lam yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems bcu drug po thams cad bden pa mthong ba'i lam yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all sixteen thoughts the path of insight into the truths?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: 'on kyang de las skad cig bco lnga ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las skad cig bco lnga ni /
translated: But fifteen moments

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: are the path of insight, because one sees what has not been seen.

original: sems bcu drug pa la ni sngon ma mthong ba blta bar bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: sems bcu drug pa la ni sngon ma mthong ba blta bar bya ba med kyi /
translated: The sixteenth moment is not the path of insight, because what has not been seen is not what is to be seen.

original: ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba goms par byed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam kho na'o //
translated: It is the path of cultivation, because one cultivates that which has been seen.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ji ltar skye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ji ltar skye ba bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained how the path of insight and the path of cultivation arise.

original: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must now explain how the noble ones are classified according to the path in which they are found.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi skad cig ma bco lngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi skad cig ma bco lngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: The fifteen moments of the path of insight that have been explained

original: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //
analyzed: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //
translated: Those of sharp and dull faculties

original: dad dang chos kyi rjes 'brang ga / yin par @187b rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dad dang chos kyi rjes 'brang ga / yin par @187b rig par bya ba ste /
translated: are to be known as followers of faith and followers of reality.

original: dbang po rtul po ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Those of dull faculties are followers of faith.

original: dbang po rnon po ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculties are followers of reality.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are also

original: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs nas //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs nas //
translated: those who have not abandoned that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa //
translated: and have entered the first result.

original: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba de dag kho na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhig yin na de gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba de dag kho na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhig yin na de gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are followers of faith and followers of reality who possess all the bonds are called “those who have entered the result of stream entry.”

original: rnam lnga'i bar bcom /
analyzed: rnam lnga'i bar bcom /
translated: Those who have abandoned up to five types

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgoms te spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs na'o //🔽gnyis pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgoms te spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs na'o // gnyis pa la /
translated: by the mundane path, who have abandoned up to five types of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //
analyzed: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //
translated: Those who have abandoned up to the ninth🔽stage of the desire realm are abiders in the result of once return.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis kyi de yan chad rnam pa drug gam bdun nam brgyad gcig sngon spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag tu brjod de /🔽'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis kyi de yan chad rnam pa drug gam bdun nam brgyad gcig sngon spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag tu brjod de / 'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las //
translated: When they abandon six, seven, or eight types of the summit of existence, they are called “those who enter the result of once-returner.”

original: chags bral gsum pa la zhugs pa //
analyzed: chags bral gsum pa la zhugs pa //
translated: Those who enter the third freedom from attachment🔽are enterers to the result of nonreturn.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams sam gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams sam gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin no //
translated: If they are free from attachment to the desire realm or to any level up to the base of nothingness, they are enterers to the result of nonreturn.

original: gang zhig gang la zhugs pa ni //🔽bcu drug pa la de 'bras gnas //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la zhugs pa ni // bcu drug pa la de 'bras gnas //
translated: Those who enter any level🔽are abiders in the result of nonreturn.

original: sems bcu drug pa skyes na 'bras bu gang la zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe 'bras bu de la gnas pa yin no //🔽de tshe dbang po rno rtul dag / dad pas mos dang mthong bas thob //
analyzed: sems bcu drug pa skyes na 'bras bu gang la zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe 'bras bu de la gnas pa yin no // de tshe dbang po rno rtul dag / dad pas mos dang mthong bas thob //
translated: When the sixteenth moment of consciousness arises, they abide in the result of nonreturn.🔽Those of sharp and dull faculties🔽are resolute in faith and obtainers by insight.

original: de'i tshe dbang po rtul po ni dad pas mos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po rtul po ni dad pas mos pa'o //
translated: At that time, those of dull faculties are resolute in faith.

original: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa'o //🔽ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya la /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa'o // ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya la /
translated: Those of sharp faculties are called “those who obtain through view.”

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one who has abandoned five categories is called a “stream-enterer” when he obtains the sixteenth moment of cognition, but is not called “one who is entering into the fruit of once-returner”?

original: gang gi phyir /🔽'bras thob 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / 'bras thob 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
translated: Because🔽one who has obtained the fruit does not obtain🔽the path of a higher fruit.

original: lam thob med pa de yi phyir //🔽'bras gnas khyad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lam thob med pa de yi phyir // 'bras gnas khyad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: One who does not strive for the higher fruit

original: mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin //
analyzed: mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin //
translated: of a higher stage is not a candidate.

original: 'bras bu thob na 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi thob ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob na 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi thob ste /
translated: One who has obtained a fruit does not obtain the path of a higher fruit.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu la gnas ba ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mi brtson pa de srid du zhugs pha zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu la gnas ba ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mi brtson pa de srid du zhugs pha zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as one who abides in a fruit does not strive for the higher fruit, he is not called a candidate for the higher fruit.🔽This is the way to determine the candidates for the fruit of once-returner and nonreturner.

original: re zhig phal cher las dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges par 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa de ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig phal cher las dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges par 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa de ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: The candidates for the fruit of stream-enterer and once-returner who are freed from attachment to the desire realm are of two types:🔽those who enter by way of the mundane path and those who enter by way of the supramundane path.

original: mthar gyis 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must now explain the gradual entry into the formless realms.

original: de'i phyir re zhig 'di ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu bstan ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig 'di ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'o // ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu bstan ba de bzhin du /
translated: First, we must establish the following.🔽Just as the defilements of the desire realm are taught to be nine in number,

original: sa dang sa na nyes rnam dgu //
analyzed: sa dang sa na nyes rnam dgu //
translated: so too are the faults in each of the stages,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the peak of existence.

original: nyes pa rnams ji ltar /🔽de bzhin @188a * //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ji ltar / de bzhin @188a * //
translated: How are they faults?

original: du ni yon tan rnams //
analyzed: du ni yon tan rnams //
translated: The qualities are just like them.

original: sa dang sa na de'i gnyen po bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan yang rnam pa dgu dgu kho na yod do //
analyzed: sa dang sa na de'i gnyen po bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan yang rnam pa dgu dgu kho na yod do //
translated: In each stage, there are nine qualities that are called the uninterrupted path and the path of liberation that are antidotes to those faults.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
translated: Because the small, medium, and great

original: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: are divided into small and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
translated: The small of the small, the small of the medium, and the small of the great.

original: de bzhin du 'bring dang / chen po dag gi dbye ba yang gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bring dang / chen po dag gi dbye ba yang gsum gsum mo //
translated: Similarly, the medium and the great are each divided into three.

original: de la lam chung ngu'i chung ngus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong la /
analyzed: de la lam chung ngu'i chung ngus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong la /
translated: The weak-weak path abandons the strong-strong affliction.

original: de bzhin du chen po'i chen pos ni chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar ro //🔽de ltar nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad du /
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po'i chen pos ni chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar ro // de ltar nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad du /
translated: Similarly, the strong-strong path abandons the weak-weak affliction.

original: 'bras gnas bsgom spang bya ma zad //🔽re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa //
analyzed: 'bras gnas bsgom spang bya ma zad // re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa //
translated: Thus, all nine degrees of affliction are abandoned by the nine degrees of the path.

original: gang zhig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la /
translated: One abiding in the result who has not abandoned objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation is a stream enterer.

original: tshe bdun gyi bar du skye ba na lan bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tshe bdun gyi bar du skye ba na lan bdun pa'o //
translated: One who is born seven times is a seven times at most.

original: re ltar thogs na lan bdun zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal pa'o //
analyzed: re ltar thogs na lan bdun zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal pa'o //
translated: One who is born seven times at most is the worst of all.

original: de ni de las gzhan par skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang / srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan par skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang / srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed la /
translated: He takes rebirth seven times in the desire realm, seven times in the intermediate existence and seven times among humans.

original: de bzhin du lha rnams kyi nang du yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha rnams kyi nang du yang ste /
translated: Similarly, he takes rebirth seven times among the gods.

original: bdun tshan du 'dra ba'i mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdun tshan du 'dra ba'i mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The one who is capable of being reborn at the most seven times is called a saptakṛtvaḥparama.

original: re zhig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma zad pa ni de lta bu yin no //🔽rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba ;
analyzed: re zhig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma zad pa ni de lta bu yin no // rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba ;
translated: This is the case when the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation have not been completely abandoned.

original: / tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: / tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
translated: The one who is freed from three or four categories is born into two or three families.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig gam gnyis su lus pa'i phyir rigs nas rigs su skye pa zhes bya'o //🔽rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig gam gnyis su lus pa'i phyir rigs nas rigs su skye pa zhes bya'o // rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa //
translated: The stream-enterer who has abandoned three or four categories of defilements of the realm of desire is called a family-to-family.

original: gnyis pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //
translated: The one who has abandoned up to five categories is a candidate for the second.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang gis rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs pa yin na de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang gis rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs pa yin na de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The stream-enterer who has abandoned from one up to five categories of defilements is a candidate for the second fruit.

original: rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
translated: The one who has abandoned the sixth category is a once-returner.🔽The one who has abandoned the sixth category of defilements of the realm of desire is a once-returner.

original: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / de ni 'bras bu gnyis ba thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / de ni 'bras bu gnyis ba thob pa yin te /
translated: He obtains the second fruit.

original: lha dag gi nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dag gi nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having gone among the gods, he returns once to the human world.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid /
translated: The perfected being who is an “abider in the fruit” of the once-returner

original: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa //🔽tshe gcig pa bar chad gcig pa dang / gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //
analyzed: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa // tshe gcig pa bar chad gcig pa dang / gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //
translated: is a “one-intervaller” when he has destroyed the seventh or eighth category.

original: rnam pa bdun nam brgyad pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir bar chad gcig pa zhes bya'o //🔽de dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun nam brgyad pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir bar chad gcig pa zhes bya'o // de dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong //
translated: He is a “one-intervaller” because he has abandoned seven or eight categories of defilements, and because he has only one birth remaining.🔽The non-returner is the perfected being who has abandoned the ninth category of defilements of the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir @188b phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir @188b phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a non-returner because, being detached from the realm of desire, he does not return there to be born.

original: de ni bar skyes 'du byed dang // 'du byed med yongs mya ngan 'da' //🔽gong du 'pho ba rnams /
analyzed: de ni bar skyes 'du byed dang // 'du byed med yongs mya ngan 'da' // gong du 'pho ba rnams /
translated: He obtains nirvāṇa either in the intermediate existence, or in the existence at birth, or in the course of this existence, or by going higher.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The non-returner who obtains nirvāṇa in the intermediate existence is one who obtains nirvāṇa in the intermediate existence.🔽The non-returner who obtains nirvāṇa as soon as he is reborn is one who obtains nirvāṇa as soon as he is reborn.🔽The non-returner who obtains nirvāṇa without effort is one who obtains nirvāṇa without effort.🔽The non-returner who obtains nirvāṇa with effort is one who obtains nirvāṇa with effort.🔽The non-returner who goes higher is one who goes higher.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder after merely being born, without dying.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is diligent and the path arises naturally.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana with exertion attains nirvana with exertion and without giving up application after being born.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not diligent and the path does not arise naturally.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par te /
translated: One who attains nirvana without exertion attains nirvana without exertion and without giving up application after being born.🔽Because he is not diligent and the path arises naturally.🔽One who attains nirvana in the intermediate state attains nirvana in the intermediate state after being born.

original: mngon par brtson pa med par lam ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa med par lam ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not diligent and the path does not arise naturally.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba'o //🔽de ni / bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba'o // de ni / bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
translated: Transference upward is not to attain nirvana in the place where one is born but to proceed to a higher level.🔽One who increases absorption goes to Akaniṣṭha.🔽One who increases absorption does not attain nirvana in the first absorption but goes to Akaniṣṭha.

original: de la gang gis bsam gtan spel ba de ni 'og min du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang gis bsam gtan spel ba de ni 'og min du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who increases absorption goes to Akaniṣṭha.

original: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du //🔽'chi 'pho // gang du 'pho ba 'og min gyi mthar thug pa de yang 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /🔽de la 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel nas /🔽bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te bsam gtan gsum pa las yongs su nyams pa las tshangs ris pa dag gi nang du skyes nas sngon gyi goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan bzhi pa spel te /
analyzed: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du // 'chi 'pho // gang du 'pho ba 'og min gyi mthar thug pa de yang 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste / de la 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel nas / bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te bsam gtan gsum pa las yongs su nyams pa las tshangs ris pa dag gi nang du skyes nas sngon gyi goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan bzhi pa spel te /
translated: That is of three types: leaping, half-leaping, and full-leaping.🔽One who increases absorption in this life and then tastes the first absorption and degenerates from the third absorption and is born among the Brahmakāyika gods and then increases the fourth absorption through the power of former training and then dies and is born among the Akaniṣṭha gods is called a leaper.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min pa dag gi nang du skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min pa dag gi nang du skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: One who increases absorption in this life and then tastes the first absorption and degenerates from the third absorption and is born among the Brahmakāyika gods and then increases the fourth absorption through the power of former training and then dies and is born among the Akaniṣṭha gods is called a leaper.

original: de ni bar du mi 'gro bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bar du mi 'gro bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it does not go in between, it is called leaping.

original: phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni de nas gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyel bar nas gnas gzhan 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni de nas gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyel bar nas gnas gzhan 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Leaping over half is when one is born in the pristine abodes and then enters Akaniṣṭha without passing through any other abodes.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni gnas gzhan thams cad du 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni gnas gzhan thams cad du 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Death and transference to all abodes is when one enters Akaniṣṭha after passing through all other abodes.

original: de las / gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro //
analyzed: de las / gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro //
translated: From that, one goes to the peak of existence.

original: gong du 'pho pa bsam gtan ma spel ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho pa bsam gtan ma spel ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not increase their absorptions go to the peak of existence.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ro myang bar byed cing gnas gzhan thams cad du skye la /🔽gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho nar gzugs @189a * //
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ro myang bar byed cing gnas gzhan thams cad du skye la / gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho nar gzugs @189a * //
translated: They experience the taste of meditative attainment, are born in all other abodes,🔽and without entering the pristine abodes, they are born in the formless realm.

original: med par skye ba'i rim gyis srid pa'i rtse mor song ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: med par skye ba'i rim gyis srid pa'i rtse mor song ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: In stages, they go to the peak of existence and attain nirvana.

original: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga yin no //
translated: These are the five nonreturners who go to the realm of form.

original: gzhan ni gzugs med 'gro rnam bzhi //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzugs med 'gro rnam bzhi //
translated: The others go to the formless realm.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa gzugs med par 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa gzugs med par 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The others, i.e., the nonreturners who go to the formless realm, are of four types, with the exception of those who obtain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state.

original: gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' //🔽mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' // mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The others obtain nirvāṇa here.🔽The others, i.e., those who obtain nirvāṇa in this life, obtain nirvāṇa in this very existence in which they have been born as a human.🔽The others, i.e., those who obtain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state, obtain nirvāṇa immediately after their death, without having taken up a new existence.🔽The others, i.e., those who obtain nirvāṇa after being born, obtain nirvāṇa after being born, but without having taken up a second existence.

original: gsum la yang rnam gsum phye nas /🔽gzugs su nyer 'gro dgur bshad do //🔽bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag dang / gong du 'pho ba gsum rnam pa gsum du byas pa 'di lta ste re zhig bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams ni dpe gsum gyis myur ba dang /
analyzed: gsum la yang rnam gsum phye nas / gzugs su nyer 'gro dgur bshad do // bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag dang / gong du 'pho ba gsum rnam pa gsum du byas pa 'di lta ste re zhig bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams ni dpe gsum gyis myur ba dang /
translated: The others, i.e., those who go higher, obtain nirvāṇa after having gone to a higher stage.🔽The first three of these four types of nonreturners are of three types, according to whether they obtain nirvāṇa quickly, not quickly, or after a long time.

original: myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonreturners who obtain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state are of three types, according to whether they obtain nirvāṇa quickly, not quickly, or after a long time.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth are of three types: those who attain nirvana quickly, those who attain nirvana after some time, and those who attain nirvana after long effort.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Those who go upstream are of nine types: those who go upstream with difficulty, those who go upstream without difficulty, those who go upstream with difficulty, those who go upstream without difficulty, those who go upstream with difficulty, those who go upstream without difficulty, those who go upstream with difficulty, those who go upstream without difficulty, and those who go upstream with difficulty.

original: de dag ni khyad par rnams /
analyzed: de dag ni khyad par rnams /
translated: These are the differences.

original: las dbang nyon mongs bye brag las //
analyzed: las dbang nyon mongs bye brag las //
translated: They are due to the differences in karma, afflictions, and faculties.

original: gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las te /
translated: These three and nine types are due to the differences in karma, afflictions, and faculties.

original: re zhig gsum po ni mngon par 'grub pa dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang po chen po dang /🔽'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig gsum po ni mngon par 'grub pa dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang po chen po dang /🔽'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir ro //
translated: The three are due to the accumulation of karma to be experienced in the next life, in a third life, and in subsequent lives, respectively; due to the small, medium, and great engagement in afflictions; and due to great, medium, and small faculties.🔽The nine are due to the differences in karma, afflictions, and faculties.

original: dgu po de dag so sor khyad par de nyid kyi phyir ci rigs par gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni gong ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las so //
analyzed: dgu po de dag so sor khyad par de nyid kyi phyir ci rigs par gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni gong ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las so //
translated: The first two sets of three are differentiated by the distinction of affliction and faculty, as before.

original: gsum tshan tham ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang ngo //
analyzed: gsum tshan tham ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang ngo //
translated: The third set of three is differentiated by the distinction of karma to be experienced in other lives.🔽What are the seven destinations of holy beings?

original: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: They are asserted to be seven,

original: gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar //🔽dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar // dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod //
translated: without differentiating those who proceed higher.

original: dgu po de dag kho na la gong du 'gro ba ma phye bas bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgu po de dag kho na la gong du 'gro ba ma phye bas bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those nine are asserted to be seven without differentiating those who proceed higher.🔽Why are only these seven destinations of holy beings and not others?

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin la slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin la slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: They are called holy because they engage in virtue,🔽because they do not engage in nonvirtue,

original: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / son pa phyir mi 'ong phyir de //
analyzed: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / son pa phyir mi 'ong phyir de //
translated: because they have attained the state of a nonreturner,🔽and because they do not return to samsara.

original: 'di dag ni las dge ba kho na la 'jug gi mi dge ba la ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni las dge ba kho na la 'jug gi mi dge ba la ni mi 'jug go //
translated: They engage in virtue but do not engage in nonvirtue.

original: 'di dag @189b tu son pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: 'di dag @189b tu son pa rnams la yang /
translated: But those who have attained these states

original: phyir mi 'ong ba med pa de'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba med pa de'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin no //
translated: are not nonreturners. Therefore these are the destinies of holy beings.

original: ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang dbye ba 'di yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang dbye ba 'di yod dam zhe na /
translated: Why is this classification of nonreturners not made on the basis of the transformation of life?

original: med de / 'di ltar /
analyzed: med de / 'di ltar /
translated: Because it is not.

original: 'dod par tshe yongs gyur pa'i 'phags //
analyzed: 'dod par tshe yongs gyur pa'i 'phags //
translated: Noble ones who transform their life in the desire realm

original: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med //
analyzed: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med //
translated: do not proceed to other realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni khams gzhan du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni khams gzhan du mi 'gro ste /
translated: Noble ones who transform their life in the desire realm do not proceed to other realms.

original: de nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain the result of nonreturner in that realm and then attain nirvana.

original: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
translated: Those born in higher realms

original: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi sten //
analyzed: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi sten //
translated: do not upgrade their intellectual faculty or die.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni dbang po rnams kyang mi 'pho la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni dbang po rnams kyang mi 'pho la /
translated: Noble ones who transform their life in the desire realm and noble ones born in higher realms do not upgrade their intellectual faculty and do not die.

original: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not retrogress from the stage of the first meditative development.

original: bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
translated: One who has cultivated the meditative development of the meditative concentrations goes to the Highest Heaven.🔽In the above, it is said that one who has cultivated the meditative development of the meditative concentrations goes to the Highest Heaven.

analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de yang dang po nyid du bsam gtan gang spel bar byed ce na /
translated: But which meditative concentration is cultivated first?

original: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang / zag pa med pa dag tu bsres pas spel ma 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang / zag pa med pa dag tu bsres pas spel ma 'grub pa yin no //

original: rgyun chags dang ldan pa la ji srid du skad cig gnyis sbyor ba de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel nas de'i stobs kyis gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang spel bar byed do //
